special-tools.para: The special tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

procedure.title: Fuel Manifold Assembly Pressure Test (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Install plug (1) in main fuel passage.
Install inlet adaptor (3) in fuel inlet nozzle (2) and lock in place using locking clamp (4).
Connect the pressure test kit (PWC60718) to inlet adaptor (3).
Make sure test kit valve selector (6) is in the OFF/TEST position as shown in figure.
Make sure nitrogen regulator (7) is closed, if regulator it is not preset.
Open nitrogen gas tank and adjust regulator to 100 to 150 psi (689.5 to 1034.2 kPa), if regulator is not preset.
Turn valve selector (6) to COMBUSTOR position. Make sure gauge reads 100 to 150 psi (689.5 to 1034.2 kPa).
Turn test kit valve to the OFF /TEST position and turn nitrogen gas tank to OFF.
Monitor manifold pressure for 5 minutes minimum. No pressure drop allowed from manifold pressure gauge.
If pressure drop is noted, investigate source and rectify.
Re-test fuel manifold assembly after rectification.
Turn test kit valve to BLEED OFF position prior to tool removal.
Remove clamp, test adapter, plug and test kit upon completion of test.

general.para: This section provides instructions and limits, required to perform visual bench check/inspection of the Combustion Chamber Outer Case, Combustion Chamber LIner, Fuel Nozzles and Igniter Plugs. These inspection procedures can only be performed during Heavy Maintenance.
It is recommended that a magnifying glass of at least 10X power be used when visually inspecting for damage.
Within the following text, where the term nicks or dents is used, unless otherwise specified, blend repair limits are applicable provided at least 70 percent of original surface remains undamaged.
Parts found unsuitable for further engine running should be replaced. Rejected parts should be returned to Pratt & Whitney Canada for complete inspection and possible repair/refurbishment.

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: Inspect for cracks. No cracks permitted.

Inspect for nicks or dents. Maximum of 15 acceptable to a depth of 0.003 inch (0.08 mm) provided damage is removed to a maximum depth of 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) and separated by a minimum distance of 0.250 inch.
Inspect igniter boss thread for damage. Minor damage may be removed by blending (Ref. 70-00-00 REPAIR).
Check for loose, broken or damaged jacking inserts. Replace as necessary (Ref. 70-00-00 REPAIR).
Check for loose, broken or damaged threaded inserts. Replace as necessary (Ref. 70-00-00 REPAIR).

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: For 25108, the following conditions are acceptable: Plasma coating loss. Non-converging cracks on the combustion liner walls. Cracks around fuel nozzles or igniter bosses that do not extend more than 180 degrees. Cooling ring cracks that do not form a closed pattern. Cracks along the cooling ring seam welds that are less than 6.0 inches (152.4 mm) long. Localized shallow buckling, if there is no evidence of burning. Circular cracks at the non-gas path section of the inner wrapper less than 8 inches (203.2 mm) long if stop drilled. A combination of one circular crack and one axial crack extending to the lip of the liner. Fretting at the contact of the inner wrapper and the HPT air nozzle if it does not exceed 20 percent of wall thickness.

For 25108, the following conditions are acceptable (Ref. Fig. ): Multiple areas of plasma coating loss associated with heavy oxidation, each area 1.0 inch by 1.0 inch (25.4 by 25.4 mm) maximum. On the inner liner only these areas may be associated with multi-pronged cracks less than 0.010 inch (0.254 mm) wide. Non-converging closed cracks on the combustion liner walls up to 0.600 inch (15.24 mm) long maximum provided coating meets limits in step . Cracks around fuel nozzles or igniter bosses that do not extend more than 180 degrees. Cooling ring cracks that do not form a closed pattern. Cracks along the weld joints that have a combined length 6.0 inches (152.4 mm) long maximum. Localized shallow buckling, at the dome area, provided there is no evidence of burning. Circular cracks at the non-gas path section of the inner wrapper 8.0 inches (203.2 mm) long maximum if stop drilled. A combination of one circular crack and one axial crack extending to the lip of the liner. Fretting at the contact of the inner and outer seal diameters if it does not exceed 20 percent of wall thickness and 20 percent of the circumference. Fretting wear at the fuel nozzle bores up to 0.005 inch (0.127 mm) deep maximum. Generalized thumbnail band oxidation and total loss of thumbnails is acceptable provided total circumferential crack is less than 5.0 inch (127 mm). Cracks originating from igniter boss up to 0.400 inch (10.16 mm) long. Cracks originating from fuel nozzle boss up to 0.350 inch (8.89 mm) long. Inner and outer exit duct lips: Non-converging cracking with burning, coating loss and deformation is acceptable over the entire circumference, provided material loss does not exceed 0.030 inch (0.762 mm) wide. Cold rework inner exit duct if necessary to allow installation of first-stage vane assembly. Local burning with material loss up to a maximum axial length of 0.125 inch (3.175 mm) and maximum width of 1.000 inch (25.4 mm).
Burned through holes on combustion liner walls are not acceptable and require repair.

Fretting wear on floating collars: Fretting wear on floating collars is permitted up to an average depth of 0.005 in (0.127 mm) maximum and a local depth of 0.010 in (0.254 mm) maximum on inner diameter. Local fretting wear on antirotation tang and bracket up to 0.100 in. (2.54 mm) is permitted. If exceeded, local weld repair is done.

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: Inspect for cracks. No cracks permitted.
Inspect for fretting of sheath. Acceptable to 50 percent of wall thickness.
Inspect for burning or erosion of nozzle tip. Reject if damage evident on tip inner surface.

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: Inspect the external sheath of each igniter at Dia. A for chafing and wear. Replace igniter if the following limits are exceeded: 0.0115 in. at the deepest point all around 360 degrees. 0.025 in. at deepest point over 0.350 in. circumference.

Inspect end face,View B for: Blockage of air hole. If any air hole is blocked, reject igniter. Reduction in any air hole area. Reject igniter if evident. Erosion of electrodes. Erosion up to 0.118 inch deep is acceptable. Localized erosion of electrodes. Erosion up to 0.125 in. deep is acceptable provided 75 percent of the original surface remains within the 0.118 inch erosion band. If erosion exceeds any of these limits, reject igniter. Erosion of ground electrodes is acceptable up to 0.400 in. diameter. Measure at tip of the inner diameter.

n-para.title: Repair
n-para.para: Information transferred to 70-00-00 REPAIR.

n-para.title: HP Turbine Housing, First and Second-stage HP Turbine Stators (Ref. Fig. )
n-para.para: The HP turbine housing is a cylindrical nickel-alloy forging, machined to accommodate the second-stage (HP) turbine vane ring, and first and second-stage shroud segment assemblies. A flange on the outside diameter supports the housing at Flange E, sandwiched between the combustion chamber outer case and the low pressure turbine module.

The first-stage HP turbine stator assembly comprises 10 individually cast nickel-alloy triple-vane segments held in place by inner and outer machined nickel-alloy shroud rings. The stator assembly is located between the combustion chamber liner exit and the first-stage HP turbine. The vanes ensure that the expanding gases are directed to the HP turbine blades at the proper angle to drive the turbine.

A flange on the front of the outer shroud supports the combustion chamber liner and a circular retaining plate for the vane segments. A circumferential groove on the rear of the outer shroud accommodates an interstage sealing ring, while 30 slots equally spaced around the shroud allow compressor delivery (P3) air to pass through the vanes for cooling. This cooling air passes through the vanes and exits into the gas path through slots in the airfoil leading and trailing edges.
The inner shroud locates the vane segments with lugs and a circumferential groove and is secured to the tangential on board injection nozzle assembly at its inside diameter.

The second-stage HP turbine vane ring consists of an integrally cast nickel-alloy vane ring having 30 vanes. The vanes ensure that the expanding gases are directed to the second-stage HP turbine blades at the optimum angle to drive the turbine. The outer platform has lugs extended radially outwards to locate in slots machined in the shroud housing. The outside diameter has a circumferential groove which accommodates an interstage brush sealing ring.

The interstage baffle assembly, interposed between the first and second-stage HP turbines, is riveted to the second-stage vane ring. The baffle directs secondary cooling air up the front face of the second-stage turbine disk.

Twenty-four shroud segments for the first and second-stage HP turbines are seated in circumferential grooves in the stator housing and are held in position by retaining rings. The shroud segments act as a seal and provide running clearance for the HP turbine blades.

n-para.title: HP Turbine Rotor Balancing Assembly (Ref. Fig. )
n-para.para: The HP turbine rotor balancing assembly consists of a two-stage turbine assembly, held together by a lug and slot arrangement, mounted on the rear end of the balanced HP turbine shaft by means of an internal spline. The assembly is secured on the shaft by a spanner nut, keywasher and retaining ring. The first and second-stage disk and blade assemblies incorporate 45 and 45 nickel-alloy blades, respectively, and each blade is located in a fir-tree serration in the circumference of the turbine disks.

A cover, fitted to the front face of the first-stage disk, directs cooling air from the nozzle near the hub of the disk along the face of the disk, up through the blade roots and into the hollow turbine blades. Additionally, the cover retains the front of the first-stage blades and serves as the rotating portion of two labyrinth air seals. A similar cover, mounted on the rear of the first-stage disk, secures the rear of the blades and serves as the rotating portion of the interstage labyrinth air seal. The blades of the second-stage HP turbine are secured to the disk by a rear cover plate.

Each HP turbine disk incorporates a flange for disk balancing; the front flange is secured by a retaining ring to the first-stage disk, while the rear flange is an integral feature of the second-stage disk. The required number of classified weights and rivets is determined during initial assembly balancing.

n-para.title: LP Turbine Module (Ref. Fig. )
n-para.para: The LP turbine module consists of a three-stage turbine rotor balancing assembly and three stator assemblies with interstage baffles, contained in a nickel-alloy casing. The three stages are numbered with respect to the complete engine, i.e. third, fourth, and fifth-stage.

The LP turbine rotor balancing assembly consists of three nickel-alloy disks, each having fir-tree serrations machined in their outer circumferences. The serrations mount 76, 62 and 68 blades to the third, fourth and fifth-stage disks, respectively. Each blade has an integral tip shroud which forms part of a continuous ring when all blades are assembled to the disk. The blades are each retained in their disk by a rivet. The third and fifth-stage disks are bolted to the fourth-stage disk, which mounts on the LP compressor shaft by means of an internal spline. A balancing rim on the front of the third-stage disk and rear of the fifth-stage disk provides for balancing of the assembly, prior to installation on the shaft.

The third-stage LP turbine stator assembly consists of a 70-vane ring and a concentric nickel-alloy turbine interstage baffle assembly. A circumferential groove on the front of the outer platform accommodates two interstage sealing rings. Eight bosses radially disposed around the circumference contain sleeves which attach the stator assembly to the LP turbine case and locate T4.5 thermocouple probes in the gas path. The stator assembly mounts on the first-stage LP turbine outer air seal with lugs at the rear of its outer platform. An interstage baffle riveted to the front of the inner platform prevents dissipation of gas heat to the disk faces and incorporates a honeycomb stator air seal at its inner diameter.

The fourth-stage turbine assembly comprises 71 vanes and is supported at the rear outer platform by the LP case. A circumferential groove at the front accommodates two sealing rings which close the gap between the stator outer platform and the LP case. An interstage baffle with a honeycomb stator air seal at its inner diameter is riveted to the front of the inner platform.

The fifth-stage stator assembly has 74 vanes and fits into the rear of the fourth-stage LP turbine outer air seal with lugs at the front of its outer platform. The rear of the stator assembly has locating lugs on the outer platform which locate in slots in the rear flange of the LP case (Flange F). An interstage baffle/air seal is riveted to the front of the inner platform.

The LP turbine case is a bell shaped cast assembly with front and rear flanges. The front flange is bolted to the rear of the combustion chamber outer case (Flange E) and the rear flange is bolted to the turbine exhaust case (Flange F). Eight bosses, radially disposed around the front end of the case, provide mounting for the T4.5 thermocouple probes. A slotted integral land on the inside of the case provides a mount for the second-stage stator assembly. The fifth-stage stator assembly and turbine outer air seal ring mount on the aft end of the case (Flange F) with slots and lugs. The three turbine outer air seal rings each have a honeycomb air seal ribbon brazed to its inside diameter. The air seals are machined to lock in place with the stator assemblies.

n-para.title: Turbine Exhaust Case and No. 4 Bearing Housing (Ref. Fig. )
n-para.para: The turbine exhaust case assembly comprises concentric inner and outer weldments, supported by 12 equally spaced hollow struts. The forward outer flange of the exhaust case bolts to the rear flange of the LP turbine case, forming Flange F.

The center weldment of the case houses the No. 4 bearing compartment as well as features for accepting pressure and scavenge oil delivery and two N1 speed probes. The outer weldment of the case incorporates an integral exhaust mixer.

A strut at the 4 o'clock position provides a passage for the No. 4 bearing pressure oil tube and two tubes housing the N1 speed probe cables. The pressure oil tube leads to an internal oil strainer located at the center of the duct. The N1 speed probe cables bolt to pads on the rear face of the duct. A strut at the 6 o'clock position provides passage for the emergency fuel shutoff control rod, while the strut at the 8 o'clock position houses the internal No. 4 bearing scavenge oil line. The scavenge and pressure oil tubes are welded in place and further secured with loop clamps and two mounting brackets. External tubes mounted on each side of the duct connect with engine external pressure and scavenge oil delivery tubes. Bosses at the bottom of the duct support a triangular mounting bracket for the bellcrank to which the emergency fuel shutoff control rod is linked.

The forward inside flange of the exhaust duct supports a heatshield which provides thermal protection to the No. 4 bearing compartment. A flange on the rear inside diameter of the duct provides a mounting location for a removable exhaust duct cone.

The exhaust duct center bore supports the No. 4 roller bearing, which is sealed at the front by a labyrinth air seal and a carbon seal. The exhaust duct itself houses the No.4 bearing outer race. The rear of the compartment is sealed by an integral cover which houses an oil jet strainer for pressure oil, a scavenge oil outlet, two N1 speed probes and the mechanical fuel shutoff trigger mechanism.

The emergency fuel shutoff control linkage in the rear of the exhaust case is part of the engine fuel shutoff system. It comprises a contact pin, installed an established dimension away from the LP turbine shaft, a lever, a control rod and a bellcrank. If the LP turbine shaft makes contact with the pin, the linkage and bellcrank are designed to actuate, and pull the overspeed linkage cable secured to the bellcrank (Ref. 73-10-05).

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. , and )

figure.title: HP Turbine Module and Related Parts - Removal

procedure.step: Measure the second-stage HP turbine disk radial tip clearance (RTC) at four locations equally spaced around shroud housing. Record as Dim. B.

Measure the second-stage HP turbine disk RTC : Place four equal thicknesses of the shim material at four locations equally spaced between the shroud housing and the HPT disk. Increase thickness of the shim material at each location until a snug fit is obtained. Measure the RTC. The maximum RTC for re-installation is 0.042 inch with 0.004 inch runout.

Locate the scallop in the stubshaft adjacent to the retaining nut and mark a line, with an approved marker, on the HP turbine rear cover (4, Fig. ) in line with the scallop center line. This line marking will be used during the assembly of the HP turbine disk to return the rotating assemblies to the original balanced position, i.e. in line with the scallop on the stubshaft.

Remove the
retaining ring (1) C33RR20-01 1 and the
keywasher (2) C33RW03-02 1 .

Soak the threads of the HP turbine retaining nut and compressor rotor stubshaft with penetrating oil (PWC05-298). Rotate the turbine several times, to allow the oil to penetrate the thread. Let oil soak for 30 minutes before trying to loosen nut.
Heat nut with a suitable heatgun for 30 minutes.
Install the support (PWC60719) on flange E with three bolts.
Install the socket (PWC60434) on the HP turbine cover and the adapter (PWC60435) over the socket and engage the anti-rotation scallop.

DO NOT EXCEED 1200 lb.ft. (1627 Nm) WHILE LOOSENING NUT.Install the anti-rotation adapter (PWC40781) and wrench (PWC41050) on socket and loosen the
retaining nut (3) C33RN05-02 1 .

figure.title: HP Turbine Module - Installation of Drilling Fixture

procedure.step:
If the HPT retaining nut will not loosen, remove the adapter (PWC60435), the socket (PWC60434) and the support (PWC60719), and proceed as follows with the drilling fixture (PWC60731): Install the body (1, Fig. ) on the HPT shaft and engage the locator (2) into any slot in nut. Lock locator with screw. Install the nut (3) on the end of the LP shaft and tighten handtight against body (1). Loosen the stopper (7) on drill bit (6). Install the setting gage on drill bit, in front of the stopper (7).
DO NOT USE HOLE IN LINE WITH EITHER OF TWO DIMPLES IN HPT NUT.Put the drill bit (6) into one of the five bushed holes. Slide bit forward until point of drill contacts the HPT nut. Slide the stopper (7) against the surface of the setting gage and tighten the screws in the stopper (7). Remove the drill bit and the setting gage. Remove the setting gage from the drill bit. Install the collar (5) on the nut (3) and the drill bit (6). Tighten collar screw (4) against nut (3). Install drill bit into suitable power drill. Drill a minimum of 5 to a maximum of 10 holes by relocating body (1), collar (5) and drill bit (6). Lubricant is not required.
Remove the tools and the retaining nut.

Locate the scallop in the stubshaft and mark a reference line on the
HP turbine rear cover (4) C33RC28-03 1 in line with the scallop. Use an approved marker to mark the line.
Install adapter (6, Fig. ) (PWC71392), cylinder (7) (PWC89837), pad (4) (PWC61823) and puller (5) (PWC60418).
HANDLE COVER WITH CARE. NO DAMAGE IS ALLOWED.Connect pump (PWC37807) to cylinder, and remove the HP turbine cover (4, Fig. ).
Remove disassembly tools.

Locate the scallop in the stubshaft and mark a line on the
second-stage HP turbine disk (5) C33RD09A03 1 in line with the scallop center line on the stubshaft. Use an approved marker to mark the line. This line marking will be used during the assembly of the HP turbines to return the rotating assemblies to the original balanced position, i.e. in line with the scallop on the stubshaft.

Remove the second-stage shroud segment
retaining ring (11) C33NR20-06 1 .
Install reaction pad (4, Fig. ) (PWC61823).
Install split body of puller (5) (PWC60415) over lip of second-stage turbine disk (5, Fig. ).
Install sleeve of puller over split-body.

Install lifting fixture (2) (PWC60623) to HP turbine module as follows: Fold back safety arms (3) away from the engine. Move shroud housing pads towards center of tool. Adjust disk pad approximately same height as the housing pads. Carefully install lifting fixture (2) (PWC60623) to engine to avoid any contact with turbine blades. Engage shroud pads in the second-stage shroud retaining ring groove as shown. Disk pad may be adjusted if required. Make sure housing pads engage properly and do not contact second-stage turbine blades. Adjust pads as required.
Install lifting eye (PWC32514) and lifting arm (1).
Support fixture (2) (PWC60623) with engine hoist or chain block.
Screw cylinder (7) (PWC89837) into adapter (6) (PWC71392).
Install adapter (6) (PWC71392) on end of puller. Make sure lock of adapter aligns with the word “LOCK” on puller.
Attach pump (PWC37807) to cylinder (7) (PWC89837).

MAKE SURE FIRST-STAGE HP TURBINE DISK DOES NOT FALL FROM ASSEMBLY.Apply pump pressure to puller and slowly remove HP turbine module. When the front face of the
HP first-stage turbine disk (7) C33RD09A01 1 , (Fig. ) is accessible, move the safety arms of the lifting fixture in position and install pin.
Carefully lower turbine assembly or assemblies onto fixture (PWC60440).

Remove
seal ring (8) C33NS06-09 1 , (Fig. ) from first-stage HP turbine vane.
Install protector (PWC43250) over shaft.

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: If the first-stage HP turbine assembly remains in the engine after the second-stage HP turbine assembly is removed, proceed as follows: Install adapter (PWC40601) (4) in compressor stubshaft. Install puller (5) (PWC60818) on first-stage HP turbine. Install adapter (3) (PWC71392) in compressor stubshaft. Install cylinder (2) (PWC89837) and pump (1) (PWC37807). Remove first-stage HP turbine and place it on the bench.

figure.title: HP Turbine - Separation of Turbine from Shroud Housing

procedure.title: Separation of Turbine from Shroud Housing (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Measure the first-stage HP turbine disk radial tip clearance: Place four equal thicknesses of shim material at four locations equally spaced between shroud housing and the HPT disk. Increase thickness of shim material at each location until a snug fit is obtained. Measure RTC. Maximum RTC for re-installation is 0.036 inch with 0.004 inch runout.
Put holding fixture (7) (PWC60440) on bench, push two holding arms in to center of fixture, and put HP turbines and housing assembly on holding fixture.

Mark a line on the first-stage HP turbine disk in line with the marking on the second-stage HP turbine disk done on the previous operation. Use an approved marker to mark the line. This line marking will be used during the assembly of the HP turbines to return the rotating assemblies to the original balanced position, i.e. in line with the scallop on the stub shaft.
Install reaction pad (2) (PWC61823), spacer (4) (PWC60398), puller (3) (PWC60415), adapter (8) (PWC71392) and cylinder (1) (PWC89837).
DO NOT PUMP ON PULLER MORE THAN NECESSARY TO BREAK THE FIT.Connect pump (PWC37807) to cylinder and apply pressure to disengage the two disks.

Install retainer (PWC60464) and remove
second-stage HP turbine disk assembly (5) C33RD09A03 1 .
Remove HP turbine housing.

Push holding arms into the center of the holding fixture, until two clamps disengage from
first-stage HP turbine (6) C33RD09A01 1 .
Remove first-stage HP turbine (6) from holding fixture.
Place the removed parts in separate containers.

n-para.title: HP Turbine Housing and Second-stage Turbine Stator

procedure.title: Disassembly (Ref. Fig. )

figure.title: HP Turbine Housing and Second-stage Turbine Stator - Disassembly

procedure.note: The HP turbine housing and second-stage turbine stator should be inspected as an assembly and therefore does not need to be disassembled. However, if damage is noted, disassemble as required.
procedure.step:
Remove shroud
retaining ring (11) C33NR20-07 1 .

Remove No. 1
shroud segment (9) C33NS27-04 18 from
turbine housing (5) C33NH05A07 1 by lifting segment up to disengage the locking feature.
Pull segment into center of turbine housing.

Remove remaining segments (9) and
seals (10) C33NS06-14 18 .

Remove
retaining ring (8) C33NR20-06 1 .

Remove
second-stage vane assembly (7) C33NV02A06 q and
piston seal (6) C33NS06-12 1 .

Remove 24
first-stage shroud segments (3) C33NS27-01 24 and 24
seals (2) C33NS06-13 24 .

Remove
seal (1) C33NS06-09 1 .

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.note: The first-stage HPT vane can be removed at this time to allow access to the combustion chamber liner for inspection purposes. The vane can also be removed with the combustion chamber case assembly (Ref. 72-40-01).
The HPT vane ring should be inspected as an assembly. Disassembly is only required if vane segments require replacement.
procedure.step: Put an index mark, with an approved marker, at 12 o'clock position across both bolting flanges of the first-stage HPT vane.

25108: Remove 24
bolts (3) B24NB20-03 24 and 24
bolts (1) C33NB20-02 24 that hold the
vane assembly (4) C33NV02A03 1 to the
combustion chamber outer case (2) B22NC05A01 1 . Remove HPT vane assembly with puller (PWC61813).

25108: Remove 24 bolts
(1) C33NB20-02 24 and
(3) B24NB20-03 24 . Remove
HPT vane assembly (4) C33NV02A03 1 and
support assembly (5) C33NS65A03 1 with puller (PWC61813).
Install three slave nuts and bolts (3) to fasten vane assembly together.

key.def: HP Turbine Stator Front Inner Support (25211)

procedure.title: Disassembly (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove
bolts (5) C33NB20-04 20 and
nuts (4) C33NN05-05 20 if installed (Ref. Section B-B).

Number all
vane segments (2) C33NV02A07 10 (Ref. View C), with an approved marker, from 12 o'clock counterclockwise.
Install and fasten first-stage HP turbine vane assembly (2) on base (12).
Install drift (11) on first-stage HP turbine vane assembly (2).
Install cylinder (10) to drift (11) and pump (PWC37807) to cylinder.
Put some dry ice in the cavity area on the first-stage HP turbine vane assembly (2) and slowly apply 1000 psi pressure on the drift (11).

Remove
HP turbine disk air nozzle assembly (3) C33NN04A01 1 .

25211: Gently tap the
HP turbine stator front inner support (13) C33NS65-15 1 with a soft faced hammer to remove from the HP turbine disk air nozzle assembly (3).

Remove vane segments (2) from fixture, turn vane over and remove
HP turbine stator inner support (6) C33NS65-04 1 with suitable soft faced hammer. If the HP turbine stator inner support (6) cannot be removed with suitable soft faced hammer, then the inner shroud removal fixture (PWC61790) may be used.

Install
HP Turbine vane outer shroud (1) C33NS27-05 1 on base (PWC61034).

Remove vane segments (2),
inner air seals (7) C33NS06-19 10 and
outer air seals (8) C33NS06-04 10 .

Remove
air seal (9) C33NS06-06 1 (Ref. Detail A).

key.def: First Stage HP Turbine Vane Assembly
HP Turbine Disk Air Nozzle Assembly (25104/25211)
HP Turbine Stator Rear Inner Support (25211)
HP Turbine Disk Air Nozzle Assembly (25211)
HP Turbine Stator Front Inner Support (25211)

procedure.title: Assembly (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Identify the 12 o'clock position of the outer shroud by applying a temporary "X" mark on the lug adjacent to the anti-rotation slot with an approved marker (PWC05-018A).

PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Put
HP turbine vane outer shroud (1) C33NS27A02 1 in the oven at 177 to 204°C (350 - 400°F) for 15 to 30 minutes.

Put
air seal (9) C33NS06-06 1 in freezer at -40°C (-40°F) for 15 to 30 minutes.
Install air seal (9) on HP turbine vane outer shroud assembly (1), as shown (Ref. Detail A).

MAKE SURE VANE ASSEMBLIES ARE THE SAME CLASS AND LOCATED IN THE SAME POSITION AS THOSE REMOVED. Install 10
vane assemblies (2) C33NV02A03 1 without the seals
(7) C33NS06-19 10 and
(8) C33NS06-04 10 starting with vane No. 1 in line with the index mark at the 12 o'clock position.
Install the remaining nine numbered vane assemblies in consecutive order, counterclockwise direction.
Keep a zero gap setting on all the HP turbine vane assemblies except between segments No. 5 and No. 6, as shown.
Measure the gap by measuring the gap between vane assemblies No. 5 and No. 6.
The minimum gap permissible is 0.110 inch (2.79 mm).
Remove all the vane assemblies from the outer shroud.
Install 10 vane outer air seals (8) and 10 vane inner air seals (7) in first-stage HPT vane assemblies (2) (Ref. View C). Hold air seals in place with synthetic grease (PWC06-015).

Identify the offset holes on the
turbine disk air nozzle (3) C33NN04A01 1 and
inner support (6) C33NS65-04 1 by marking an "X" adjacent to the offset holes with an approved marker (PWC05-18A). Due to the minimal offset distance, the offset hole on the air nozzle is not readily visible and can only be determined with a suitable measuring device. The offset hole on the inner support is a smaller diameter than the other twenty-three holes and has an electro-etched "X" adjacent to the hole.

MAKE SURE VANE ASSEMBLIES ARE THE SAME CLASS AND LOCATED IN THE SAME POSITION AS THOSE REMOVED. Install No. 1 segment in the outer shroud (1) and align the vane lug with the shroud slot in line with the index mark.
Install vane segments on each side of No. 1 segment seals. No gap between each segment until all segments are in and a gap remains at the bottom as shown.

Engage seals at gap and move outward until correctly seated in outer shroud. Make sure that seals are correctly installed between each vane segment by slightly separating vanes one at a time and confirming seals are properly engaged and have not been damaged.
DO NOT FORCE VANE SEGMENTS TOGETHER. DAMAGE TO THE AIR SEAL COULD RESULT.Install 0.011 to 0.023 inch (0.28 - 0.58 mm) shim between each vane segment to keep gap during assembly.
PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Put vane assembly (2) in oven at 177 to 204°C (350 - 400°F) for 15 to 20 minutes.

25104: Identify offset holes for
turbine disk air nozzle (3) C33NN04A01 1 and and
HP turbine stator inner support (6) C33NS65-04 1 with temporary "X" mark with an approved marker (PWC05-018A). Put HP turbine stator inner support (6) on base (11) and align the offset hole on guide pin, as shown (Ref. Fig. ). Put the turbine disk air nozzle (3) in freezer at -40°C (-40°F) for 15 to 30 minutes.
USE HEAT RESISTANT GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS.Remove the HP turbine vane assembly from the oven and align the index mark "X" of the HP turbine vane outer shroud with the guide pin on the base (11).
MAKE SURE THAT THE CHAMFERS OF VANE AND INNER SHROUDS ARE ALIGNED.Install the HP turbine vane assembly on HP turbine stator inner support (6) and align lugs into the slots. A gap is allowed between the inner shroud and vane, as shown in Figure .
PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY. MAKE SURE HP TURBINE DISK AIR NOZZLE ASSEMBLY IS SEATED EVENLY ON HP TURBINE VANE ASSEMBLY.Remove turbine disk air nozzle (3) from the freezer, align "X" mark (offset hole) and install with drift (10) and hydraulic cylinder (PWC89837) on to
HP turbine vane shroud assembly (1) C33NS27A02 1 .

MAKE SURE AIR NOZZLE IS SEATED EVENLY ON THE VANE ASSEMBLY.25104/25211: Put assembly fixture (12) on a clean bench. Identify offset hole of
HP turbine stator inner support (13) C33NS65-15 1 and
HP turbine disk air nozzle assembly (14) C33NN04A01 1 with an approved marker (PWC05-18A). Install HP turbine stator inner support (13) on the assembly fixture (12) and align offset hole with guide pin. Put the HP turbine disk air nozzle assembly (14) in a freezer at -40°C (-40°F) for 15 to 30 minutes.
PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Remove the HP turbine vane assembly from the oven. Align the temporary "X" mark on the
vane outer shroud assembly (1) C33NS27A02 1 with the temporary "X" mark on the inner support (13).
MAKE SURE THAT THE CHAMFERS OF THE HP TURBINE VANE ASSEMBLY AND THE HP TURBINE STATOR INNER SUPPORT ARE ALIGNED.Align the lugs of HP turbine vane assembly (1) into the slots of HP turbine stator inner support (13). Install the HP turbine vane assembly (1) on the HP turbine stator inner support (13) with drift (10), hydraulic cylinder (PWC89837) and hydraulic pump (PWC37807). A gap is permitted between the HP turbine vane assembly (1) and the HP turbine stator inner support (13).
PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Remove the HP turbine disk air nozzle assembly (14) from the freezer. Align the "X" mark with the guide pin.
MAKE SURE HP TURBINE DISK AIR NOZZLE ASSEMBLY IS SEATED EVENLY ON HP TURBINE VANE ASSEMBLY.Install HP turbine disk air nozzle assembly (14) on to HP turbine vane assembly (1) with drift (10), hydraulic cylinder (PWC89837) and hydraulic pump (PWC37807).

25211: Put assembly fixture (12) on a clean bench. Identify offset hole of
HP turbine stator rear inner support (15) C33NS65-04 1 with an approved marker (PWC05-18A). Install HP turbine stator rear inner support (15) on assembly fixture (12) and align offset hole with guide pin. Put
HP turbine disk air nozzle (17) C33NN04A01 1 on dry ice for 15 to 30 minutes.
PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Remove the HP turbine vane assembly from the oven. Align the temporary "X" mark on the
vane outer shroud assembly (1) C33NS27A02 1 with the temporary "X" mark on the HP turbine stator rear inner support (15).
MAKE SURE THAT THE CHAMFERS OF THE HP TURBINE VANE ASSEMBLY AND THE HP TURBINE STATOR REAR INNER SUPPORT ARE ALIGNED.Align the lugs of HP turbine vane assembly (1) into the slots of HP turbine stator rear inner support (15). Install the HP turbine vane assembly (1) on the HP turbine stator inner support (15) with drift (19), hydraulic cylinder (PWC89837) and hydraulic pump (PWC37807). A gap is permitted between the HP turbine vane assembly (1) and the HP turbine stator rear inner support (15). Apply 400 to 500 psi pressure and keep this pressure until assembly reaches room temperature. Put base (16) on a clean bench. Put the HP turbine vane assembly (1) in oven preheated at 177 to 204°C (350 - 400°F) for 15 to 20 minutes.
PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Remove HP turbine disk air nozzle (17) from dry ice. Install HP turbine disk air nozzle (17) on base (16) and align offset hole with guide pin.
MAKE SURE THAT THE CHAMFER EDGE OF THE HP TURBINE STATOR FRONT INNER SUPPORT IS FACING DOWN WHILE INSTALLING. MAKE SURE THAT THE LUGS ARE ENGAGED BEFORE INSTALLING HP TURBINE VANE ASSEMBLY.Install the
HP turbine stator front inner support (18) C33NS65-15 1 on the HP turbine disk air nozzle (17) and align the lugs.
PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Remove the HP turbine vane assembly from the oven. Align the temporary "X" mark on the HP turbine disk air nozzle (17) with the temporary "X" mark on the HP turbine rear inner support (15).
MAKE SURE VANE IS SEATED EVENLY.Align the lugs of HP turbine vane assembly into the slots of HP turbine disk air nozzle (17). Install the HP turbine vane assembly on the HP turbine disk air nozzle (17) with drift (19), hydraulic cylinder (PWC89837) and hydraulic pump (PWC37807).
Apply 1800 to 2000 psi (12,410.5 - 13,789.5 kPa) pressure and keep pressure until assembly reaches room temperature.

Install three equally spaced slave
bolts (5) C33NB20-04 20 and
nuts (4) C33NN05-05 20 .
Torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in. (5.5 - 6 Nm).
Install shims at 10 places at location G. Shim thickness ranges from 0.011 to 0.023 inch (0.28 - 0.58 mm).

GAP MUST BE 0.011 INCH (0.28 MM) MINIMUM TO 0.023 INCH (0.58 MM) MAXIMUM WHEN CHECKED SIMULTANEOUSLY.Measure gaps at locations G between HP turbine vane segments at 10 places with shim stock. Check minimum and maximum gap.
Remove all shims after checking the gaps.

Examine the alignment of the HPT vane cooling passage relative to the large holes in the HPT vane shroud vane. Make sure there is no misalignment with the HPT outer shroud which could cause partial occlusion of the airfoil cooling passage way.

Do a check of the vane assembly flow area (F&C REF. NO. 1851) if a facility is available to perform this check. To recover engine performance loss due to compressor deterioration, a flow area lower than 11.60 sq. in. is acceptable, providing the engine does not surge during handling test.

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Install 2 alignment pins (1) (PWC64241-3) at the
turbine disk air nozzle support location (2) C33NN04A01 1 . Do not use the offset hole at the TDC location.
Install 2 alignment pins (1) at the combustion liner location.
Install the heating adapter (PWC61423).

Install the
vane (3) C33NV02A07 1 on the adapter.
Set the temperature control on the controller (PWC60136) to 400°F (204°C).
Set the selector switch 'TOOL/PLATEN' to PLATEN.
Set the controller power switch to ON.
Set the timer to 20 minutes.
Press HEATER START and TIMER START.
At sound of timer alarm select RESET.
Set controller power switch to OFF.
25108: Install vane assembly with X mark at 12 o' clock and offset hole(s) aligned (F&C REF. NO. 1386).

25108: Install
support assembly (6) C33NS65A03 1 on combustion liner. Install two alignment pins (1) at the support assembly (6). Install
first stage vane ring (3) C33NV02A07 1 on support assembly (6) with X mark at 12 o' clock and offset hole(s) aligned (F&C REF. NO. 1386).
Make sure the assembly is installed within 30 seconds of removal from adapter.
Remove guide pins (1).

WEAR PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING ANTI-SEIZE COMPOUND.Coat all
bolt (4) B24NB20-03 24 threads with anti-seize compound (PWC06-009).
Install 24 bolts (4). Tighten 43 to 47 lb.in. (4.8-5.3 Nm).

Install 24
bolts (5) C33NB20-02 24 . Tighten 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Allow assembly (3) to cool to room temperature and tighten bolts (4), 43 to 47 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

n-para.title: No. 3 Bearing Rear Cover and Rotor Air Seal

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.note: If there is no evidence of oil leaks or obvious damage, removal of the No. 3 bearing cover is not required. If damage is evident or air/oil seal related problems have been experienced, proceed with these instructions.

figure.title: No. 3 Bearing Cover and HP Turbine Rotor Air Seal - Removal/Installation of

key.def: Snap Washer (Ref. part of Carbon Seal Assembly)

procedure.step:
Remove
HP turbine air seal (14) C33RS06-26 1 together with the
spacer (15) C33RS33-01 1 (if spacer has not been removed yet) with puller (PWC60177).
Remove retaining ring (7).
Remove HP turbine rotor brush seal (8) with puller (PWC61820).

Remove six
bolts (9) F50LB20-39 6 fastening bearing cover to gas generator/diffuser case (1).

Remove
No. 3 bearing rear cover (10) F50LC28A01 1 with puller (PWC43209).

Inspect
carbon seal (6) B24NS05-02 1 for damage (Ref. INSPECTION/CHECK). If no damage is present, do not remove carbon seal from rear cover assembly.

If damage is found proceed as follows: Remove
retaining ring (5) B24NR20-02 1 .
HANDLE CARBON SEAL WITH CARE. ROUGH HANDLING CAN CAUSE DAMAGE OR RESULT IN AN OUT OF ROUND CONDITION.Remove carbon seal (6) with puller (PWC40323).

procedure.title: Installation of Carbon Seal in No. 3 Bearing Rear Cover (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Put
No. 3 bearing rear cover assembly (10) F50LC28A01 1 in oven preheated to 350 to 400°F (177-204°C) for 15 to 30 minutes.

Place
carbon seal (6) B24NS05-02 1 in freezer at -40°F (-40°C) for 15 to 30 minutes.
Put support base (PWC43215) on arbor press.
Remove No. 3 bearing rear cover (10) from oven and place it on support base (PWC43215).

HANDLE CARBON SEAL WITH CARE. ROUGH HANDLING CAN CAUSE DAMAGE OR RESULT IN AN OUT OF ROUND CONDITION. DO NOT CONTAMINATE CARBON SEAL WITH LOCKING COMPOUND (PWC09-002).Remove carbon seal (6) from freezer and apply locking compound (PWC09-002) in area B.

Install carbon seal assembly in rear cover assembly (10) with snap washer (11) down, with drift (PWC43206). Make sure carbon seal was not damaged during installation. Remove excessive locking compound. Install seal within 60 seconds after removing from freezer.
Fasten carbon seal (6) in rear cover (10) with retaining ring (3).
Put No. 3 bearing rear cover assembly (10) in a clean sealable container identified with the engine serial number.

procedure.title: Installation of No. 3 Bearing Rear Cover Assembly (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Clean faces and spigots of both parts with alcohol (PWC11-014) with a lint free wiper prior to assembly.
Heat flange of gas generator case for 15 minutes with a hot air heat gun.
Install two guide pins (PWC64241-2) equally spaced around flange.

Lubricate and install one new
preformed packing (4) F50LP03-26 1 on
No. 3 bearing rear cover assembly (10) F50LC28A01 1 .

Put a thin film of oil on face of
carbon seal (6) B24NS05-02 1 .

MAKE SURE LOCATING PINS ON OIL HOUSING ENGAGE WITH COVER BEFORE SEATING COVER.Install No. 3 bearing rear cover (10) on gas generator case (1) aligning offset hole. Make sure locating pins (13) on the oil housing engage with cover before seating the cover. A dental mirror can be used to check for engagement of locating pins with cover.

Gradually seat No. 3 bearing rear cover assembly (10) with three
bolts (9) F50LB20-39 6 . Remove guide pins.
Tighten six bolts (9) in a star pattern 36 to 40 lb.in. (4-4.6 Nm).
Allow assembly to reach room temperature then and check tighten 36 to 40 lb.in. (4-4.6 Nm).

procedure.title: Installation of HP Turbine Rotor Air Seal (Balance Piston) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Check that the
wire damper seal (16) C33RD02-01 1 is installed.

Heat
seal (14) C33RS06-26 1 evenly, in area C, for 15 to 20 minutes with suitable heatgun.

Install seal on
stubshaft (12) A15RS21-01 1 , aligning V mark of seal (14) and stubshaft scallop.
Seat seal (14) on stubshaft with adapter (PWC40653), drift (PWC60843), hydraulic pump (PWC37807), and hydraulic cylinder (PWC89837).
Apply 1400 to 1500 psi (9652.6-10342.1 kPa) pressure. Hold pressure or 5 to 10 minutes until temperatures stabilize.
Remove tools.

procedure.title: Installation of Brush Seal (Ref. Fig. )

figure.title: Installation of HP Turbine Rotor Brush Seal

procedure.step:
Place the
brush seal (1) C33NC04-01 1 in a freezer for 15 to 30 minutes at -40°F (-40°C).

Locally heat inside diameter of
air nozzle support assembly (3) C33NS65A02 1 for ten minutes with a suitable heat gun.
Remove brush seal (1) from the freezer and install in the air nozzle support assembly (3) with drift (2) (PWC61821). Make sure anti-rotation lug is aligned with slot of brush seal carrier.
Maintain pressure until parts temperature have equalized. Make sure seal has seated correctly.

Install
retaining ring (4) C33NR20-02 1 .

procedure.title: Assembly of HP Turbine Housing (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Select first-stage and second-stage shroud segments which require replacing. Select same class of shroud segments which are being replaced, to suit turbine dimension (Table 602 REF. NO. 1225). Layout shroud segments and mark the new shroud segments. Note direction of arrow on No.1 segments for first- and second-stage segments.
Check for index mark X at offset hole of shroud housing on each side of flanges.
Mask cooling holes of HPT shroud housing, area S, with tape (PWC05-066A). Make sure tape does not interfere with shroud installation for grinding.
Install shim stock of equal thickness in each rail location FG1. Chose thickness, start with 0.003 inch, that lets segment fit snug. Reduce or increase as necessary.

Start with
No. 1 segment (2) C33NS27-01 24 of first-stage shroud in line with offset hole, and install segment with shim stock between segment rails and housing.
Installing remaining segments in CCW direction in same manner.

Install
slave retaining ring (3) C33NS06-22 24 (PWC60487).
Install shim stock of equal thickness in each rail location FG2. Chose thickness, start with 0.003 inch, that lets segment fit snug. Reduce or increase as necessary.

Start with
No. 1 segment (4) C33NS27-04 18 of second-stage shroud in line with offset hole, and install segment with shim stock between segment rails and housing.
Install remaining segments in CW direction in same manner.

Install HPT housing in grinding fixture as follows. Place grinding fixture in oven heated to 300 to 325°F (149-63°C) for 15 minutes. Install assembled HPT housing in fixture (PWC60738) aligning offset hole with index mark on fixture. Install slave nuts and bolts. Tighten nuts 75 to 85 lb.in. (8.4-9.6 Nm).

procedure.title: Measurement of the Circular Runout of Combustor (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Install adapter ring (2) (PWC60101) on flange E of
combustion chamber outer case (1) B22NC05A01 1 , aligning offset hole at top. Install four slave 0.250 inch diameter nuts and bolts. Tighten 85 to 95 lb.in. (9.6-10.7 Nm). Make sure runout fixture spigot is engaged fully and spigot is seated.

Install runout gage (4) (PWC60102) on
stubshaft (6) A15RS21-01 1 . Install nut (5) hand tight.
DO NOT LOAD STUBSHAFT IN ANY DIRECTION DURING RUNOUT CHECK.Put DTI (3) at top center and set to zero.
Turn stubshaft (6) clockwise, two full turns, to make sure DTI returns to zero at top center (Ref. View F).
Check dial indicator readings at A, B, C and D and record results. Example of reading: A = 0.000 B = - 0.001 C = - 0.0005 D = 0.000
Note positive and negative signs of dial indicator.
Make sure position A returns to zero when each reading is taken.

If runout exceeds plus or minus 0.005 inch at position B or D, or if runout exceeds plus 0.009 inch or minus 0.001 inch at position C, remove combustor and check seal for damage and re-seat combustor assembly.
Remove runout gage (4) and adapter ring (2).

procedure.title: Calculation of Offset (Ref. Fig. )

figure.title: Preparation and Calculation of Offset prior to Grinding

procedure.step:
Calculate offset, X horizontal axis or Y vertical axis, for grinding of shroud segments recorded in preceding (Ref. step ) with positive and negative signs as follows:
X offset = B - D2
Y offset = 0.004 - C2

Example in view No. 5 is described as follows:
X offset = (- 0.001 ) - (- 0.000)2 = - 0.0005
Y offset = (0.004) - (- 0.0005)2 = 0.00225
Record X and Y offset values, and determine the location of material removal.

procedure.title: Grinding of HP Turbine Shroud Segments (Ref. Fig. )

figure.title: Grinding of HP Turbine Shroud Segments

procedure.step: Install holding fixture on grinding machine.
Adjust holding fixture to offset grind to requirements (Ref. Para. ).
DO NOT GRIND FIXTURE.Grind first-stage shroud segments to Dim. (Ref. Table 602 REF. NO. 1225). Check for witness steps after grinding.
DO NOT GRIND FIXTURE.Grind second-stage shroud segments to Dim. (Ref. Table 602 REF. NO. 1225). Check for witness steps after grinding.
Remove HP turbine housing assembly from grinding fixture.

procedure.title: Disassembly After Grinding (Ref. Figs. )
procedure.step: Remove slave bolts and nuts from shroud housing and grinding fixture.
Remove shroud housing from grinding fixture with jacking screws.

Remove second-stage shroud segment
retaining ring (5) C33NR20-06 1 and remove
second-stage shroud segments (4) C33NS27-04 18 and shim stock from location FG2.

Remove first-stage shroud segment
slave retaining ring (3) C33NS06-22 1 and remove
first-stage shroud segments (2) C33NS27-01 24 and shim stock from location FG1.
Spray wash all components with solvent (PWC11-027).
Remove all masking tape from area S.
Remove all tape residue with clean cloth dampened in solvent (PWC11-027).
Spray wash again with solvent (PWC11-027) and dry with dry compressed air.

procedure.title: Checking of Piston Seal Gap (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Install support ring (PWC60550) in shroud housing.

Install piston seal ring and check gap as follows: Check that gap does not exceed 0.001 (0.03 mm) over an arc of 180 degrees or does not exceed 0.002 (0.05 mm) over an arc of 120 degrees or does not exceed 0.003 inch (0.8 mm) over an arc of 60 degrees.

procedure.title: Installation of Shroud Segments and Second-stage Vane in Shroud Housing (Ref. Fig. )

figure.title: Installation of Shroud Segments and Second-stage Vane in Shroud Housing

key.def: Second-stage Shroud Segment Anti-rotation Pin and Slot
First-stage Shroud Segment Anti-rotation Pin and Slot

procedure.step:
Install seal (1) in
shroud housing (10) C33NH05A07 1 .
Mark location of No. 1 first-stage shroud segment anti-rotation slot (12) in area E with silver pencil (PWC05-018).
Mark location of shroud housing No. 1 first-stage anti-rotation pins (12) location in area F with silver pencil (PWC05-018).

Install
segment seal (3) C33NS06-22 1 on CCW side of segment.

Install remaining
shroud segments (2) C33NS27-01 24 in CCW direction from No. 1 at index mark.
Install shroud segment in rails joining each segment together tightly as possible to allow installation of last segment.
Separate each segment enough to align housing anti-rotation pins with segments anti-rotation slots.
Tap segments gently down with soft faced hammer until they are completely seated and install piston seal (4). If segments do not seat, remove and check seal for damage. Replace seal if required.
Record second-stage vane class number. If class number is not indicated, record vane area.
Install protector (PWC60805) on brush seal.
Install piston seal (4) in second-stage vane assembly.

Install
second-stage vane assembly (5) C33NV02A01 10 . Make sure lugs go into mating slots of housing with smaller lug marked X installed in smaller slot of housing marked X.

Install
retaining ring (6) C33NR20-06 1 .
Mark location of No. 1 second-stage shroud segment anti-rotation slots (11) in area C with silver pencil (PWC05-018).
Mark location of shroud housing No. 1 second-stage shroud segment anti-rotation pin (11) in area D with silver pencil (PWC05-018).
Install segment seal (3) on CW side of segments.

Install remaining
segments (7) C33NS27-04 18 and
seals (8) C33NS06-14 18 in cw direction from No. 1 segment.
Install shroud segments in rails joining each segment together as tightly as possible to allow installation of last shroud segment.
When all segments are installed join the last segment to the first segment. Separate each segment enough to align anti-rotation pins with anti-rotation slots.

Tap segments gently with soft faced hammer until all segments are completely seated. Install
retaining ring (9) C33NR20-07 1 .

procedure.title: Calculate Spacer Thickness (Ref. Fig. )

figure.title: First-stage HP Turbine - Dimension Check and Installation

procedure.step:
Install HPT gage (1) (PWC60791) on
HP rotor shaft (2) A15RS21-01 1 . Make sure adapter touches rear face of
HP turbine rotor air seal (5) C33RS06-26 1 .

Measure the distance from the front face of the
HP turbine first-stage disk (3) C33RD09-02 1 to the front of the
turbine blade (4) C33RB15-03 45 platform. Record value as dimension GH.
Make sure HP rotor is turning freely and is loaded forward by pushing shaft with the hand during the measurement process.
Measure distance from rear face of spacer gage to the rear face of the HP turbine stator air seal at 4 equally spaced locations. Take the minimum value and record as dimension GV.
Dimension HH = Dimension C - dimension GV, where dimension C is marked on tool (Ref. 6.5XX).
Spacer thickness = Dim. HH - Dim. GH + 0.051 inch.
Select pre-ground spacer or grind new replacement spacer (Ref Subpara. following) to above requirements.

procedure.title: Grinding of Spacer (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Grind Face D only to achieve required thickness ± 0.001 inch and surface finish of 63 micro inches.
Spacer faces must be flat within 0.002 inch and Face D must be parallel to Face B within 0.0002 inch.
Break edges of spacer 0.003 to 0.015 inch.
Magnetic particle inspect: rod 1000 amps. No cracks are permitted.
Spray wash spacer with solvent (PWC11-027) and air dry.
Check for residual magnetism with a standard field gage. Remove any residual magnetism.
Tag identify with thickness and seal spacer in plastic bag.

figure.title: Second-stage Vane Ring - Removal of Brush Seal

procedure.title: Removal of Brush Seal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove
retaining ring (3) C33NR20-05 1 .

Install
vane assembly (1) C33NV02A07 1 in base (PWC60844).

Remove
brush seal (2) C33NS06-23 1 with drift (PWC60810) and handle (PWC60813).

figure.title: Second-stage Vane Ring - Calculation of Second-stage Baffle Clearance

procedure.title: Calculation of Second-Stage Baffle Clearance (Ref. Fig. and )
procedure.step:
Load the
compressor rotor stubshaft (3) A15RS21-01 1 forward and make sure that it is rotating freely.
Install gage (1) (PWC60791) on stubshaft.
Measure dimension TF with a suitable depth micrometer, at four equally spaced locations.
Record the average value.
Actual dimension, marked on gage, - TF = FS.

25104: Calculate dimension Z. Where Z = FS - (G + M1 + 0.045 + 0.125 + M2), as follows: G from HP turbine spacer (Ref. Para. , ). M1 from
first-stage HP turbine disk (4) C33RD09-02 1 . M2 from
HP turbine housing (7) C33NH05A02 1 .

25104: Measure the dimension "B" at four equally spaced locations and record the average value. Calculate dimension "A" as follows: Dim. A = FS - (G + M1) Dimension G obtained from HP turbine spacer thickness. (Ref. 72-00-00). Dimension M1 obtained from
first-stage HP turbine disk (4) C33RD09-02 1 . Dimension B must not exceed Dim. A - 0.046. If required, strip and rebuild. Calculate the turbine baffle clearance, dimension "Z" as follows: Dim. Z = Dim. A - 0.046. The baffle clearance is acceptable if Dim. B is equal to or less than Dim. Z. If the baffle clearance is not acceptable, strip and rebuild the second stage stator assembly. Make sure the retaining plate and baffle are seated properly within the vane segments.
Record dimension Z.
Install second-stage stator baffle on vane ring machining fixture (6) (PWC61768) and machine to dimension Z.
Measure and record the actual dimension.
Spray wash all components with (PWC11-027). Dry with dry compressed air.

procedure.title: Installation of Brush Seal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Install new
brush seal (2) C33NS06-23 1 with drift (PWC60810) and handle (PWC60813).
Install protector (PWC60805).

Install
retaining ring (3) C33NR20-05 1 .

Remove
vane assembly (1) C33NV02A07 1 from base.

key.def: Shroud Housing and First-stage Vane ring

procedure.title: Assembly (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Install revolving ring (PWC60377) on stand (PWC60376).
Install adapter plate (PWC60923) and fixture (1) (PWC60440) on ring (PWC60377).

Install second-stage,
HPT2, disk assembly (6) C33RD09-04 1 in blade retainer.
Install setting ring (4) (PWC60658).

Install
seal ring (5) C33NS06-06 1 below the bevel of the housing with P/N up, and joint in line with offset hole.
Check gap C between OD of seal ring and ID housing (Ref. Fits and Clearances REF. NO. 1806).
Make sure that mating surfaces of HPT1 disk and HPT2 disk are clean.
25104: Heat HPT2 disk mating spigot, area B, to 500°F (260°C) for 20 minutes with suitable heat gun.
25104: Heat HPT2 disk mating spigot, area B, on heating platen (PWC60152) to 400°F (204°C) for 10 to 15 minutes.

Install
HPT1 disk (2) C33RD09-02 1 on fixture (1) (PWC60440).

Install
shroud housing (3) C33NV02A07 1 on fixture (1), aligning marked hole of shroud housing with similar index mark on HPT1 disk (2), and engaging anti-rotation lugs/slots.

PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Install HPT2 disk (6), aligning marked hole of shroud housing with similar index mark on HPT1 disk (2), and engaging anti-rotation lugs/slots.
Do not force HPT2 disk (6) to seat. If assembly does not seat correctly, repeat steps thru .
Rotate HPT2 disk CW as viewed from TE, aligning lines in bores of HPT1 and HPT2 disks.
Install pusher (8) (PWC43057) and cylinder (9) (PWC89837).
Connect pump (PWC37807) to cylinder (9), apply 1800 to 2000 psi (12,410.5-13789.5 kPa) pressure, and hold for five minutes minimum.
Disconnect pump, and remove cylinder (9) and pusher (8).
Make sure the TDC line of disk aligns with TDC line on stub shaft.

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. and )
procedure.step: Remove shroud housing retaining ring (1, Fig. ), tag and identify ring with engine S/N.
Install pusher (2) (PWC61580) on HPT, aligning split line of pusher with index mark of HPT2.
Loosen shroud holders (4) and move inward.
Loosen screws (5) of shroud holders (4) but do not remove.
Move locator (6) away from HPT1.
Install fixture (3) (PWC60623) over pusher (2), aligning index mark of fixture with index mark on HPT.
Install nut (7) handtight only. Make sure top of nut is flush with top of pusher.
Tighten locator (6) against HPT2.
Adjust shroud holders (4) to align squarely in retaining ring groove.
Align shroud housing index mark with HPT assembly index mark and tighten shroud holders (4) handtight.
Install lifting eye (8) (PWC32514) to fixture (3) and install lifting hook into eye.
Lift and rotate assembly horizontal, and remove fixture (1, Fig. )(PWC60440).
Install safety arms (9, Fig. ) on fixture (3).
Align marked hole of HPT shroud housing, split of pusher (2), index mark of HPT2 and fixture (1, Fig. ).
Install heater (10, Fig. ) (PWC60916) and controller (11) (PWC60136) into bore of HP assembly, and set timer for twenty minutes.
Clean HPT spacer (12), mating surfaces of HPT1 disk and balancing piston with alcohol (PWC11-014).
25345: Install the HPT spacer (12) of correct thickness.
25345: Select the class of new HPT sleeve spacer to fit within ± 0.001 inch during assembly (Ref. F&C REF. NO. 1284). If needed, grind the new HPT sleeve spacer to required dimension (Ref. Para ).
Install seal ring (13), with S/N forward, and split at top. Make sure scallop of seal ring aligns with anti-rotation pin of first-stage vane ring outer shroud seal ring groove.
Apply sealant (PWC09-002) maximum one drop, to seal ring joint, compress ring and hold until set. Seal ring must rotate freely in groove.
If sealant has spread between ring and groove, or does not set properly, remove ring, clean and re-apply sealant.
Make sure that the first-stage shroud segments are positioned rearward.
Install gasket (14).
Align index scallop of stubshaft with index mark on combustor case.
Install guide (PWC61765) into stubshaft bore with alignment pin in stubshaft scallop.

PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Check temperature of HPT spigot with probe of controller (11). If temperature is above 300°F (149°C), remove heater (10), store and lock safety arms (9).

PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Install HPT assembly aligning index mark with stubshaft scallop. Check that offset holes of shroud and combustor are aligned.
Remove guide from stubshaft.
Remove the spherical nut from the adapter (PWC40601) (15) threaded rod. The spherical nut is depicted in view of cylinder (PWC89837) (17).
Insert adapter (PWC40601) (15) through the turbine module and install it on the stubshaft. Tighten the adapter on the stubshaft.
Install pusher pad (PWC43057) (16) and the hydraulic cylinder (PWC89837) (17) on the adapter (PWC40601) (15).
Install and tighten the spherical nut on the adapter (PWC40601) (15) threaded rod.
Install the hydraulic cylinder (PWC89837) (17) containment.
Attach the pump (PWC37807) to cylinder (17), and apply 2900 to 3100 psi (19994 - 21373 kPa) pressure. Hold for minimum five minutes. Remove tools.
Install retaining ring (18).

Install bolts (19) and nuts (20) around flange. Draw flanges together evenly by gradually tightening nuts (20) in a diametrically opposite clockwise pattern, starting at 12 o'clock, until flanges are seated. Finally torque all nuts 85 to 95 lb.in. (9.5-10.75 Nm).
Remove all tools.

procedure.title: Measure XX and YY (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Measure YY dimension on the
cover (1) C33RC28-03 1 .
Record dimension YY.

Measure XX dimension on the
HPT disk (2) C33RD09-04 1 and
stub shaft (3) A15RS21-01 1 with a depth vernier.
Record dimension XX.

figure.title: HP Turbine Module - Installation of Retaining Nut

procedure.title: Installation of Retaining Nut (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Make sure stubshaft scallop is at the 12 o'clock position.

Make sure that mating faces of
HP rear cover (1) C33RC28-03 1 and HPT2 disk are clean.
USE EXTREME CARE WHEN HANDLING COVER. NO DAMAGE IS ALLOWED.Place rear cover on heater adapter (PWC61774) and set temperature to 600°F (315°C) for fifteen to thirty minutes.
PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Make sure cover temperature is more than 450°F (232°C), and install holder (PWC61775) on cover.
Install cover (1) with holder, aligning cover index mark with stubshaft index scallop.
Install drift (PWC60843), adapter (PWC40601) and cylinder (PWC89837).
Attach pump (PWC37807) to cylinder, and apply 3600 to 4000 psi (24,821-27,579 kPa).
Hold pressure. Let cover temperature equalize with cooling ring (PWC64330) or air cooling tool (PWC89835).
Remove tools.

Coat mating face and threads of
nut (2) C33RN05-02 1 with anti-seize compound (PWC06-009) and install nut on shaft.
Install wrench (PWC41050), adapter (PWC60435) and socket (PWC60434).
Torque nut 2400 to 2640 lb.in. (271.2-298.3 Nm).
Hold torque and set angle needle to zero.
Turn nut thru angle of 50 degrees.
Trial fit keywasher. If slots do not align, increase angle of turn until slots align. Do not exceed 55 degrees total.
Record final torque value and angle.
Remove tools.
Install runout fixture (PWC61030) and check runout on face B. Maximum runout is 0.001 inch (0.03 mm).
Remove tools.

Install
keywasher (4) C33RW03-02 1 .

Install
retaining ring (3) C33RR20-01 1 with gap at 12 o'clock.

procedure.title: Measure Stretch (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Measure and record dimension "ZZ".
Calculate stretch as follows: Stretch = ZZ - (XX - YY)
The amount of stretch must be 0.006 to 0.008 in. (0.152 - 0.203 mm).
If the stretch value is below the minimum limit, apply torque of 500 lb.ft. (6000 lb.in.) (677.9 Nm). Check stretch.
If the stretch is still under minimum, apply torque in 10 lb.ft. (120 in.lb.) (13.6 Nm) increments until the required stretch is achieved. Do not exceed 550 lb.ft. (6600 lb.in.) (745.7 Nm).

general.para: This section provides instructions and limits for inspection/check of the HP turbines and related parts. The procedures described in this section can only be done during Heavy Maintenance.
It is recommended that a magnifying glass of at least 10X power be used when visually inspecting for damage.
Within the following text, where the term nicks or dents is used, unless otherwise specified, blend repair limits are applicable provided at least 70 percent of original surface remains undamaged.
Parts found unsuitable for further engine running should be replaced. Rejected parts should be returned to Pratt & Whitney Canada for complete inspection and possible repair/refurbishment.

Cleaning and Inspection of the P2.5 and P2.8 BOV's must be performed at the same time as the HP Turbine Inspection/Check. Reference:
Chapter 05-20-00 - Scheduled Maintenance Checks.
Chapter 75-30-01 - Compressor Bleed Valves - Maintenance Practices.

consumables.para: The consumable materials listed below are used in the following procedures.

special-tools.para: The special tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

n-para.title: First-stage Disk Assembly (Ref. Fig. )
n-para.note: First and second-stage turbine disk assemblies comprise a balanced assembly. Rejection of either disk assembly requires that both be sent to an overhaul facility to be rebalanced.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Disk
procedure.step: Examine for cracks. No cracks permitted, reject assembly if evident.

Nicks, dents, scratches, scores, and corrosion pitting are acceptable to 0.005 inch (0.138 mm) deep on disk side face except for area located within 0.030 of fir tree fixings, and disk bore where 0.003 inch (0.08 mm) is acceptable. Remove sharp edges. Polish to restore surface finish.
Examine internal splines for pitting, wear and local surface damage. Isolated pitting or wear 0.005 inch (0.14 mm) deep is acceptable on 25 percent of surface. Remove sharp edges.
Examine the threads for wear and local surface damage. Fretting wear and galling 0.003 inch (0.08 mm) deep is acceptable. Remove sharp edges. Polish to restore surface finish.
Examine for signs of hot gas ingestion or overtemperature at the apex of fir tree fixings. White color indicates overtemperature. Send HPT disk assembly to overhaul facility if evident.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Front Cover
procedure.step: Examine balance counterweights retaining rivets for tightness. Replace as necessary.
Examine for cracks. No cracks permitted. Reject assembly if evident.
Nicks, dents, scratches, scores, and corrosion pitting are acceptable to 0.003 inch (0.076 mm) deep. Remove sharp edges. Polish to restore surface finish.

Examine knife edges for rubbing. If evident, check dimensions of knife edges:
Diameter A - 9.725 to 9.735 inch (247.015-247.269 mm)
Diameter B - 5.619 to 5.621 inch (147.723-147.773 mm)
Diameter C - 5.529 to 5.531 inch (140.437-140.487 mm)
Diameter D - 5.459 to 5.461 inch (138.659-138.709 mm)
Examine for damaged cooling holes. No damage is permitted, reject assembly if damage is evident.
Examine for blocked cooling holes. Clear as necessary.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Blades
procedure.step: Airfoil tip, area j: Examine for cracks extending through thickness of material. Cracks 0.100 inch (2.54 mm) in length are acceptable if the cracks are more than 0.400 inch (10.2 mm) from the trailing edge and spaced as follows: Converging cracks: 0.100 inch (2.54 mm) minimum apart. Non-converging cracks: 0.025 inch (0.64 mm) minimum apart. Examine for erosion. Localized erosion of blade tip is acceptable if engine performance margin (ITT) is acceptable. HPT blade tip clearances may be re-established by replacing HPT shrouds and grinding blade tips to minimum allowable disk diameter. Examine the blade tip pocket area, missing cooling passage plug welds are acceptable.

Airfoil leading edge tip, area h: Examine for erosion. Erosion with complete coating removal is acceptable if it is within 0.050 inch (1.27 mm) of blade tip, and wall thickness is no less than 0.010 inch (0.25 mm). Examine for nicks, dents or raised material. Remove sharp edges.

Airfoil leading edge, area f: Area f extends 0.100 inch (2.54 mm) from leading edge. Examine for cracks. Hairline cracks 0.100 inch (2.54 mm) and located above 50% of total blade height as measured from the bottom of the blade fixing, are acceptable. Examine for erosion. Erosion of coating exposing base material is acceptable if damage does not extend through the blade wall exposing internal core passages. If acceptable, damage must be re-inspected within 300 FH by borescope inspection (Ref. Chapter 72-00-00, INSPECTION). Examine for nicks, dents or pits. One area of damage 0.020 inch (0.51 mm) deep is acceptable.

Examine airfoil leading edge under blade platform for sulphidation. A narrow band , 0.080 inch (2.03 mm) wide maximum, occurring at the seal contact area on the platform, less than 0.020 inch (0.51 mm) below the platform, not associated with cracks or rubbing is acceptable.
Examine airfoil surface, area e for nicks, dents or pits. A maximum of three areas of damage 0.003 inch (0.08 mm) deep is acceptable.
Examine airfoil root, area a for nicks, dents or pits. One area of damage 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep is acceptable.

Airfoil trailing edge, area g: Area g extends 0.100 inch (2.54 mm) from airfoil trailing edge. Examine for cracks. No cracking is allowed. If cracks are present send disk assembly to overhaul facility. Examine for nicks, dents or pits. One area of damage 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep is acceptable.
Examine for erosion. Erosion of coating without exposure of base material is acceptable.
Examine blade platform for cracking. Non-converging cracks are acceptable if they do not enter area a of blade airfoil.
Examine blade platform for oxidation. Oxidation without material loss of the TE corners is acceptable.
Examine for blocked cooling holes. Clear as necessary.
If blades fail inspection, and must be replaced, or tips machined, send disk assembly to an overhaul facility.

n-para.title: Second-stage Disk Assembly (Ref. Fig. )
n-para.note: First and second-stage turbine disk assemblies comprise a balanced assembly. Rejection of either disk assembly requires that both be sent to an overhaul facility to be rebalanced.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Disk
procedure.step: Nicks, dents, scratches, scores, and corrosion pitting are acceptable to 0.005 inch (0.138 mm) deep on disk side face except for area located within 0.030 of fir tree fixings, and disk bore where 0.003 inch (0.08 mm) is acceptable. Remove sharp edges. Polish to restore surface finish.
Examine for indications of hot gas ingestion or overtemperature at the apex of fir tree fixings. White color indicates overtemperature. Send HPT disk assy to an overhaul facility if evident.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Blades
procedure.step: If blades are not within the following acceptance criteria, send disk assembly to an overhaul facility.
Examine area j: Oxidation with material loss is acceptable if the tip clearance and runout is within limits.
Examine area f: Erosion with complete coating removal is acceptable if within 0.050 inch (1.27 mm) of blade tip and wall thickness is more than 0.010 inch (0.25 mm).
Examine airfoil leading edge tip for nicks, burrs and raised material. Remove sharp edges.

Examine area d: Area d extends 0.100 inch (2.54 mm) from airfoil LE. Erosion of coating without exposing base metal is acceptable. Nicks, dents and pits. One area of damage 0.005 inch (0.127 mm) deep is acceptable.
Examine area b for nicks, dents and pits. Three areas of damage 0.003 inch (0.076 mm) deep are acceptable.
Examine area e for nicks, dents and pits. A maximum of one area of damage 0.005 inch (0.127 mm) deep is acceptable. Area e extends 0.100 inch (2.54 mm) from airfoil TE.
Examine area c for nicks, dents or pits. One area of damage 0.005 inch (0.127 mm) deep is acceptable. Area c extends 0.150 inch (3.81 mm) from platform surface.

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: Examine for cracks. No cracks permitted. Reject cover if evident.
Nicks, dents, scratches, scores, and corrosion pitting are acceptable to 0.003 inch (0.08 mm) deep. Remove sharp edges. Polish to restore surface finish.
Examine for security of balance counterweights retaining rivets. Replace as necessary.

procedure.title: Visual Check of No. 3 Bearing Rear Carbon Seal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: CARBON SEALS ARE VERY EASILY DAMAGED. BE CAREFUL WHEN HANDLING.Examine outer case for: Cracks. Reject seal if evident. Nicks and burrs up to a maximum of 0.005 inch deep is acceptable. Remove raised metal and sharp edges.
Examine carbon sealing ring for cracks or deterioration. Reject if evident.

Examine dia. A for nicks, chips or scratches. Up to four axial scratches across the full width of the seal surface are acceptable providing that each scratch is less than 0.005 inch deep and 0.010 wide. Chips are acceptable if a continuous band of at least 50 percent of original seal width remains undamaged and the damage is not spread over more than a 30 degree arc. Examine side faces and chamfers. Nicks, chips and scratches are acceptable provided the sealing in the housing is not affected.

TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO SEAL, AVOID EXCESSIVE RADIAL MOVEMENT.Check operation of seal in case. Movement should be smooth without sticking or binding. Carry out dimensional inspection if oil leaks are evident.
Dimensionally check dia. A using a bore gage employing air gap principle or equivalent. Acceptable provided dimension does not exceed specified limits REF. NO. 1133.
Dimensionally check remainder of carbon seal REF. NO. 1134.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Housing
procedure.step: Examine for cracks. No cracks permitted, reject if evident.

Examine for nicks or dents on functional surfaces that contact seal rings, diameters A, B and C, and shroud segment attachment rails. Acceptable to a maximum depth of 0.005 inch (0.13 mm), provided damage is removed by blending to a maximum depth of 0.007 inch (0.18 mm).
Examine for wear or fretting of Dia. A, Dia. B and or Dia. C. Acceptable to a maximum depth of 0.002 inch (0.05 mm).
Examine for blocked cooling holes. Clear as necessary.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Baffle
procedure.step: Examine for cracks. Three cracks to a maximum length of 0.200 inch (5.080 mm) are acceptable if cracks are separated by a minimum of 0.300 inch (7.620 mm) and are non-converging. No cracks permitted in area a.
Examine for nicks. Any number acceptable to a maximum depth of 0.008 inch (0.203 mm) provided damage is removed by blending to a maximum depth of 0.010 inch (0.254 mm).
Examine for dents. Acceptable to a maximum depth of 0.010 inch (0.254 mm).
Examine for blocked cooling holes. Clear as necessary.
Examine for looseness. Send assembly to an overhaul facility if the baffle is loose.

procedure.title: Visual Check of First and Second-stage Shroud Retaining Rings
procedure.step: Examine for cracks, distortion. Reject if evident.
Examine for fretting. Fretting is acceptable to a maximum of 0.005 inch (0.25 mm) deep.
Dimensionally check Dim. a, free state gap. If necessary cold rework the ring to obtain a minimum gap of 0.170 inch, do not exceed 0.225 inch.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Second-stage Stator Seal Ring
procedure.step: Examine for cracks or distortion. Reject if evident.

Examine for radial clearance when installed in HPT housing with the gap at the top as follows: Check that gap between components does not exceed 0.001 inch (0.03 mm) over an arc of 180 degrees or does not exceed 0.002 inch (0.05 mm) over an arc of 120 degrees or does not exceed 0.003 inch (0.08 mm) over an arc of 60 degrees. If necessary, rotate seal ring until clearance is within limits. Note position of seal ring gap. Reject seal ring if clearance is not within limits.
Examine for evidence of damage, fretting or wear on faces. Acceptable to a maximum depth of 0.010 inch (0.013 mm). Stone to remove sharp edges and raised material

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: If the limits are exceeded, reject vane segments. Retain segments for future evaluation and possible repair.

Examine airfoil leading edge (LE): Hairline cracks that are not in a circular pattern are serviceable. Hairline cracks can be associated with superficial oxidation and small loss of material. Erosion around cooling holes and cracks 0.005 inch (0.12 mm) deep maximum is serviceable.

Examine airfoil trailing edge (TE): Hairline cracks are serviceable if they are in the limits that follow: The cracks are not in a circular pattern. One crack 0.600 in. (15.24 mm) long maximum for each airfoil, if the crack goes fully through the two airfoil skins. Three cracks 1.000 in. (25.40 mm) long maximum for each airfoil surface that are not directly in line on the two airfoil skins. Erosion is acceptable, if thickness of TE is greater than 0.008 inch (0.21 mm) with coating. Use a gauge (PWC54101) to measure the wall thickness of the airfoil trailing edge. Dents/constrictions at the trailing edge ejection slots are serviceable in the limits that follow: A maximum of one slot on each airfoil has a dent/constriction. The slot width at the dent/constriction is 0.010 in. (0.26 mm) minimum.

Examine airfoil surfaces: Hairline cracks are serviceable if they are in the limits that follow: Multi-pronged non-converging cracks that include an area that is not more than 0.300 in. (7.62 mm) in diameter are serviceable if there is no airfoil distortion. Cracks with or without shallow burned areas 0.020 in. (0.50 mm) wide maximum not in a circular pattern are serviceable, other than "U" shaped cracks on concave surface. Areas of heavy oxidation related to cracks and material loss to a maximum of 0.005 in. (0.12 mm) are serviceable. Dents 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) deep maximum are serviceable, if airfoil surface is not punctured. Local heavy oxidation 0.005 inch (0.12 mm) deep maximum is serviceable.

Examine inner and outer shroud TE lips: Hairline cracks are serviceable if they are in the limits that follow: Cracks do not converge and are less than 0.030 in. (0.76 mm) wide. They are 0.250 in. (6.35 mm) minimum from the trailing-edge-lip end acute angle face. There is a gap of 0.150 in. (3.81 mm) minimum between cracks. On the inner shroud lips, general heavy oxidation or erosion is serviceable if the lip thickness is more than 0.030 in. (0.77 mm). On the outer shroud lips erosion that makes the trailing edge round is serviceable. The maximum radius of the eroded chamfer or corner is 0.040 in. (1.01 mm).

Examine Inner and Outer Shroud Gas Path - Surfaces Hairline cracks with or without superficial oxidation or minor material loss are serviceable if they are in the limits that follow: They can go through airfoil fillet radii into the airfoil. The maximum total crack length is 0.600 in. (15.24 mm). Groups of small surface cracks that do not go through the shroud are serviceable.
Examine Inner and Outer Shroud Surfaces Hairline cracks 0.600 in. (15.24 mm) long maximum are serviceable. Cracks that do not go through the shroud are serviceable.

Examine Inner and Outer-Shroud Feather-seal Faces Burning or erosion more than 0.050 in. (1.27 mm) from the feather-seal slot is serviceable. Cracks that go through to the feather-seal slot are serviceable.

Examine Outer-Shroud Leading Edge Hairline cracks that go through to the airfoil surface are serviceable. Erosion 0.020 in. (0.50 mm) deep maximum is serviceable. Thinning material is serviceable if the flange thickness is not less than 0.065 in. (1.66 mm).
Examine Cooling Holes, Inserts and Trailing-Edge Slots Cooling holes, inserts and trailing edge slots that are not blocked is serviceable.
Examine Gas Path Surfaces Small coating loss areas due to erosion is acceptable.
Examine All Other Surfaces Local surface damage 0.005 in. (0.12 mm) deep maximum is serviceable, remove only raised material.

n-para.title: Second-stage Vane Ring Assembly (Ref. Fig. and )

procedure.title: Visual Check (25104)
procedure.step: Outer shroud: Hairline cracks. Any number of hairline cracks are acceptable, cracks may extend into airfoil. Through going cracks up to 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) wide may extend from the corner of the cooling slot on the outer shroud to the forward edge is acceptable, and cracks may progress into the airfoil fillet radius and the leading edge (Ref.
