View P-P and R-R). Through going cracks extending into the seal ring retaining slot is not acceptable. Burnt or missing material. Minor burning or oxidation is acceptable.

Inner shroud: Hairline cracks. Multiple hairline cracks originating at the inner shroud rear edge, key hole slots and/or cooling holes, terminating in the baffle support flange are acceptable. Hairline cracks originating at the inner shroud front edge are not acceptable. Open cracks are not acceptable. Burnt or missing material is not acceptable.

Vane leading edge: Hairline cracks. Any amount of non-through-going hairline cracks are acceptable. Open cracks. Two open cracks per vane are acceptable up to a maximum of 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) wide and up to a maximum cumulative length of 0.600 inch (15.24 mm). Minor oxidation of cracked areas is acceptable. Missing material or multi-branched open cracks is not acceptable.

Check airfoil trailing edge as follows: Hairline cracks. Any amount of non-through going hairline cracks are acceptable. Distortion and dents. Trailing edge exhibiting waviness or dents up to a maximum of 0.060 inch (1.524 mm) are acceptable. Open cracks, burnt and/or missing material is not acceptable.

Check airfoil pressure and suction surfaces as follows: Hairline cracks. Any amount of non-through going hairline crack on either side of the airfoil is acceptable. Open cracks, burnt and/or missing material is not acceptable. Distortion and dents. Minor bulging on airfoil is acceptable.
Check inner and outer location lugs for evidence of wear, cracks or missing lugs. Lugs may be repaired.
Check sealing cap welds for evidence of cracking. Cracks are not acceptable.

Check airfoil and inner platform cooling holes for: Blockage and evidence of foreign material. Reject if evident. Vane ring with blockage in the cooling holes may be sent to an overhaul facility for repair.

Check all other surfaces for: Raised metal and sharp edges. Stone to remove. Nicks, dents or scoring. Damage is acceptable to a maximum depth of 0.008 inch (0.20 mm) deep on airfoil surfaces and a maximum of 0.020 inch (0.51 mm) deep on all other surfaces. When repairing damaged areas make sure the minimum area of surface treatment is removed.
Check for deterioration of surface treatment. Send assembly to an overhaul shop for restoration of surface treatment.

Check baffle for: Distortion, cracks, looseness. Loose or missing rivets are not permitted. Raised material and sharp edges. Stone to remove. Local surface damage max. 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep is acceptable. Damage 0.005 to 0.008 inch (0.13-0.20 mm) deep may be blended to a max. depth of 0.010 inch (0.25 mm).

RUBBER GLOVES (OR SIMILAR) MUST BE USED WHEN HANDLING BRUSH SEALS SINCE LINT OR COTTON GLOVES WILL SNAG BRISTLES AND DAMAGE PART. TOUCHING BRISTLES SHOULD BE AVOIDED. BRUSH SEAL SHALL NOT BE CLEANED OR SUBMERSED IN DYE PENETRANT FLUID.Examine brush seal for distortion, excessive wear, looseness and oil/carbon contamination (Ref. Fig. ). The following conditions are acceptable: Loose or stray individual bristles are acceptable and can be left as is or cut down with diagonal pliers. Pulling bristles out may dislodge further bristles, therefore is not permitted. Within a seal pack, small areas of missing bristles up to 0.025 inch are permitted when the areas are separated by four inches or more and the adjacent seal pack has no missing bristles. Partial blow over or downstream windage damage is acceptable provided a minimum bristle pack width is maintained. Partial tapering of the bristle pack from the upstream side is acceptable. Worn bristles showing as a variation of height above and below the backing plate, is acceptable providing it is not more than 0.010 inch below the backing plate. Nicks, dents, or scratches on the backing plate up to 0.005 inch are acceptable without blending. Damage up to 0.015 inch requires blending.

procedure.title: Visual Check (25104)
procedure.step: Inner and Outer shroud gas path surfaces: Hairline cracks which may extend into the airfoil filet radius or associated with cooling holes are acceptable. Cracks extending on the outer rim or the mounting flange are not acceptable. Clusters on non through going cracks are acceptable. Axial through going cracks less than 0.010 in (0.25 mm) wide are acceptable providing they do not extend onto the T.E. mounting flange or outer rim. May converge with circumferential cracks running parallel with the T.E. sealing face. 25229 and 25230: Open through going cracks or converging axial or circumferential cracks are not acceptable. Local oxidation and or erosion that may be associated with a cluster of multiple shallow cracks is acceptable. Small pieces of material missing associated with cracking is acceptable. Burnt or missing material, other than allowed above, is not acceptable. Cooling hole blockage or foreign material deposits restricting the cooling flow is not acceptable.

Airfoil leading edge: Non-converging hairline cracks that may originate at the cooling holes are acceptable. Local oxidation and or erosion that may be around the cooling holes or associated with cracking is acceptable. Burnt or missing material is not acceptable. Cooling hole blockage or foreign material deposits restricting the cooling flow is not acceptable.

Airfoil trailing edge: Cracks less than 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) wide are acceptable as follows: One crack per airfoil extending on both convex and concave surfaces that is less than 0.800 inch (20.32 mm) long. Up to 3 cracks per airfoil less than 1.000 inch (25.40 mm) long affecting only the convex or concave surface that may be associated with small areas of material loss. Closed pattern cracks that indicate the material will liberate are not acceptable. Local erosion and oxidation that may be associated with cracking is acceptable providing the trailing edge thickness exceeds 0.008 inch (0.203 mm). One dent or distortion per airfoil that is restricting the flow through the cooling slots is acceptable providing the slot width is not below 0.010 inch (0.25 mm). Burnt or missing material, other that allowed above, is not acceptable.

Airfoil concave and convex surfaces: Hairline cracks are acceptable if cracks do not form a closed pattern. Multi-pronged cracks are acceptable if pattern does not exceed 0.300 inch (7.62 mm) in diameter. Cracks with small areas of missing material are acceptable. Dents up to 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) deep that are not puncturing the airfoil surface are acceptable. Local oxidation and or erosion that may be associated with a cluster of multiple shallow cracks is acceptable. Burnt or missing material, other than allowed above, is not acceptable.
Check inner and outer location lugs for evidence of wear, cracks or missing lugs. Lugs may be repaired.
Check sealing cap welds for evidence of cracking. Cracks are not acceptable.

Check airfoil and inner platform cooling holes for: Blockage and evidence of foreign material. Reject if evident. Vane ring with blockage in the cooling holes may be sent to an overhaul facility for repair.

Check all other surfaces for: Raised metal and sharp edges. Stone to remove. Nicks, dents or scoring. Damage is acceptable to a maximum depth of 0.008 inch (0.20 mm) deep on airfoil surfaces and a maximum of 0.020 inch (0.51 mm) deep on all other surfaces. When repairing damaged areas make sure the minimum area of surface treatment is removed.
Check for deterioration of surface treatment. Send assembly to an overhaul shop for restoration of surface treatment.

Check baffle for: Distortion, cracks, looseness. Loose or missing rivets are not permitted. Raised material and sharp edges. Stone to remove. Local surface damage max. 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep is acceptable. Damage 0.005 to 0.008 inch (0.13-0.20 mm) deep may be blended to a max. depth of 0.010 inch (0.25 mm).
Examine brush seal for distortion, excessive wear, looseness and oil/carbon contamination. Clean or replace as required.

figure.title: Second-stage HP Turbine Vane Ring Brush Seal Inspection

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: Examine sealing ring groove, dimension A. Fretting wear is acceptable if dimension A is less than 0.168 inch (4.27 mm).
Examine cooling holes for obstructions. Clear holes as necessary.
Any number of minor cracks and oxidation associated with the cooling holes at the leading edge chamfer are acceptable.

Area C: Open cracks that may be associated with material loss are acceptable at the LE chamfer provided: The crack does not propagate radially on the flange more than 0.200 inch (5.08 mm) from the flange fillet radius. The crack does not propagate axially past the first row of cooling holes. Diameter B in freestate is not more than 13.718 inch (348.26 to 348.44 mm).

Inspect anti-rotation lugs (25156): Severely worn anti-rotation lugs are acceptable. Crack in anti-rotation lug up to 0.300 inch (7.62 mm) long is acceptable provided no missing material and no converging cracks is observed. SB25156 should be incorporated when accessed.

Inspect anti-rotation lugs (25156): Inspect anti-rotation pins for fretting. Maximum 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) is acceptable provided the wear step is removed. Crack in anti-rotation lug up to 0.300 inch (7.62 mm) long is acceptable provided no missing material and no converging cracks is observed.
Examine piston ring anti-rotation pin for wear. Check pin OD. If less than 0.096 inch (2.44 mm), replace shroud.

Examine all other surfaces: Raised metal and sharp edges. Remove all raised metal and sharp edges. Fretting, dents, nicks, scores or scratches. Damage 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep is acceptable. Damage 0.005 to 0.010 inch (0.13 to 0.25 mm) deep may be removed by blending to 0.012 inch (0.30 mm) deep maximum.

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: Examine diameter A for seal rub. Damage 0.007 inch (0.18 mm) deep and 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) wide is acceptable. Reject if limits are exceeded. Check dimension (Ref. Fits and Clearances, REF NO 1375)

Examine all other surfaces for nicks, dents, and/or fretting: Damage/wear 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep is acceptable without repair. Damage/wear 0.005 to 0.010 inch (0.13-0.25 mm) deep may be repaired to 0.012 inch (0.30 mm) deep.
Examine anti-rotation lugs for fretting. Minor fretting is acceptable if the step is removed.
Multiple radial hairline cracks on Dia. B and Face C (Area F) are acceptable providing the cracks do not extend into Dia. D.
Heavy oxidation with missing material at Dia. B and Face C is acceptable providing a minimum band of 0.100 inch contact surface remains undamaged (Ref. Fig. ).

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: Examine anchor nuts for attachment. Tighten or replace as necessary (Ref. Chapter 70-00-00, REPAIR).
Examine support for distortion. Reject support if bent or distorted.

Examine all other surfaces: Raised metal and sharp edges. Remove all raised metal and sharp edges. Dents, nicks, scores or scratches 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep are acceptable. Damage 0.005 to 0.010 inch (0.13-0.20 mm) deep may be removed to 0.012 inch (0.30 mm) deep maximum.

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: Examine for cracks. Axial cracks that may be open and associated with local heavy oxidation at the outer ring of the segment locating groove are acceptable if they do not extend past the groove.

Examine for nicks or dents. Maximum combination of 10 is acceptable to 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep is acceptable. Damage 0.005 to 0.010 inch (0.13-0.25 mm) deep can be removed by blending to a maximum depth of 0.012 inch (0.30 mm).

Local heavy oxidation and/or burnt material and/or fretting of the segment locating groove is acceptable if: Local heavy oxidation and/or burnt material 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) deep is acceptable. Local fretting at the outer rim up to 0.035 inch (0.9 mm) deep is acceptable.

Examine for loose, worn or damaged honeycomb turbine air seal. Reject if loose or damaged. Replace the honeycomb and/or the first-stage high pressure turbine front cover labyrinth seal if they are badly rubbed.

procedure.title: Dimensional Check
procedure.step: Perform the special assembly procedure (REF. NO. 1825, 1826, 1827 and 1828), if the first-stage high pressure turbine front cover air nozzle assembly or honeycomb were replaced.

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: Examine for nicks or dents. Maximum combination of 10 is acceptable to 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep is acceptable. Damage 0.005 to 0.010 inch (0.13-0.25 mm) deep can be removed by blending to a maximum depth of 0.012 inch (0.30 mm).

Examine for loose, worn or damaged honeycomb turbine air seal. Reject if loose or damaged. Replace the honeycomb and/or the first-stage high pressure turbine front cover labyrinth seal if they are badly rubbed.

procedure.title: Dimensional Check
procedure.step: Perform the special assembly procedure (REF. NO. 1825, 1826, 1827 and 1828), if the first-stage high pressure turbine front cover, air nozzle assembly or honeycomb were replaced.

n-para.title: HP Turbine Front Inner Stator Support (25211) (Ref. Fig. )

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: Examine for cracks. Axial cracks that may be open and associated with local heavy oxidation at the outer ring of the segment locating groove are acceptable if they do not extend past the groove.

Examine for nicks or dents. Maximum combination of 10 is acceptable to 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep is acceptable. Damage 0.005 to 0.010 inch (0.13-0.25 mm) deep can be removed by blending to a maximum depth of 0.012 inch (0.30 mm).

Local heavy oxidation and/or burnt material and/or fretting of the segment locating groove is acceptable if: Local heavy oxidation and/or burnt material 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) deep is acceptable. Local fretting at the outer rim up to 0.035 inch (0.9 mm) deep is acceptable.

figure.title: HP Turbine Front Inner Stator Support

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: Visually examine for cracks or deformation. Reject if evident.

procedure.title: Visual Check (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Inspect for cracks. No cracks are permitted.

Inspect the carbon seal diameter. Surface damage, local and isolated pits, circumferential and axial scratch up to 0.003 in. (0.07 mm) maximum are serviceable. Reject the part if you find flaking or crack in the coating.
Reject the part if knife edge seals are damaged. Rubbing is serviceable.

Inspect brush seal diameter. Surface damage, local and isolated pits, circumferential and axial scratch up to 0.003 in. (0.07 mm) maximum are serviceable. Reject the part if you find flaking or crack in the coating.
Inspect all other surfaces for nicks and dents. Local surface damage up to 0.005 in. (0.12 mm) deep maximum is serviceable. Remove only raise material.
Make sure that the air seal damper is still in place and not damaged or broken.

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: Cracks: No cracks permitted.
Nicks and/or dents: Acceptable to a maximum depth of 0.007 inch (0.18 mm) if damage is removed by blending to a maximum depth of 0.010 inch (0.25 mm).
Examine rear inner and rear outer cover attachment rivets. Replace rivets if loose or damaged.

procedure.title: Visual Checks
procedure.step: Examine area b for: Local erosion or oxidation is acceptable if the tip clearance is within limits (Ref. F&C 1225). Localized rubbing and raised material. Remove raised material. Make sure that air cooling holes are clear and unobstructed. Clear as necessary. Surface cracks starting at the cooling holes are acceptable provided that the cracks are not through going. Burnt material and/or surface distortion is not acceptable.
Examine feather seal slots for: Raised metal and sharp edges. Remove sharp edges. Local erosion is acceptable as long as the wall thickness is more than 0.025 inch (0.64 mm) in any one location.

Examine all other surfaces for: Raised metal and sharp edges. Remove sharp edges. Cracks 0.060 inch (1.52 mm) long maximum are acceptable. Rubbing or surface erosion 0.020 inch (0.51 mm) deep is acceptable.

procedure.title: Visual Check
procedure.step: Examine area(s) b for: Cracks. Non-converging hairline cracks are acceptable. Erosion. Erosion of area b is acceptable if the tip clearance is within limits (Ref. Fits and Clearances REF. NO. 1225). Cooling holes are clear and unobstructed. Clear as necessary. Surface cracks 0.020 inch (0.51 mm) deep starting at the cooling holes are acceptable. Cracks through the segment are not acceptable. Burnt material and/or surface distortion are not acceptable.
Examine area c for: Localized rubbing and raised material. Remove raised material.
Examine feather seal slots for: Raised metal and sharp edges. Stone to remove. Erosion. Local erosion is acceptable if wall thickness is more than 0.025 inch (0.64 mm) in any one location.

Examine all other surfaces for: Raised metal and sharp edges. Stone to remove. Cracks. Cracks 0.020 inch (0.51 mm) deep are acceptable . Rubbing or surface erosion. Damage 0.020 inch (0.51 mm) deep is acceptable.

row.entry: Segment, shroud, HP Turbine - First-stage (Fit to)
HP Turbine - First-stage Disk Assy (Fit to)

entry.note:
First Stage TurbineAcceptable rotor minimum diameter replacement. Grind leading edge of HPT1 blade at angle from a point 0.275 in. (6.985 mm) ± 0.030 in. (0.762 mm) from the trailing edge at blade tip measured normal to disc face, to reduce leading edge diameter by 0.004 in. (0.1016 mm) ± 0.002 in. (0.0508 mm) less than trailing edge (0.002 in. (0.0508 mm) ± 0.001 in. (0.0254 mm) on rad).
The selected shroud class is to be ground within 0.001 in. (0.0254 mm) of true position.
From the shroud measurement and fixed rotor diameter.The difference in diameter must be 0.064 in. (1.626 mm) ± 0.004 in. (0.102 mm) for HPT1. The average clearance is to be within the limits specified. The shroud segments are to be machined if necessary.

row.entry: Segment, shroud, HP Turbine - Second-stage (Fit to)
HP Turbine - Second-stage Disk Assy (Fit to)

entry.note:
Second Stage TurbineAcceptable rotor minimum diameter replacement. Grind leading edge of HPT2 blade at angle from a point 0.105 in. (2.667 mm) ± 0.030 in. (0.762 mm) from trailing edge at blade tip measured normal to disc face, to reduce leading edge diameter by 0.004 in. (0.1016 mm) ± 0.002 in. (0.0508 mm) less than trailing edge (0.002 in. (0.0508 mm) ± 0.001 in. (0.0254 mm) on rad).
The selected shroud class is to be ground within 0.001 in. (0.0254 mm) of true position.
From the shroud measurement and fixed rotor diameter.The difference in diameter must be 0.080 in. (2.032 mm) ± 0.010 in. (0.254 mm) for HPT2. The average clearance is to be within the limits specified. The shroud segments are to be machined if necessary.

row.entry: 25104Disk Balancing Assy - HP Turbine NOT APPLICABLE
25175 Blade - HPT, First-stagePlatform to Platform Gap

entry.note: Minimum must be maintained by selection on all gaps simultaneously.

row.entry: 25175 Blade - HPT, First-stagePlatform to Platform Gap

entry.note: Minimum must be maintained by selection on all gaps simultaneously.
Minimum must be maintained by selection on all gaps simultaneously.

row.entry: HPT Vane, First-stg, Recommended flow area limits

entry.note: Coat all bolt threads with anti-seize compound (PWC06-009) before torquing.
NOT APPLICABLE

procedure.title: Nut - Plain, Round
procedure.step: Lubricate threads and mating faces of nut, shaft and turbine disk with anti-seize compound (PWC06-009) prior to each tightening.
25104: Apply a seating load of 9940 to 10490 lbs. (44215 to 46662 N) on the rear cover plate without removing pressure.
Tighten nut to 2400 to 2640 lb.in. (271.2 to 298.3 Nm).
Hold torque and set needle to zero.
Turn nut thru angle of 50 degrees.
Trial fit keywasher in slots. If slots do not align, increase angle of turn until slots align. Do not exceed 55 degrees total.
Record final torque value and angle.

procedure.title: Fit Between HP Turbine Housing and Seal Rings
procedure.step: A 0.002 (0.051 mm) inch feeler gage must not pass between diameters. A 0.001 (0.0025 mm) inch feeler gage must not pass between these diameters thru an arc of more than 60 degrees total.

row.entry: Runout of this surface must not exceed 0.0015 inch (0.038 mm) FIR. The high point should not be more than 45 degrees max. either side of original high point mark.

procedure.title: Honeycomb Seal
procedure.step: Measure labyrinth seal to four decimal places. Record value.
25104: Add 0.006 inch (0.152 mm) to value recorded to get required final diameter.
25104: Add 0.018 inch (0.457 mm) to value recorded to get required final diameter.
Machine honeycomb seal.

procedure.title: Honeycomb Seal
procedure.step: Measure labyrinth seal to four decimal places. Record value.
25104: Add 0.006 inch (0.152 mm) to value recorded to get required final diameter.
25104: Add 0.018 inch (0.457 mm) to value recorded to get required final diameter.
Machine honeycomb seal.

procedure.title: Honeycomb Seal
procedure.step: Measure labyrinth seal to four decimal places. Record value.
25104: Add 0.012 inch (0.305 mm) to value recorded to get required final diameter.
25104: Add 0.010 inch (0.254 mm) to value recorded to get required final diameter.
Machine honeycomb seal.

procedure.title: Honeycomb Seal
procedure.step: Measure labyrinth seal to four decimal places. Record value.
25104: Add 0.012 inch (0.305 mm) to value recorded to get required final diameter.
25104: Add 0.010 inch (0.254 mm) to value recorded to get required final diameter.
Machine honeycomb seal.

entry.note: NOT APPLICABLE

general.para: The following section describes the removal and installation of the No. 4 bearing, LP turbine module and related parts.
Lubricate preformed packings, threads and mating surfaces with engine oil unless otherwise stated.
Install protective caps and plugs on disconnected tubes, component openings and electrical connectors after disassembly.

consumables.para: The consumable materials listed below are used in the following procedures.
Refer to INTRODUCTION for alternate products, suppliers and suppliers addresses.

special-tools.para: The special tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

n-para.title: No. 4 Bearing and Related Parts - Removal

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )

figure.title: Removal/Installation of No. 4 Bearing and Related Parts

procedure.step:
Remove
retaining ring (1) C35RR20-01 1 and
keywasher (2) C35RW03-01 1 .

Remove
LP shaft rear plug (3) C35RP26-01 1 using puller (PWC43263) or (PWC60765).

Remove and discard
preformed packings (4) C35RP03-01 2 .

Soak No. 4 bearing
retaining nut (5) C35RN05-02 1 with a 50/50 mixture of engine oil (PWC03-001) and fuel (PWC01-001).
Install adapter (PWC43266) into slots at end of LP shaft.
Slide socket (PWC43265) over adapter and engage lugs with slots in No. 4 bearing retaining nut (5).
Install adapter (PWC40781) on power wrench (PWC41050).
DO NOT EXCEED 11200 LB. IN. ON ADAPTER (PWC43266).Install power wrench on adapter and socket and remove No. 4 bearing retaining nut.

Loosen jaws of puller (PWC43267) and locate on front face of
No. 4 bearing inner race (7) C35NS33-01 1 . Secure jaws in place. Turn center bolt of puller to position pad on LP shaft.

PUT ON CLEAN LINT FREE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING BEARINGS PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Remove No. 4 bearing (7) and No. 4 bearing
Retaining ring (6) C35RR12A01 1 r together using puller PWC43267). Put bearing in a suitable clean container.

Remove
flanged sleeve spacer (8) C35NS33-01 1 using puller (PWC60766).

Remove
No. 4 bearing air seal (9) C35NS06-13 1 using puller (PWC43270).

procedure.title: Removal of Module (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove flange nuts.

Install LP compressor shaft pad (PWC43274) (1) into the
LP shaft (2) A13RS08-03
.
Install puller (PWC43272) (3), adapter (PWC71392) (4), hydraulic cylinder (PWC89837) (5) and hydraulic pump (PWC37807) (6).
MAKE SURE ALUMINUM RING OF LPT SLING IS PLACED ON THE REAR FACE OF THE FIFTH-STAGE ROTOR.Install the sling (8) (PWC60761).

Apply pressure with the hydraulic pump (PWC37807) (6) to release the
LPT module (7) C35RR13A06 1 .
Remove LPT module and place on holder (PWC43013).
Put protector (PWC61765) on LP shaft.

procedure.title: Installation of Module (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: MAKE SURE ALUMINUM RING FROM SLING IS PLACED ON REAR FACE OF 5TH-STAGE ROTOR (3RD-STAGE LPT).Install LPT sling (PWC60761) (1). Make sure the lifting eye of the sling is at the top.

Check dimension A as follows (Ref. Sheet 2): The required setting is 2.780 to 2.790 in. If necessary, obtain desired setting with bolt (2) and clamp (3). Once dim A is set lock rotor in position by tightening bolts (2) and knurled nut on clamp (3) hand tight.
If necessary use bolt (2) and clamp (3) to obtain desired setting.
Once dim. A is set, lock rotor in position by tightening bolts (2) and knurled nut on clamp (3) hand tight.
Install guide pin (PWC66686-2) or (PWC64241-6) (4) at top on the LPT rotor case.
Make sure seal rings (5) are installed and joints are staggered 180° apart. Apply sealant (PWC08-014) sparingly to the rings to hold in a compressed and central position.

DO NOT USE DRY ICE ON THE LP SHAFT.Connect the heater (PWC61006) to the TOOL output on the controller (PWC67176). The indicated temperature is equivalent to 300° to 310°F (148.9 to 154.4°C) at the front and rear spigot.
Install heater into rotor bore.
Turn the main power switch to ON.
Check that controller is set for 490° to 500°F (254.4 to 260°C).
Set the timer to 7 minutes.
Start heating by pressing the HEATER START button.
Start the timer using the START/RESET switch.
Remove heater from rotor.
Install LPT assembly onto fan shaft, aligning splines and guide pin.
MAKE SURE THE 3RD-STAGE VANE SEAL RINGS AND LP SHAFT SPLINES DO NOT INTERFERE WITH THE INSTALLATION OF THE LPT ASSEMBLY.Install LPT assembly on LP shaft.
Install adapter (PWC40700) (6), drift (PWC43271) (7), cylinder (PWC89837) (8), and pump (PWC37807) (9).
Make sure adapter is fully threaded on the LP shaft. Apply 2150 to 2250 psi (14,823.7-15,513.2 kPa) pressure. Make sure LPT assembly goes on smoothly.

Release pressure. Unlock bolts (2) and clamps (3) out of position. Re-apply 2150 to 2250 psi (14,823.7-15,513.2 kPa) pressure. Maintain pressure until rotor and shaft temperatures equalize to room temperature.
Remove tools.
Install 4 brackets (1, Fig. ) with 1 bolt (5) and 3 bolts (6).
Install bracket (2) with bolt (6).
Install bracket (3) with bolt (6).
Install bracket (4) with 2 bolts (5).
Install 25 remaining bolts (6).
Tighten all 31 bolts in a star pattern 85 to 95 lb.in. (9.6-10.7 Nm).
Re-tighten until no movement is observed.
Make sure flange is completely seated.

procedure.title: LPT Flange Hardware - Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
25337: Remove
bolt (2) C35NS06-04 1 and
bracket (11) F33LB40-01 1 (Ref. Section J-J). Remove bolt (2) and
terminal box (10) F33BB16-01 1 . Remove bolts (2) and
bracket (8) F50EB40A08 2 (Ref. Section G-G). Remove two
bolts (7) B22NB20-05 6 and
bracket (9) F33EB40-08 1 . Remove bolt (2) and
bracket (1) F33EB40-04 3 (Ref. Section F-F four places). Remove bolt (7) and bracket (1) (Ref. Section H-H). Remove bolts (6),
screws (5) F50AB20-44 2 ,
transducer (3) F50AS19-01 1 and lifting bracket (4). Remove remaining bolts (2).

25337: Remove bolt (2),
nut (12) A13EN05-01 6 and bracket (11) (Ref. Section J-J). Remove bolt (2), nut (12) and terminal box (10). Remove bolts (2), nuts (12) and bracket (8) (Ref. Section G-G). Remove two bolts (7), two nuts (12) and bracket (9). Remove bolt (2), nut (12) and bracket (1) (Ref. Section F-F four places). Remove bolt (7), nut (12) and bracket (1) (Ref. Section H-H). Remove bolts (6), nuts (12), screws (5), transducer (3) and lifting bracket (4). Remove remaining bolts (2) and nuts (12).

procedure.title: LPT Flange Hardware - Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
25337: Install four
brackets (1) F33EB40-04 3 with four
bolts (2) C35NS06-04 1 .

25337: Install four brackets (1) with four bolts (2) and four
nuts (12) A13EN05-01 6 .

Secure
transducer (3) F50AS19-01 1 to bracket (4) (PWC43443) with 3
capscrews (5) F50AB20-44 2 . Torque screws 13 to 15 lb. in. (1.5-1.7 Nm) and lockwire. Make sure pick-up and bracket mating surfaces are clean and free of burrs or raised material.

25337: Install bracket (4) on flange E at TDC with slave bolt (6). Torque bolts 85 to 95 lb. in. (9.6-10.7 Nm). Install bracket (1) with
bolt (7) B22NB20-05 6 . Install
bracket (8) F50EB40A08 2 with bolt (2). Install
bracket (9) F33EB40-08 1 with two bolts (7). Make sure T4.5 harness bracket is between flange E and bracket (9). Install
terminal box (10) F33BB16-01 1 with three bolts (2). Install
bracket (11) F33LB40-01 1 with bolt (2). Install 16 remaining bolts (2). Torque all 32 bolts in a star pattern 85 to 95 lb.in. Retorque until no movement is observed. Make sure flange is completely seated.

25337: Install bracket (4) on flange E at TDC with slave bolt (6) and nut (12). Torque bolts 85 to 95 lb. in. (9.6-10.7 Nm). Install bracket (1) with bolt (7) and nut (12). Install bracket (8) with bolt (2) and nut (12). Install bracket (9) with two bolts (7) and two nuts (12). Make sure T4.5 harness bracket is between flange E and bracket (9). Install terminal box (10) with three bolts (2) and three nuts (12). Install bracket (11) with bolt (2) and nut (12). Install remaining 16 bolts (2) and 16 nuts (12). Torque all 32 bolts in a star pattern 85 to 95 lb.in. Retorque until no movement is observed. Make sure flange is completely seated.

n-para.title: No. 4 Bearing and Related Parts - Installation

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Heat No. 4 bearing air seal (9) in oven at 204°C (400°F) for a 10 to 15 minutes.

DO NOT EXCEED MAXIMUM HYDRAULIC PRESSURE OF 1050 PSIG (7.2 kPa).Install No. 4 bearing air seal (9) with adapter (PWC40700), pusher (PWC43271), cylinder (PWC89837), and pump (PWC37807). Maximum cylinder pressure 950 to 1050 PSI. Maintain cylinder pressure until temperatures equalize. Remove tooling. Refer to Figure for correct air seal orientation.
PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Heat No. 4 bearing sleeve spacer (8) in oven at 204°C (400°F) for a minimum of 15 minutes.

DO NOT EXCEED MAXIMUM HYDRAULIC PUMP PRESSURE OF 1050 PSIG (7.2 kPa).Install sleeve spacer (8) with cylinder (PWC89837), pump (PWC37807), adapter (PWC40700) and pusher (PWC43271). Maintain cylinder pressure until temperatures equalize. Remove tooling. Refer to Figure for correct sleeve spacer orientation.
Make sure that you can see all No. 4 bearing oil lubrication holes on the LP shaft.

PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN YOU HANDLE HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY. PUT ON CLEAN, LINT FREE GLOVES WHEN YOU HANDLE BEARING.Heat the No. 4 bearing (7) in an oven pre-heated at 176 to 204°C (350 - 400°F) for 15 minutes minimum.
PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN YOU HANDLE HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Remove the No. 4 bearing (7) from oven.

MAKE SURE BEARING IS INSTALLED WITH SERIAL NUMBER FACING FORWARD. DO NOT EXCEED MAXIMUM HYDRAULIC PRESSURE OF 1050 PSIG (7.2 kPa).Install No. 4 bearing (7) with cylinder (PWC89837), pump (PWC37807), adapter (PWC40700) and pusher (PWC43271). Pressurize cylinder 950 to 1050 psi (6550 to 7239 kPa). Maintain cylinder pressure until temperatures equalize. Remove tooling. Refer to Figure for correct bearing orientation.
PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Heat fuel shut off phonic ring (6) in oven at 204°C (400°F) for 10 to 15 minutes.

DO NOT EXCEED MAXIMUM HYDRAULIC PRESSURE OF 1050 PSIG (7.2 kPa).Install phonic ring (6) with cylinder (PWC89837), pump (PWC37807) and adapter (PWC40700) and pusher (PWC43271). Pressurize cylinder 950 to 1050 PSI.
Maintain cylinder pressure and allow low compressor shaft to cool to room temperature.
Remove tooling from LP shaft.
Lubricate threads on low compressor shaft and retaining nut (5) with engine oil (PWC03-001).
Install retaining nut (5) and torque (Fits and Clearances, REF. NO. 1706) using adapter (PWC43266), socket (PWC43265), adapter (PWC40781), wrench (PWC41050).

DO NOT FORCE KEY WASHER INTO SLOTS. IF KEY WASHER DOES NOT ALIGN, REMOVE PLUG AND REINSTALL IN A DIFFERENT POSITION OR REINSTALL RETAINING NUT.Fit plug (3) in LP compressor shaft, without packings, to determine the correct locking position of key washer (2). Fit keywasher (2). Mark locking position on key washer, plug and nut using an approved marker. Remove keywasher and plug.
Lubricate and install two new preformed packings (4) on plug (3).
Install plug (3) in low compressor shaft with drift (PWC60764).
Install keywasher (2) and retaining ring (1).

entry.note: NOT APPLICABLE
NOT APPLICABLE
NOT APPLICABLE

procedure.title: Retaining Nut
procedure.step: Lubricate threads with engine oil.

DO NOT EXCEED 7800 LB. IN. (881.28 NM) TORQUE. IF THIS VALUE IS REACHED DURING ASSEMBLY, REMOVE NUT, CLEAN AND INSPECT FOR DAMAGE TO THE THREADS. IF HIGH TORQUE PERSISTS, CHECK ALL PARTS FOR BINDING OR EXCESSIVE INTERFERENCE FITS. CLEAN AND RE-APPLY OIL.Tighten nut 7200 to 7500 lb.in. (813.49-847.38 Nm) seating torque.
Loosen to zero.
Tighten nut 600 to 720 lb.in. (67.8-81.4 Nm).
Mark reference line between nut and mating part with marker (PWC05-018).
Turn nut thru angle of 39 to 41 degrees.
Loosen nut to zero and tighten again 600 to 720 lb.in. (67.8 to 81.4 Nm).
Reference line must be aligned within ±3 degrees max.
Turn nut thru angle of 39 to 41 degrees. Check alignment of keywasher slots. Nut may be turned 4.5 degrees max. more for alignment of keywasher.
If the reference points are not within limits (Ref. Step ), remove nut, clean all surfaces and repeat steps thru until within limits, then do step .

procedure.title: LP Rotor Trim Balancing (25330)
procedure.step: Correct 1EN1 vibration levels to 0.15 in/sec. As required by adding crimp counterweights ZA in plane ZB.A maximum of 10 counterweights may be added.Make sure all crimped counterweights ZA are attached at assembly.

entry.note: NOT APPLICABLE

figure.title: LP Turbine Module - Fits and Clearances

general.para: This section provides instructions and limits for inspection/check of the LP Turbines, Stators and Case.
It is recommended that a magnifying glass of at least 10X power be used when visually inspecting for damage.
Within the following text, where the term nicks or dents is used, unless otherwise specified, blend repair limits are applicable provided at least 70 percent of original surface remains undamaged.
Parts found unsuitable for further engine running should be replaced. Rejected parts should be returned to Pratt & Whitney Canada for complete inspection and possible repair/refurbishment.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Case
procedure.step: Examine for cracks. Reject if evident.
Examine for nicks or dents. Acceptable, with blending, to a maximum depth of 0.030 inch (0.8 mm).
Examine for evidence of isolated heat spots. Reject if evident.
Examine front and rear flanges for deformation. Reject if evident.
Examine clinch nuts for thread damage. Replace as necessary (Ref. 70-00-00, REPAIR).

procedure.title: General
procedure.step: Vane and/or blade deterioration is acceptable for continued service if component integrity is not effected, ie. no missing material, excessive damage, or airfoil distortion, and engine performance is within limits.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Vane Assembly (Ref. Fig. , and Table )
procedure.step:
Examine vanes to limits shown in Table .
Third-stage Vane Assembly - Inspection
Inspection AreaAcceptable Limits: Continue in service without additional inspection Acceptable Limits: Continue in service with additional inspection at or before 400 FHUnacceptable Limits: Replace vane within 100 FH
Leading Edge, A1 Nicks and dents: Up to 0.060 inch (1.5 mm) deep.Nicks and dents: Up to 0.080 inch (2.0 mm) deep.Nicks and dents: Up to 0.120 inch (3.0 mm) deep.
Cracks: Less than 0.120 inch (3.0 mm) long. One crack per airfoil less than 0.160 inch (4.1 mm) long.Cracks: Less than 0.160 inch (4.1 mm) long. One crack per airfoil less than 0.200 inch (5.1 mm) long.Converging Cracks: Less than 0.250 inch (6.4 mm) long. One crack per airfoil less than 0.300 inch (7.6 mm) long.
Vane stage 3 only: One crack per airfoil, less than 0.300 inch (7.6 mm) long, max. eight per vane ring.Vane stage 3 only: One crack per airfoil, less than 0.400 inch (10.2 mm) long, max. eight per vane ring.Vane stage 3 only: One crack per airfoil, less than 0.600 inch (15.2 mm) long, max. eight per vane ring.
Trailing Edge, A2Nicks and dents: Up to 0.030 inch (0.76 mm) deep.Nicks and dents: Up to 0.040 inch (1.0 mm) deep.Nicks and dents: Up to 0.060 inch (1.5 mm) deep.
Cracks: Less than 0.200 inch (5.1 mm) long. One crack per airfoil less than 0.300 inch (7.6 mm) long.Cracks: Less than 0.300 inch (7.6 mm) long. One crack per airfoil less than 0.350 inch (8.9 mm) long.Converging Cracks: Less than 0.400 inch (10.2 mm) long. One crack per airfoil less than 0.450 inch (11.4 mm) long.
Bends: Max. 12 per vane ring to a max. length of 25 percent of trailing edge and a max. deflection of 0.060 inch (1.5 mm).Bends: Not permitted.Bends: Max. 12 per vane ring or longer than 25 percent of trailing edge or deflection larger than of 0.060 inch (1.5 mm).
Tears: No tears acceptable.Tears: One per airfoil less than 0.100 inch (2.5 mm) long.Tears: More than one per airfoil or one longer than 0.100 inch (2.5 mm).
Airfoil, A3Cracks: Max. two per airfoil less than 0.100 inch (2.5 mm) long.Cracks: Max. three per airfoil less than 0.150 inch (3.8 mm) long.Cracks: Max. three per airfoil less than 0.200 inch (5.1 mm) long.
Inner and Outer Fillet Radius, A4Cracks: Less than 0.200 inch (5.1 mm) long. Max. 12 cracks per vane ring less than 0.300 (7.6 mm) long.Cracks: Less than 0.250 inch (6.4 mm) long. Max. 12 cracks per vane ring less than 0.350 (8.9 mm) long.Converging Cracks: Less than 0.300 inch (7.6 mm) long. Max. 12 cracks per vane ring less than 0.450 (11.4 mm) long.
Outer Shroud, A5Cracks: Less than 0.200 inch (5.1 mm) long. Max. eight per vane ring less than 0.300 inch (7.6 mm) long, if there is max. one crack between two airfoils.Cracks: Less than 0.300 inch (4.6 mm) long. Max. eight per vane ring less than 0.400 inch (10.2 mm) long, if there is max. one crack between two airfoils.Converging cracks: Less than 0.400 (10.2 mm) long. Max. eight per vane ring less than 0.600 inch (15.2 mm) long, if there is max. one crack between two airfoils.
Max. 12 horseshoe cracks per vane ring less than 0.300 inch (7.6 mm) long.Horseshoe cracks less than 0.400 inch (10.2 mm) long.Horseshoe cracks less than 0.600 inch (15.2 mm) long.
Vane Stage 3 Inner Shroud, A6Cracks: Any number of axial cracks and horseshoe cracks (cracks around airfoil root radii) up to 0.400 (10.2 mm) length.Cracks: Any number of axial cracks and horseshoe cracks less than 0.500 (12.7 mm) long.Cracks: Any number of axial cracks and horseshoe cracks less than 0.600 (15.2 mm) long.
Cracks in circumferential direction up to 0.120 (3.0 mm) length, if there are no converging cracks.Cracks in circumferential direction less than 0.160 (4.1 mm) long, if there are no converging cracks.Cracks in circumferential direction less than 0.200 (5.1 mm) long.
One axial through going crack and max. 10 axial cracks or horseshoe cracks up to 0.800 (20.3 mm) length (per vane ring), if: - there is max. one long crack between two airfoils. - long cracks extending to the rear edge of the shroud are separated by 3 or more airfoils. - max. 3 long cracks enter the airfoil (only in the rear half of the airfoil). - width of open cracks does not exceed 0.010 (0.25 mm). - cracks do not start to split off a piece (converging cracks). - the axial offset at the inner shroud (caused by the through going crack) does not exceed 0.004 (0.10 mm).One axial through going crack and max. 12 axial cracks or horseshoe cracks up to 1.000 (25.4 mm) length (per vane ring), if: - there is max. one long crack between two airfoils. - long cracks extending to the rear edge of the shroud are separated by 3 or more airfoils. - max. 4 long cracks enter the airfoil (only in the rear half of the airfoil). - width of open cracks does not exceed 0.012 (0,30 mm). - cracks do not start to split off a piece (converging cracks).Two axial through going crack and max. 15 axial cracks or horseshoe cracks up to 1.200 (30.5 mm) length (per vane ring), if: - there is max. one long crack between two airfoils. - max. 4 long cracks enter the airfoil (only in the rear half of the airfoil). - width of open cracks does not exceed 0.012 (0.30 mm). - cracks do not start to split off a piece (converging cracks).
Vane Stage 5 Inner Shroud, A6Cracks: Less than 0.200 inch (5.1mm) long. Max. 12 cracks per vane ring less than 0.300 inch (7.6 mm) long, if there is max. one crack between two airfoils.Cracks: Less than 0.300 inch (7.6 mm) long. Max. 12 cracks per vane ring less than 0.400 inch (10.2 mm) long, if there is max. one crack between two airfoils.Converging Cracks: Less than 0.400 inch (10.2mm) long. Max. 12 cracks per vane ring less than 0.600 inch (15.2 mm) long, if there is max. one crack between two airfoils.
Max. 12 horseshoe cracks per vane ring less than 0.300 inch (7.6 mm).Horseshoe cracks less than 0.400 inch (10.2 mm) long.Horseshoe cracks less than 0.600 inch (15.2 mm) long.
Vane airfoil (surface protection only at stage 3 and 4). Note : Sulfidation appears as a green to pale blue color.Slight discoloration and local loss of coating. Local pitting.Sulfidation over less than 40 percent of airfoil surface, if there are no blisters or loss of basic material.Sulfidation over more than 40 percent of airfoil surface, or with blisters / loss of basic material.
Examine bosses for cracks. Cracks are acceptable to a maximum length of 0.120 inch (3.0 mm).
Examine for loose or damaged air seal/seal ring retaining rivets. Reject assembly if loose.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Rotor Hub (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Examine for cracks. Reject if evident.
Examine for nicks or dents. Reject if evident.

Examine for evidence of damage to internal spline as follows: Corrosion and/or indentations on involute surface. Damage is acceptable to 0.005 inch (0.01 mm) deep. Improper tooth contact pattern, pitting, spalling, chipping or wear. Reject if evident. Axial scores to 0.005 inch (0.01 mm) deep are acceptable. Remove raised metal and/or sharp edges. Examine for nicks or dents. Reject if evident.
Examine for fretting on Faces A and/or B. Light fretting is acceptable. Remove raised metal and/or sharp edges.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Disk
procedure.step: Inspect for cracks. Reject assembly if evident.
Inspect for nicks or dents. Reject assembly if evident.
Inspect for cracked or deformed blade retaining rivets. Reject assembly if evident.

procedure.title: General
procedure.step: Vane and/or blade deterioration is acceptable for continued service if component integrity is not effected, ie. no missing material, excessive damage, or airfoil distortion, and engine performance is within limits.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Fifth-stage Blades (Ref. Fig. , and Table )
procedure.step: Examine blades to limits shown.

row.entry: Acceptable Limits: Continue in Service with inspection at the regular interval.
Acceptable Limits: Continue in Service with additional inspection at or before 400 FH *.
Unacceptable Limits: component replacement within 50 FH.
All areas of the blades stage 3, 4 and 5
Cracks: Not permitted except in A7 and A8.
Pitting, dents and nicks without sharp edges: Less than 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) deep.
Pitting, dents and nicks without sharp edges: Less than 0.015 inch (0.38 mm) deep.
One FOD damage per blade without sharp edges: Up to 0.020 inch (0.50 mm) deep.
Pitting, dents, and nicks with sharp edges: Less than 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep.
Pitting, dents, and nicks with sharp edges: Up to 0.008 inch (0.20 mm) deep.
One FOD damage per blade with sharp edges: Up to 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) deep.
Erosion and oxidation: Local erosion or oxidation that does not affect parent metal.
Erosion and oxidation: Local leading edge erosion or oxidation associated with minor parent mental loss.
Sulfidation: Sulfidation is not permitted. Slight discoloration and local loss of coating is permitted.
Sulfidation: Over less than 40 percent airfoil surface, if there are no blisters or loss of basic material.
Sulfidation: Over more than 40 percent of airfoil surface, or with blisters / minimal loss of basic material.
Airfoil area of the blades stage 5
Pitting, dents and nicks: Less than 0.004 inch (0.10 mm) deep.
Pitting, dents and nicks: Less than 0.006 inch (0.15 mm) deep.
One FOD damage per blade: Up to 0.008 inch (0.20 mm) deep.
Leading Edge, A7 and Trailing Edge, A8
Cracks: One crack per blade less than 0.040 inch (1.0 mm) long, if not more than 5 blades are affected.
Bends: One on trailing edge to a max. length of 25 percent of trailing edge and a max. deflection of 0.015 inch. (0.38 mm), if not more than 5 blades are affected.
Bends: More than one bend on the trailing edge or longer than 25 percent of trailing edge or a deflection of more than 0.015 inch. (0.38 mm) or more than 5 blades affected.
Inner and Outer Fillet Radii, A9
Nicks and dents: Less than 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep.
One FOD damage per blade: Up to 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) deep.

entry.note: * Subsequent borescope inspection must be carried out at intervals depending upon the rate of progression and the level of deterioration seen.

procedure.title: Visual Check (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Examine contact surfaces, fourth-stage disk area A, spacer area B and bearing contact area C: Nicks and/or dents are acceptable up to 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) deep, 0.040 inch (1.01 mm) wide and at least 0.050 inch (1.27 mm) apart. Remove sharp edges. Restore surface smoothness. Axial scores are acceptable, except in area C, up to 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep, 0.010 (0.25 mm) wide and at least 0.100 inch (2.54 mm) apart. Remove raised metal. Axial scores are acceptable in area C, up to 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep. Remove raised metal. Circumferential scores are acceptable up to 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep, 0.010 (0.25 mm) wide and at least 0.100 inch (2.54 mm) apart. Corrosion pitting is acceptable up to 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep. Remove raised metal. Restore surface smoothness.
Examine splines: Nicks, burrs and/or galling are acceptable up to 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) deep. Remove raised metal. Restore surface smoothness.

general.para: The following section describes the removal and installation of the exhaust case assembly and the No. 4 bearing assembly. This procedure is intended for use during Heavy Maintenance.
Lubricate preformed packings, threads and mating surfaces with engine oil unless otherwise stated.
Install protective caps and plugs on disconnected tubes, component openings and electrical connectors after disassembly.

consumables.para: The consumable materials listed below are used in the following procedures.
Refer to INTRODUCTION for alternate products, suppliers, and suppliers addresses.

special-tools.para: The special tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

key.def: Rear Inner Bypass Duct Support Bracket (25294)

procedure.title: Procedure (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: DO NOT ROTATE ENGINE MORE THAN 10 DEGREES FROM HORIZONTAL POSITION.
procedure.step:
Mark top center position of
exhaust case (1) D36NC05A05 1 with an approved marker.

25294: At location A, six places, remove
nuts (2) D36NN05-12 48 ,
bolts (4) D36NB20-16 D36NB20-16 28,18 and
