(7) F22JB40-02 2 and
(8) F50EB40-15 1 from flange F. At location D, remove nuts (2), bolts (4) and
bracket (5) F22FB40-02 1 from flange F. At location E, two places, remove nuts (2), bolts (4) and
bracket (3) F50EB40-07
from flange F. At location G, remove nut (2), bolt (4) and bracket (6) from flange F. At location H, remove nut (2), bolt (4) and
bracket (9) F22JB40-01 2 from flange F. At location J, remove nut (2), bolt (4) and bracket (6) from flange F. At location K, remove nut (2), bolt (4) and bracket (6) from flange F.

25294: At location A, six places, remove
nuts (2) D36NN05-12 48 ,
bolts (4) D36NB20-16 D36NB20-16 28,18 ,
washers (11) F35EW03-05 21 and
brackets (10) F50EB40A10 12 . At location B, three places, remove nuts (2) and
(15) F50EN05-77 16 , bolts (4) and
(16) F50EB20-84 16 , washers (11),
loop clamps (13) F50EC07-98 16 ,
grommets (14) F50EG17-37 16 and brackets (10) and
(12) F50NB40-05 16 from flange F. At location C, two places, remove nuts (2), bolts (4) and brackets
(7) F22JB40-02 2 and
(8) F50EB40-15 1 from flange F. At location D, remove nuts (2), bolts (4) and
bracket (5) F22FB40-02 1 from flange F. At location E, two places, remove nuts (2), bolts (4), washers (11) and brackets (10) from flange F. At location F, 10 places, remove bolts (4 and 16), nuts (2 and 15), loop clamps (13), grommets (14) and brackets (12) from flange F. At location G, remove nuts (2 and 15), bolts (4 and 16), washer (11), loop clamp (13), grommet (14) and brackets (10 and 12) from flange F. At location H, remove bolts (4 and 16), nuts (2 and 15), loop clamps (13), grommets (14) and brackets (12) from flange F. At location J, remove nuts (2), bolts (4), washer (11) and brackets (10 and 12) from flange F. At location K, remove nuts (2 and 15), bolts (4 and 16), brackets (10 and 12), loop clamp (13) and grommet (14) from flange F.

REMOVE EXHAUST CASE EVENLY. MAKE SURE NO DAMAGE OCCURS TO CARBON SEAL OR SEAL CARRIER.Install lifter (PWC60927) and separate exhaust case with four jacking screws (PWC32396-100) on flange F at location L.
Remove exhaust duct assembly and place on a clean working surface.
Remove lifter and jacking screws.

procedure.title: Procedure (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.note: Inspect the exhaust case without stripping the assembly. If it is necessary to inspect the No. 4 bearing area, disassemble the exhaust case as required.
procedure.step:
Index mark
seal carrier assembly (6) A13NC04-02
to
exhaust case (1) D36NC05A05 1 with an approved marker.

Remove
retaining ring (5) A13RR20-03 1 .
25273: Install cylinder (10) (PWC89837) and puller (PWC60134).
25273: Install cylinder (10) (PWC89837) and puller (9) (PWC63135).
Connect pump (11) (PWC37807) to cylinder and remove seal carrier (6).

PUT ON CLEAN LINT FREE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING BEARINGS PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Remove
retaining ring (4) A13NR20-01 1 and
No. 4 bearing outer race (3) A13RB06-01 1 . Remove and discard
sealing rings (2) A13NS06-01 A13NS06-01 1,1 .

Remove
oil nozzle (7) D36LN04-01 1 and withdraw
oil strainer element (8) D36LS51A01 1 .

procedure.title: Removal from Seal Carrier Assembly (25273) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.note: The seal carrier assembly can be inspected without disassembly. If damage is noted, disassemble seal carrier.
procedure.step:
Mount
seal carrier assembly (1) A13NC04-02
on base (PWC43582).

Remove
retaining ring (2) A13NR20-01 1 from
seal carrier (1) A13NC04-02
.

Remove
carbon seal (3) A13NS05-02 1 from seal carrier with puller (PWC43580).

procedure.title: Removal from Seal Carrier Assembly (25273) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.note: The seal carrier assembly can be inspected without disassembly. If damage is noted, disassemble seal carrier.
procedure.step: Remove the retaining ring (2) from seal carrier (1).
Make three reference marks on the outside of the carrier in line with the center of the inner scallops and the three oil holes.

MAKE SURE THAT THE REFERENCE MARKS ARE ALIGNED BEFORE APPLYING PRESSURE OTHERWISE THE CARRIER WILL BE DAMAGED.Put the seal carrier assembly in the base (part of PWC63410). Align the reference marks on the carrier with the three reference lines on the base (part of PWC63410).
Install drift (part of PWC63410) into position, turn the top of drift and install the cylinder (PWC89837).

Connect pump (PWC37807) (6) to cylinder (PWC89837) and remove
carbon seal (3) A13NS05-02 1 from seal carrier (1). Discard the carbon seal (3).

procedure.title: Installation in Seal Carrier (25273) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
HANDLE CARBON SEAL WEARING CLEAN, LINT-FREE GLOVES.Lubricate faces of
No. 4 bearing carbon seal (3) A13NS05-02 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001), place in a plastic bag and put bag in freezer at -40°F (-40°C).

WEAR HEAT RESISTANT GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS.Place
seal carrier (1) A13NR20-01 1 in oven at 400°F (204°C) for 15 minutes minimum.

WEAR HEAT RESISTANT GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS.Remove
seal carrier (1) A13NR20-01 1 from oven and place in base (PWC43582).

Remove
No. 4 bearing carbon seal (3) A13NS05-02 1 from freezer and install carbon seal (3) in seal carrier, serial number up, with drift (PWC43581).

Install
retaining ring (2) A13NR20-01 1 .
Make sure that the carbon seal was not damaged during installation.

procedure.title: Installation in Seal Carrier (25273) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING COLD PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY. PUT ON CLEAN LINT FREE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING CARBON SEAL.Lubricate the faces of
No. 4 bearing carbon seal (3) A13NS05-02 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001), place in a plastic bag and put bag in freezer at -40°F (-40°C).

PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Place
seal carrier (1) A13NC04-02
in oven at 400°F (204°C) for 15 minutes minimum.

PUT ON PROTECTIVE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING HOT PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Remove
seal carrier (1) A13NC04-02
from oven and place in base (PWC63224).

Remove No. 4 bearing carbon seal (3) from freezer and install carbon seal (3) on the drift (PWC63141) (5), seal against the upper flange of drift and serial number up with drift (PWC63141) (5). Freeze the seal and drift before the installation of seal on the drift.
Install No. 4 carbon seal (3) in the carrier with the drift (PWC63141) (5) and base (PWC63224) (4).
Install retaining ring (2).
Make sure that the carbon seal was not damaged during installation.

procedure.title: Procedure (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Install
strainer (8) D36LS51A01 1 in exhaust case.

Lubricate threads of
oil nozzle (7) D36LN04-01 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001), install and torque 175 to 195 lbf.in. (19.8-22.0 Nm) (REF. NO. 1709, Fits and Clearances).

PUT ON CLEAN LINT FREE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING BEARINGS PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Lubricate two
seal rings (2) A13NS06-01 2 with engine oil (PWC03-001)and install on
No. 4 bearing outer race (3) A13RB06-01 1 . Make sure seal ring joints are staggered 180 degrees apart.

PUT ON CLEAN LINT FREE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING BEARINGS PARTS TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY.Lubricate No. 4 bearing outer race (3) with engine oil (PWC03-001)and install into
turbine exhaust case (1) D36NC05A05 1 , with serial number facing upwards. Make sure anti-rotation lug on bearing engages with exhaust case.

Install
retaining ring (4) A13NR20-01 1 .
Locally heat exhaust case bore for a minimum of 15 minutes with a heat gun.

Clean mating surfaces of
carrier (6) A13NC04-02
and exhaust case (1) with cloth dampened in solvent (PWC11-014).
PUT ON CLEAN LINT FREE GLOVES WHEN HANDLING CARBON SEAL PART TO PREVENT PERSONAL INJURY. DO NOT IMMERSE CARBON SEAL IN ANY CLEANING FLUIDS.25273: Apply a thin coat of engine oil (PWC03-001) to seal.

25273: Apply a thin and even coat of locking and retaining compound (PWC09-002) around Area C of the
seal carrier assembly (6) A13NC04-02
.
25273: Do not use locking compound. Clean the mating surfaces again with a clean lint-free cloth soaked with solvent (PWC11-014) and allow to dry.

Heat exhaust case - Method A: Install heater (PWC61437) in
exhaust case (1) D36NC05A05 1 , and attach controller (PWC60136). Set timer to eight minutes, start heater and timer. Heater is preset to 490 to 500°F (254-260°C).

Heat exhaust case - Method B: Install heater (PWC40538) (10) and heating gun (PWC69269) (9) in to the turbine exhaust case (13). Set heat gun dial to 7. Heat the bore of turbine exhaust case for 12 to 15 minutes.
25273: When time is up remove heater and install carrier seal assembly (6) in exhaust case with drift (PWC43584).

25273: When time is up remove heater and install
carrier seal assembly (6) A13NC04-02
in exhaust case with drift (11) (PWC63134).
25273: Remove any excess traces of locking and retaining compound (PWC09-002). Make sure that no compound in contact with the carbon seal element.

Install
retaining ring (5) A13RR20-03 1 .

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove 12
screws (2) D36NB20-17 12 .

Remove
exhaust cone (3) D36NC15-01 1 from exhaust case flange (4). The emergency fuel shut-off valve upper mechanism can be inspected without disassembly. If damage is noted, disassemble the mechanism (Ref. Subpara. ).

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Apply a thin film of anti-seize compound (PWC06-009) to threads of
screws (2) D36NB20-17 12 .

Align holes and install
exhaust cone (3) D36NC15-01 1 on exhaust case flange (4).
Install screws (2) and torque 18 to 22 lb.in. (2-2.4 Nm).

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.note: It is not normally required to disconnect or to remove the overspeed control linkage.
procedure.step:
Remove
cotterpin (12) D36NP04-03 2 ,
washer (11) D36NW03-01 2 ,
pin (10) D36NP04-01 1 and
control rod (13) D36NR11A01 1 from
lever (9) D36NL02-01 1 . Discard cotterpin.

Remove cotterpin (12), washer (11),
pin (14) D36NP04-01 1 and control rod (13) from
bellcrank (15) D36NC15-03 1 . Discard cotterpin.

Remove control rod (13) from
exhaust case (1) D36NC05A05 1 through port in strut at
bellcrank mounting bracket (16) D36NB40-03 1 .

If required, remove remaining overspeed control linkage: Remove
nut (2) D36NN05-06 1 ,
bolt (5) D36NB20-06 1 and
sleeve (4) D36NS33-05 1 from
retaining block (3) D36NR03-01 1 .
IF OVERSPEED CONTROL PIN IS REMOVED FOR ANY REASON, RETAINING BLOCK MUST BE REMOVED THEN REINSTALLED AS PART OF OVERSPEED CONTROL PIN DIMENSIONING PROCEDURE (REF. PARA. ).Remove lever (9) and
pin (8) D36NP04-02 1 . Remove and inspect
ring seal (6) D36NS06-01 1 . If required, remove two
bolts (7) D36NB20-05 1 and retaining block (3).

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: IF OVERSPEED CONTROL PIN IS REMOVED FOR ANY REASON, RETAINING BLOCK MUST BE REMOVED THEN REINSTALLED AS PART OF OVERSPEED CONTROL PIN DIMENSIONING PROCEDURE.
procedure.step:
If required, fasten
bellcrank mounting bracket (16) D36NB40-03 1 to mounting bosses on
exhaust case (1) D36NC05A05 1 with three
bolts (20) D36NB20-07 3 . Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

If removed, install
bellcrank (15) D36NC15-03 1 to bracket (16) with
bolt (17) D36NB20-08 1 and
nut (18) D36NN05-07 1 . Torque nut 65 to 85 lb.in. (7.3-9.6 Nm) and install
cotterpin (19) D36NP04-04 1 .

Check pin clearance (REF. NO. 1282, Table 601) as follows: Make sure LP shaft is loaded rearward, direction AB. Measure and record dimension Y without
pin (8) D36NP04-02 1 installed. Spray wash existing pin (8) with solvent (PWC11-027) and allow to air dry. Measure and record
retaining block (3) D36NR03-01 1 dimension X. Measure length of pin (8) with gage (PWC60995). Record dimension AC. Calculate length of pin (8) required, dimension AC, ± 0.004 inch (0.10 mm) to achieve pin clearance (AC = X + Y - Ref. No. 1282). Grind new or existing pin (8) to required length, dimension AC. Pin must have a surface finish of 32 micro inches or better. Break sharp edges 0.004 to 0.020 inch (0.10 to 0.51 mm). Remove material from tip only.

Install serviceable
ring seal (6) D36NS06-01 1 in overspeed linkage pin bore.

Install pin (8) into retaining block (3). Install retaining block and two
bolts (7) D36NB20-05 1 . Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm). Do not install retaining block in exhaust case before pin is installed in retaining block.

Install fork on
lever (9) D36NL02-01 1 over head of pin (8).

Fasten lever (9) to retaining block with
sleeve spacer (4) D36NS33-05 1 ,
bolt (5) D36NB20-06 1 and
nut (2) D36NN05-06 1 . Torque nut to 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Insert
control rod (13) D36NR11A01 1 through exhaust case port at bellcrank mounting bracket (16).

Fasten control rod (13) to lever (9) with
pin (10) D36NP04-01 1 ,
washer (11) D36NW03-01 2 and
cotterpin (12) D36NP04-03 2 .

Fasten control rod (13) to bellcrank (15) with
pin (14) D36NP04-01 1 , washer (11) and cotterpin (12).
Adjust bolt (7) to obtain lever locating dimension (Fits and Clearances REF. NO. 1281) and fasten with nut (6). Torque nut (6) 75 to 85 lb.in. (8.5-9.6 Nm) and install lockwire (PWC05-089).

Check pin and linkage installation: Push bellcrank (15) fully rearward to eliminate tension in linkage. Resistance felt when moving bellcrank rearward and forward is friction of pin (8) as it moves through ring seal (6). With a suitable load gage applied to open bellcrank gap, check for a force of 18 to 45 lb.in. (80-200 Nm) when bellcrank is moved to fully forward position.

procedure.title: Procedure (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Install lifter (PWC60927).
Lubricate faces of No. 4 bearing carbon seal with engine oil (PWC03-001).

Align top center mark of
exhaust case (1) D36NC05A05 1 with mark on flange F of LP turbine assembly. Align flange locating pin and install exhaust case.

25294: At location A, six places, install
brackets (6) F50EB40-05 1 ,
bolts (4) D36NB20-16 D36NB20-16 28,18 and
nuts (2) D36NN05-12 48 on flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. At location B, three places, install brackets (6), bolts (4) and nuts (2) on flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. At location C, two places, install brackets
(7) F22JB40-02 2 and
(8) F50EB40-15 1 , bolts (4) and nuts (2) from flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. At location D, install
bracket (5) F22FB40-02 1 , bolts (4) and nuts (2) on flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. At location E, two places, install
bracket (3) F50EB40-07
, bolts (4) and nuts (2) on flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. At location G, install bracket (6), bolt (4) and nut (2) on flange F. Tighten bolt with your fingers. At location H, install
bracket (9) F22JB40-01 2 , bolt (4) and nut (2) on flange F. Tighten bolt with your fingers. At location J, install bracket (6), bolt (4) and nut (2) on flange F. Tighten bolt with your fingers. At location K, install bracket (6), bolt (4) and nut (2) on flange F. Tighten bolt with your fingers. Install remaining 15 bolts (4) and 15 nuts (2). Tighten bolts with your fingers. Torque bolts (4) 85 to 95 lb. in. (9.6-10.7 Nm) in a star pattern.

25294: At location A, six places, install
brackets (10) F50EB40A10 12 ,
bolts (4) D36NB20-16 D36NB20-16 28,18 ,
washers (11) F35EW03-05 21 and
nuts (2) D36NN05-12 48 on flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. At location B, three places, install brackets (10) and
(12) F50NB40-05 16 , bolts (4) and
(16) F50EB20-84 16 , washers (11),
loop clamps (13) F50EC07-98 16 ,
grommets (14) F50EG17-37 16 and nuts (2) and
(15) F50EN05-77 16 on flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. At location C, two places, install brackets
(7) F22JB40-02 2 and
(8) F50EB40-15 1 , bolts (4) and nuts (2) on the flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. At location D, install
bracket (5) F22FB40-02 1 , bolts (4) and nuts (2) on flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. At location E, two places, install brackets (10), washers (11), bolts (4) and nuts (2) on flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. At location F, 10 places, install brackets (12), loop clamps (13), grommets (14), bolts (4 and 16) and nuts (2 and 15) on flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. At location G, install brackets (10 and 12), bolts (4 and 16), washer (11), loop clamp (13), grommet (14) and nuts (2 and 15) on flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. At location H, install bracket (12), bolts (4 and 16), loop clamp (13), grommet (14) and nuts (2 and 15) on flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. At location J, install brackets (10 and 12), bolts (4), washer (11) and nuts (2) on flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. Adjust bracket (12) as necessary, to maintain 0.080 inch minimum clearance between guide tube and cowl support brackets (10). At location K, install bracket (10 and 12), bolts (4 and 16), loop clamp (13), grommet (14) and nuts (2 and 15) on flange F. Tighten bolts with your fingers. Adjust brackets (12) as necessary, to maintain 0.080 inch minimum clearance between guide tube and cowl support brackets (10). Install remaining bolts (4) and nuts (2). Tighten bolts with your fingers. Torque bolts (4 and 16) 85 to 95 lb. in. (9.6-10.7Nm) in a star pattern.
Torque all nuts (2) 85 to 95 lb.in. (9.6-10.7 Nm) in a star pattern.
Remove lifter, and install engine mounts (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

general.para: This section provides instructions and limits for inspection/check of the exhaust case assembly.
It is recommended that a magnifying glass of at least 10X power be used when visually inspecting for damage.
Within the following text, where the term nicks or dents is used, unless otherwise specified, blend repair limits are applicable provided at least 70 percent of original surface remains undamaged.
Parts found unsuitable for further engine running should be replaced. Rejected parts should be returned to Pratt & Whitney Canada for complete inspection and possible repair/refurbishment.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Case
procedure.step: Inspect for cracks. Cracks are acceptable within the following limits: Strut leading and trailing edge, cracks acceptable to a maximum length of 0.250 inch (6.4 mm) provided cracks are non-converging. Strut inner and outer fillet radii, cracks acceptable to a maximum length of 0.120 inch (3.0 mm) provided cracks are non-converging. Welded seams; cracks acceptable to a maximum length of 0.120 inch (3.0 mm) provided cracks are separated by a minimum of 2.0 inches (50.8 mm) and are non-converging. Cracks acceptable to a maximum length of 0.250 inch (6.4 mm) provided cracks are separated by a minimum of 6.0 inches (152.4 mm) and are non-converging.
Visually inspect No. 4 bearing external pressure and scavenge oil tubes for cracks and corrosion. Reject exhaust case if any cracks or corrosion is found.
Nicks and dents are acceptable to a maximum depth of 0.030 inch (0.76 mm).
Reject exhaust case if any corrosion, isolated heat spots or deformed flanges are found.

procedure.title: Visual Check of Heat Shield, Mixer and Cone
procedure.step: Inspect for cracks in welded seams as follows: Cracks acceptable to a maximum length of 0.120 inch (3.0 mm) provided cracks are separated by a minimum of 2.0 inches (50.8 mm) and are non-converging. Cracks acceptable to a maximum length of 0.250 inch (6.4 mm) provided cracks are separated by a minimum of 6.0 inches (152.4 mm) and are non-converging.
If cracks are found in other areas, reject exhaust case.
Nicks and dents are acceptable to a maximum depth of 0.015 inch (0.38 mm).
If isolated heat spots are found, reject component.

procedure.title: Visual Check of No. 4 Bearing Oil Nozzle
procedure.step: Check nozzle and strainer for damage or blockage. Reject if any damage is found.

procedure.title: Visual Check of No. 4 Bearing Carbon Seal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: CARBON SEALS ARE EASILY DAMAGED. BE CAREFUL WHEN HANDLING .
procedure.step: Examine outer case for: Cracks. Reject seal if evident. Nicks, burrs up to a maximum of 0.005 inch deep is acceptable. Remove raised metal and sharp edges.
Examine carbon sealing ring for cracks or deterioration. Reject if evident.
Examine dia. A for nicks, chips or scratches. Acceptable up to a maximum of 0.005 inch deep provided a continuous band at least 50 percent of original seal width remains undamaged.
Examine side faces and chamfers. Nicks, chips and scratches are acceptable provided the sealing in the housing is not affected.

TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO SEAL, AVOID EXCESSIVE RADIAL MOVEMENT.Check operation of seal in case. Movement should be smooth without sticking or binding. Carry out dimensional inspection if oil leaks are evident.
Dimensionally check Dia. A using a bore gage employing air gap principle or equivalent. Acceptable provided dimension does not exceed specified limits (F & C REF. NO. 1175).
Dimensionally check remainder of carbon seal (F & C REF. NO. 1176).

procedure.title: Check Fuel Shut-off Mechanism (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Inspect complete fuel shut-off mechanism for freedom of movement and correct operation. Particular attention must be directed to the No. 4 bearing housing shut-off pin, exhaust case connecting rod and shut-off cable to ensure operation without interference or contaminate build up.
Remove the exhaust cone.
Check the operation of the pin by moving the control rod up maximum deflection.
Check for cracks. Reject if found.
Nicks and dents are acceptable to a maximum depth of 0.005 inch (0.13 mm).

subpara.title: General
subpara.para: The following pages provide the fits and clearances, torques, spring pressures, special assembly, and backlash checks.
All tables have metric equivalents given in parentheses either beside or below the imperial measurements.
For all tables, the indicated REF. NO. can be found on the Figure following the last table.

subpara.title: Dimensional Checks
subpara.para: The DIMENSIONS FOR REF. column indicates minimum and maximum manufacturing dimensions of two mating parts. These dimensions are provided for information only.
The LIMITS column indicates the desired minimum and maximum fits and clearances between new parts, and also the allowable limit to which these parts may wear before replacement is necessary.
The letter T indicates a tight fit; L or no letter, a loose fit.
BY SELECTION means parts must be matched by selection to provide a required fit.
FIT TO means a fitting operation may be required at assembly to obtain the required fit.
An asterisk (*) indicates part(s) should be replaced if any looseness is evident.
Unless otherwise stated, all fits are diametrical. Spline fits are calculated from chordal dimensions.

row.entry: Carrier - Seal, No. 4 Brg, Assy Of

procedure.title: Lubricating Nozzle
procedure.step: Lubricate with engine oil and tighten to 175 to 195 lbf.in. (19.8-22.0 Nm).

module.pageblock-title: ACCESSORY GEARBOX ASSEMBLY - DESCRIPTION AND OPERATION

n-para.title: Accessory Gearbox and Towershaft Section
n-para.para: The accessory gearbox is mounted below the engine on the intermediate casing, and is driven through an angled towershaft passing through the 6 o'clock strut of the intermediate casing. The splines of the towershaft engage bevel gears at both ends, the upper gear meshing with the bevel gear on the high pressure compressor rotor shaft, and the lower gear meshing with the bevel gear on the starter-generator driveshaft in the accessory gearbox. Two N2 speed sensor units, located in the accessory gearbox casing (RH side), pick up N2 speed signal pulses from a spur gear on the alternator driveshaft.

n-para.title: Accessory Gearbox Assembly (Ref. Figs. and )
n-para.para: The accessory gearbox consists of a cast magnesium housing with a rear cover. An airframe-supplied starter-generator mounts on the starter-generator pad of the housing, and connects with the gearbox main shaft assembly. The main shaft assembly is supported by a plain bearing at the front of the housing and a ball thrust bearing in the gearbox cover at the rear. The main shaft has an integral spur gear which drives two gears supported by identical plain bearings in the housing and cover. Garter seals and retaining rings are mounted on the ends of all shafts. Oil trays installed in the housing reduce foaming. The alternating current (AC) generator mounts on a pad on the left of the gearbox cover and the hydro-mechanical metering unit (HMU), which houses the cartridge-type fuel pump, mounts to the AC generator. The AC generator provides power to EEC. The right-hand pad on the cover provides for mounting of an airframe-supplied hydraulic pump.

The AC generator gearshaft drives a spur gear which, in turn, drives the pressure and scavenge oil pump assemblies mounted on the outer and inner left-hand side of the housing, respectively. The alternator shaft, which is driven by the hydraulic pump shaft, incorporates an oil-air separator. An integral spur gear on the alternator shaft is the pulse generator gear supplying high-pressure rotor speed signals to two speed sensors. The speed sensors are radially located in the right-hand side of the accessory gearbox casing.

A chip detector is installed at the bottom of the gearbox casing. The chip detector provides an indication of ferrous particles in the lubrication system when a continuity check is performed. Provisions exist for airframe wiring to provide in-flight indication of contamination.

Pressure oil for the lubrication of the accessory gearbox bearing is routed via a transfer tube from the intermediate case and passes through integral passageways in the housing and cover. An engine data plate is riveted onto the engine identification plate installed at the underside of the accessory gearbox housing.

general.para: Lubricate preformed packings, threads and mating surfaces with engine oil unless otherwise stated.
Install protective caps and plugs on disconnected tubes, component openings and electrical connectors after disassembly.

consumables.para: The consumable materials listed below are used in the following procedures.
Refer to CONSUMABLE MATERIALS section for alternate products, suppliers and suppliers addressess.

special-tools.para: The special tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

fixtures-and-equipment.para: The fixtures, equipment and supplier tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

figure.title: Accessory Gearbox Seals and Adapter - Removal/Installation

procedure.title: Removal of Lip Seal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove breather tube (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

Remove two
bolts (10) F41LB20-09 2 and two
washers (9) F41LW03-04 2 securing the
breather adapter (8) F41LA03A01 1 to the accessory gearbox.
DO NOT DAMAGE THE LIP SEAL INSTALLED IN THE BREATHER ADAPTER.Remove breather adapter (8) from the AGB using puller (PWC43177).

Remove and discard
preformed packing (7) F41LP03-11 1 from the breather adapter.

Remove
retaining ring (6) E41NR20-01 1 .

Remove
lip seal (5) F41LS06-02 1 using extractor (PWC43176).

procedure.title: Installation of Lip Seal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove any raised material from the breather adapter retaining ring groove.

Heat the
breather adapter (8) F41LA03A01 1 in oven at 300°F to 350°F (148°C to 176°C) for 15 to 20 minutes.
Remove the breather adapter from the oven.
Lightly lubricate the inner surface of the adapter with assembly fluid mixture (50% engine oil (PWC03-001) and 50% assembly fluid PWC06-011).

Lightly lubricate the outer surface of
lip seal (5) F41LS06-02 1 with assembly fluid mixture (50% engine oil (PWC03-001) and 50% assembly fluid PWC06-011).

MAKE SURE THE BREATHER ADAPTER LIP SEAL IS INSTALLED WITH THE SILVER METAL SURFACE AND BLACK SEAL LIP FACING THE RETAINING RING. MAKE SURE THE LIP SEAL REMAINS PROPERLY POSITIONED ON THE SHIPPING MANDREL. MAKE SURE THERE IS NO EVIDENCE OF TEARING OR EXTRUSION OF THE LIP SEAL AFTER INSTALLATION.Seat the lip seal into the breather adapter using drift (PWC60225-01). Do not remove the mandrel from the lip seal.

Install
retaining ring (6) E41NR20-01 1 in the groove inside the breather adapter.

Lubricate
preformed packing (7) F41LP03-11 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001) and install on breather adapter (8).

Clean the breather gearshaft in the area of the lip seal running surface and dry using alcohol (PWC11-014). A clean and dry gearshaft will result in better seating of the lip seal to the shaft during initial engine run.
With the mandrel still fitted in the lip seal, align the mandrel with the breather shaft and push the adapter in place by hand. The shaft will push the mandrel out from the adapter.
Discard the mandrel.

Lubricate the threads of two bolts with engine oil (PWC03-001) and secure the breather adapter (8) to the accessory gearbox with two
washers (9) F41LW03-04 2 and two
bolts (10) F41LB20-09 2 . Torque the bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.6 Nm.).
Install the breather tube (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

procedure.title: Removal of Lip Seal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Gain access to hydraulic pump lip seal by removing hydraulic pump (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

Remove
retaining ring (14) E41RR20-19 1 .
If necessary, cut the Teflon seal (13) with suitable knife to install the extractor.

DO NOT TAP OR AVOID THE USE OF EXCESSIVE FORCE DURING INSTALLATION ON THE EXTRACTOR.Remove
seal (13) E41RS06-02 1 with the extractor (PWC60684).

procedure.title: Installation of Lip Seal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove any raised material from the hydraulic pump retaining ring groove.

Clean the hydraulic pump gearshaft in the area of the lip seal contact and dry with alcohol (PWC11-014). A clean and dry gearshaft will result in better seating of the lip seal during initial engine run.

Lightly lubricate the outer surface of
lip seal (13) E41RS06-02 1 with assembly fluid mixture (50% engine oil (PWC03-001) and 50% assembly fluid PWC06-011).

MAKE SURE THE HYDRAULIC PUMP LIP SEAL IS INSTALLED WITH THE BEIGE COLORED SEAL LIP FACING THE RETAINING RING. MAKE SURE THE LIP SEAL REMAINS PROPERLY POSITIONED ON THE SHIPPING MANDREL.With the mandrel fitted in seal (13), align the mandrel to the shaft and push the seal squarely onto the hydraulic pump shaft.
MAKE SURE YOU REMOVE THE MANDREL. ACCESSORY GEARBOX COMPONENTS CAN BE DAMAGED IF MANDREL IS NOT REMOVED BEFORE THE OIL SEAL IS INSTALLED WITH THE PUSHER (PWC60683).Remove and discard the mandrel.

MAKE SURE THERE IS NO EVIDENCE OF TEARING OR EXTRUSION OF THE SEAL AFTER INSTALLATION. WHEN THE SEAL IS INSTALLED WITH PUSHER (PWC60683), MAKE SURE THAT NO EXCESSIVE FORCE IS USED TO INSTALL THE SEAL IN PLACE. EXCESSIVE FORCE/MISALIGNMENT CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE AGB BEARING OR DISENGAGE THE AGB GEAR TEETH. MAKE SURE THAT THE TORQUE IS NOT EXCEEDED.Install the lip seal with the pusher (PWC60683). Torque the pusher from 50 to 60 lb.in. (5.8 - 6.9 Nm.).

Install
retaining ring (14) E41RR20-19 1 .
Install hydraulic pump (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

procedure.title: Removal of Splined Adapter (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove the hydraulic pump (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).
Remove hydraulic pump gearshaft lip seal (Ref. Para. , above).

Remove
retaining ring (12) E41RR20-14 1 .

Remove hydraulic pump gearshaft
splined adapter (11) E41RA03-06 1 using puller (PWC60635). Store splined adapter with hydraulic pump gearshaft parts to avoid mixing with other AGB splined adapters.

procedure.title: Installation of Splined Adapter (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Lubricate the internal splines of the hydraulic pump gearshaft with engine oil (PWC03-001).

Install
splined adapter (11) E41RA03-06 1 into the gearshaft by lightly tapping with a soft faced drift (PWC61155). Fully seat splined adapter to allow installation of the retaining ring.

Install
retaining ring (12) E41RR20-14 1 .
Install the hydraulic pump gearshaft lip seal (Ref. Para. , above).
Install the hydraulic pump (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME ELECTRICAL POWER IS OFF WHEN DISCONNECTING ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS.
procedure.step: Select maintenance test discrete ON (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).
Remove HMU (Ref. Chapter 73-20-01, HYDROMECHANICAL METERING UNIT - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES).
Disconnect wiring harness connectors P11 and P12 from PMA/AC generator housing connectors (13 and 12).

Remove five
self-locking nuts (10) F41EN05-03 4 and
washers (9) F41EW03-01 5 securing
PMA/AC generator housing (8) F41BG14-01 1 to AGB cover.

Remove housing (8). Discard
preformed packing (7) F41EP03-03 1 .

Remove
retaining ring (6) E41RR20-16 1 and
keywasher (5) E41RW03-13 1 .

Remove
retaining nut (4) E41RN05-04 1 using socket (PWC43553) and adapter (PWC60144).

Remove
rotor (3) F41BG14-02 1 from
fuel pump gearshaft (2) E41RG10A01 1 .

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Install
PMA/AC generator rotor (3) F41BG14-02 1 on
fuel pump gearshaft (2) E41RG10A01 1 .

Lubricate threads and mating face of
retaining nut (4) E41RN05-04 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001) and install on fuel pump gearshaft (2).

SOCKET (PWC43553) HAS A TWO INCH OFFSET. REFER TO CHAPTER 70-00-00, STANDARD PRACTICES - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES FOR RECALCULATION OF TORQUE VALUES.Torque 600 to 800 lb.in. (69.4 to 92.4 Nm.) using socket (PWC43553) and adapter (PWC60144).
Loosen nut to zero.
Retorque to 600 lb.in. (69.4 Nm.).
FINAL TORQUE MUST NOT EXCEED 800 LB.IN. (92.4 Nm.).Tighten to the next locking position.

Install
keywasher (5) E41RW03-13 1 and
retaining ring (6) E41RR20-16 1 on retaining nut (4).

Install new
preformed packing (7) F41EP03-03 1 on
PMA/AC generator housing (8) F41BG14-01 1 .
Install housing (8) over rotor (3). Set locating pin (11) at the 6 o'clock position.

Secure housing (8) with five
washers (9) F41EW03-01 5 and five
self-locking nuts (10) F41EN05-03 4 . Torque 32 to 36 lb.in. (3.6-4.1 Nm.).

MAKE SURE AIRFRAME ELECTRICAL POWER IS OFF WHEN CONNECTING ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS. MAKE SURE CONNECTOR PLUGS ARE FREE FROM MOISTURE; IF NECESSARY, DRY WITH HEAT GUN. PROPER PIN ENGAGEMENT SHOULD BE ACHIEVED BY HAND TIGHTENING. CONNECTORS ARE PROPERLY TIGHTENED WHEN ONLY THE BLUE COLOR IS VISIBLE; THE RED COLOR BAND SHOULD NOT BE VISIBLE.Attach wiring harness connector P12 to housing connector (12) and harness connector P11 to housing connector (13). Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL-JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORS.Tighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
Restore electrical power to appropriate system and reset EEC circuit breaker to ON.
Select maintenance discrete OFF.
Refer to Chapter 71-00-00, POWER PLANT - ADJUSTMENT/TEST, for checks following installation of the PMA/AC generator.

procedure.title: Removal of Lip Seal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove HMU (Ref. Chapter 73-20-01, HYDROMECHANICAL METERING UNIT - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES).

Remove
retaining ring E41RR20-17 1 (15, Fig. , Sheets 1 and 2).
DO NOT DAMAGE THE DRIVE SHAFT OUTSIDE DIAMETER.Remove PMA/AC generator housing from the AGB (Ref. Para. ).

Remove
lip seal (16) E41RS06-04 1 by pushing outward from inside of the housing, using teflon drift (PWC51137).

procedure.title: Installation of Lip Seal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove any raised material from the PMA/AC generator retaining ring groove.
Clean the gearshaft in the area of the lip seal contact surface and dry with alcohol (PWC11-014). A clean and dry gearshaft will result in better seating of the lip seal during initial engine run.

Lightly lubricate the outer surface of
lip seal (16) E41RS06-04 1 with assembly fluid mixture (50% engine oil (PWC03-001) and 50% assembly fluid PWC06-011).

MAKE SURE THE LIP SEAL IS INSTALLED WITH THE BEIGE COLORED SEAL LIP FACING THE RETAINING RING. MAKE SURE THE LIP SEAL REMAINS PROPERLY POSITIONED ON THE SHIPPING MANDREL.With the mandrel fitted in the seal (16), align the mandrel to the shaft and push the seal squarely onto the shaft.
MAKE SURE YOU REMOVE THE MANDREL. ACCESSORY GEARBOX COMPONENTS CAN BE DAMAGED IF MANDREL IS NOT REMOVED BEFORE THE OIL SEAL IS INSTALLED WITH THE PUSHER (PWC60685).Remove and discard the mandrel.

MAKE SURE THERE IS NO EVIDENCE OF TEARING OR EXTRUSION OF THE SEAL AFTER INSTALLATION. THE LIP SEAL MUST BE SEATED BELOW THE RETAINING RING GROOVE. WHEN THE SEAL IS INSTALLED WITH PUSHER (PWC60685), MAKE SURE THAT NO EXCESSIVE FORCE IS USED TO INSTALL THE SEAL IN PLACE. EXCESSIVE FORCE/MISALIGNMENT CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE AGB BEARING OR DISENGAGE THE AGB GEAR TEETH. MAKE SURE THAT THE TORQUE IS NOT EXCEEDED.Install the lip seal with the pusher (PWC60685). Torque the pusher from 50 to 60 lb.in. (5.8-6.9 Nm.).
Index the pusher 180 degrees and retorque 50 to 60 lb.in. (5.8-6.9 Nm.).

Install
retaining ring (15) E41RR20-17 1 .
DO NOT DAMAGE THE DRIVE SHAFT OUTSIDE DIAMETER.Install the PMA/AC generator housing onto the AGB (Ref. Subpara. ).

procedure.title: Removal of Lip Seal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove alternator or starter to gain access to the lip seal (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

Remove the
starter shaft shield (22) E41LS23-01 1 using puller (PWC61951). Remove and discard
preformed packing (21) E41LP03-30 1 .

Remove retaining ring
(1) E41RR20-20 1 or
(20) E41RR20-03 1 (Ref. Fig. , Section F-F, Section G-G similar).
If necessary, cut the Teflon seal (13) with suitable knife to install the extractor.

DO NOT TAP OR AVOID THE USE OF EXCESSIVE FORCE DURING INSTALLATION ON THE EXTRACTOR.Remove lip seal
(2) E41RS06-03 1 or
(19) E41RS06-01 1 with the extractor (PWC60679).

procedure.title: Installation of Lip Seal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove any raised material from the retaining ring groove.
Clean the gearshaft in the area of the lip seal contact and dry with alcohol (PWC11-014). A clean and dry gearshaft will result in better seating of the lip seal during initial engine run.

The new seal
(2) E41RS06-03 1 or
(19) E41RS06-01 1 is supplied pre-installed on mandrel. Make sure seal is fitted properly on mandrel.
Lightly lubricate the outer surface of lip seal with assembly fluid mixture (50% engine oil (PWC03-001) and 50% assembly fluid PWC06-011).

MAKE SURE THE LIP SEAL IS INSTALLED WITH THE BEIGE SEAL LIP FACING THE RETAINING RING. MAKE SURE THE LIP SEAL REMAINS PROPERLY POSITIONED ON THE SHIPPING MANDREL.With the mandrel fitted on the seal, align the mandrel to the shaft and push the seal squarely onto the shaft.
MAKE SURE YOU REMOVE THE MANDREL. ACCESSORY GEARBOX COMPONENTS CAN BE DAMAGED IF MANDREL IS NOT REMOVED BEFORE THE OIL SEAL IS INSTALLED WITH THE PUSHER (PWC60682).Carefully remove the mandrel.

MAKE SURE THERE IS NO EVIDENCE OF TEARING OR EXTRUSION OF THE SEAL AFTER INSTALLATION. THE LIP SEAL MUST BE SEATED BELOW THE RETAINING RING GROOVE. WHEN THE SEAL IS INSTALLED WITH PUSHER (PWC60682), MAKE SURE THAT NO EXCESSIVE FORCE IS USED TO INSTALL THE SEAL IN PLACE. EXCESSIVE FORCE/MISALIGNMENT CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE AGB BEARING OR DISENGAGE THE AGB GEAR TEETH. MAKE SURE THAT THE TORQUE IS NOT EXCEEDED.Install the lip seal onto the shaft with the pusher (PWC60682). Torque the pusher from 50 to 60 lb.in. (5.8-6.9 Nm.).
Index the pusher 180 degrees and retorque 50 to 60 lb.in. (5.8-6.9 Nm.).

Install the retaining ring
(1) E41RR20-20 1 or
(20) E41RR20-03 1 in the groove.

Install
preformed packing (21) E41LP03-30 1 on the
starter shaft shield (22) E41LS23-01 1 .
Install the starter shaft shield.
Install alternator or starter (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

procedure.title: Removal of Splined Adapter (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove alternator or starter (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).
Remove lip seal (Ref. Para. , above).

Remove retaining ring
(3) E41RR20-15 1 or
(18) E41RR20-02 1 .

Remove splined adapter
(4) E41RA03-05 1 or
(17) E41RA03-07 1 using puller (PWC60635). Store splined adapter with the alternator or starter gearshaft parts to avoid mixing with other AGB splined adapters.

procedure.title: Starter Splined Adapter Visual Check (Ref. Figs. and )

figure.title: Visual Inspection for Starter Splined Adapter

procedure.step: Examine the starter splined adapter (17, Fig. ) for the following damage (Ref. Fig. , Section A-A, Area 1): Local and isolated pitting is acceptable if it does not exceed 0.005 in. (0.12 mm.) depth, 0.015 in. (0.38 mm.) in diameter and no more than 5 pits in a 0.250 in. (6.35 mm.) diameter area. Local surface damage is acceptable if it does not exceed 0.005 in. (0.12 mm.) depth, 0.010 in. (0.250 mm.) width and cover no more than 20 percent of the contact surface. Wear on the contact surfaces must not exceed 0.005 in. (0.12 mm.) depth, and the total spline surface contact pattern must include no less than 80 percent of the spline. No chipping is permitted. No cracks are permitted.
Reject if damage is not within the specified limits.

procedure.title: Installation of Splined Adapter (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Lubricate the internal splines of the alternator or starter gearshaft with engine oil (PWC03-001).

Install splined adapter
(4) E41RA03-05 1 or
(17) E41RA03-07 1 into the gearshaft by lightly tapping with a soft faced drift (PWC61155). Fully seat splined adapter to allow installation of the retaining ring.

Install retaining ring
(3) E41RR20-15 1 or
(18) E41RR20-02 1 .
Install the alternator or starter gearshaft lip seal (Ref. Para. , above).
Install the alternator or starter (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

procedure.title: Removal of Oil Drain
procedure.step:
25088: Remove
oil drain plug (24) F41LP26-03 1 from the base of the AGB. Remove and discard
preformed packing (23) E41LP03-01 1 .

25088: Remove
bolt (28) E41LB20-20 1 and
washer (27) E41LW03-12 1 securing
oil drain cover (25) E41LC28-01 1 at the base of the AGB. Remove the oil drain cover using puller (PWC66103). Remove and discard
preformed packing (26) E41LP03-01 1 .

procedure.title: Installation of Oil Drain
procedure.step:
25088: Install
preformed packing (23) E41LP03-01 1 on
oil drain plug (24) F41LP26-03 1 . Lubricate drain plug threads with engine oil (PWC03-001). Install oil drain plug at the base of the AGB. Torque 65-75 lb.in. (7.5-8.6 Nm.).

25088: Install
preformed packing (26) E41LP03-01 1 on
oil drain cover (25) E41LC28-01 1 . Lubricate bolt threads with engine oil (PWC03-001). Install oil drain cover at the base of the AGB. Secure the oil drain cover with
bolt (28) E41LB20-20 1 and
washer (27) E41LW03-12 1 . Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.6 Nm.).

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )

figure.title: Engine Identification and Trim Plate - Removal/Installation

procedure.step:
Remove head of four
rivets (3) E41NR25-01 4 using a 0.125 inch diameter drill.

Using a suitable punch, light tap the rivet stem through the
trim plate (5) E41NP16-03 1 and
identification plate (4) E41NP16-02 1 until the plate is free.

Remove four
screws (2) E41NS02-01 4 and
retaining plate (1) E41NP16-01 1 .
Remove wasted portion of rivets (3) from cavities in accessory gearbox housing.

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Secure
retaining plate (1) E41NP16-01 1 to AGB with four
screws (2) E41NS02-01 4 . Torque screws 9 to 11 lb.in. (1.0-1.2 N.m).

Install
identification plate (4) E41NP16-02 1 on retaining plate (1). Put trade mark on identification plate forward. Secure with two blind
rivets (3) E41NR25-01 4 in the front corners using suitable riveting tool.

Install
trim plate (5) E41NP16-03 1 over bottom portion of identification plate (4) and make sure no information is obscured. Secure with two blind rivets (3) using suitable tool.
Cut and file rivet stems flush to head. Do not push rivet stem inside AGB case.

procedure.title: Repair of AGB Starter-Generator and Alternator Mount Pad Inserts (Ref. Fig. )

figure.title: AGB Starter-Generator and Alternator Mount Pad Inserts

procedure.step: Remove the starter-generator or alternator from the AGB (Ref. AMM).
A locally manufactured hole guide is recommended to get the required repair tolerances.
Drill mount pad hole to diameter of 0.515 to 0.521 in. and to depth of 0.750 in.
Make a chamfer of 82° to 100° with a diameter of 0.572 to 0.582 in.
Tap the hole: 0.5625-12 UNC-2B to 0.560 in. minimum, full depth threads.
Clean the area.
Apply the chromate conversion solution on the magnesium casings (Ref. 70-00-00, STANDARD PRACTICES - REPAIR).
Measure the wall thickness between the bottom of the hole and the back of the mount pad flange. Make sure it is 0.090 in. minimum.

Install a Keensert insert P/N MS51831A204L or MS51831A204 or any equivalent 0.010 to 0.030 in. below the surface of the hole. Other equivalent insert P/N's can also be used: NAS1395C6L, NAS1395-6L or KNH624J.
Drive the insert locking keys down.
Install the starter-generator or alternator on the AGB (Ref. AMM).

procedure.title: Nut-AC Generator Bearing Retaining
procedure.step: Lubricate with engine oil (PWC03-001).
Tighten 600 to 800 lb.in. (67.8 to 90.4 N.m).
Loosen zero.
Tighten 600 to 800 lb.in. (67.8 to 90.4 N.m).

NOT APPLICABLE
NOT APPLICABLE

n-para.title: General
n-para.para: The engine bypass ducts consist of a two-piece annular outer assembly and a six-piece annular inner assembly. The outer assembly is secured to the rear outer flange of the intermediate case (Flange C), while the inner assembly is located with a snug fit to the inside diameter of the intermediate case, and is secured to the front flange of the combustion chamber case. An outer fan duct and inner core ducts are secured to the rear flanges of the outer and inner bypass duct assemblies respectively. The total configuration forms a full length bypass duct, through which bypass air is propelled.

n-para.title: Inner Bypass Duct (Ref. Fig. )
n-para.para: The inner bypass duct is an aluminum sheet metal assembly, comprising six main sections and three faired support-struts. A snug fit locates the front end of the bypass duct to the intermediate case, while a support ring, bolted to the rear flange of the gas generator case provides a rigid support midway along the length of the bypass duct. A stiffening ring, attached to the rear end of the bypass duct, adds rigidity and provides the attachment surface for the airframe-supplied core cowl.

A box-shaped section, fastened to the inside of the bypass duct at the rear end, provides thermal protection for the spark igniters and cables. The lower right panel provides access to the hybrid fuel nozzles.

The struts at the 3 and 9 o'clock positions provide passageways for the cabin bleed air pipes, while the strut at the 6 o'clock position houses fuel and oil transfer tubes and the emergency fuel shutoff cable.

n-para.title: Outer Bypass Duct (Ref. Fig. )
n-para.para: The outer bypass duct consists of a two-piece annular aluminum sheet metal assembly, with flanges at the front, rear and sides. The front flange is bolted to the rear outer face of the intermediate case (Flange C) and the rear flange (Flange D) provides the means of attachment for the airframe-supplied fan duct. Flanges at the 3 and 9 o'clock positions secure the two halves of the assembly together. An access panel located under the ignition exciter box mounts provides access to the inner bypass duct access panel, which allows access to the hybrid fuel nozzles. Various bosses around the circumference of the duct provide for accessories and external fittings.

n-para.title: Mid Core Duct (Ref. Fig.)
n-para.para: The mid core duct consists of two-piece aluminum sheet metal assembly to cover the core area. The front end of the duct is bolted to the mating end of the inner bypass duct and the mating sides are bolted together to form a cylindrical cover to the engine core. An access door on the right half of the duct provides access to the N1/T4.5 terminal box and various components in the area.

n-para.title: Rear Core Duct (Ref. Fig.)
n-para.para: The rear core duct consists of two-halves of aluminum sheet metal assembly to cover the exhaust case. The front end of the duct is bolted to the brackets around the exhaust case and it overlaps with the rear end of the mid duct to form a smooth surface transition between the two assemblies.

n-para.title: Rear Outer Bypass Duct and Rear Engine Mount (Ref. Fig. )
n-para.para: The outer fan duct consists of one-piece annular bonded structure and sheet metal assembly. A ceramic fabric is bonded to the exterior surface by a layer of silicone rubber and the inner diameter is lined with perforated acoustic face sheet forming a honeycomb sandwich structure. The front flange face of the duct is bolted to the rear face of the outer bypass duct (Flange D) and the rear flange provides the means of attachment for the airframe supplied thrust reverser. An access door is located at the 4 o'clock position to provide access to the mid core and inner bypass duct access panels.

A rear engine mount is fitted at the rear flange of the duct at approximately 3 or 9 o'clock position depending on the installed configuration of the engine, i.e., right hand or left hand. The mount consists of two short forged arms with spherical bearings at the ends. One end of each arm attached to brackets which is assembled to the duct for left or right build. Identical sets of bushes and fasteners have been used at each end.

general.para: Lubricate preformed packings, threads and mating surfaces, with engine oil unless otherwise stated.
Install protective caps and plugs on disconnected tubes, component openings and electrical connectors after disassembly.

consumables.para: The consumable materials listed below are used in the following procedures.
Refer to INTRODUCTION for alternate products, suppliers and suppliers addresses.

procedure.title: Removal of Rear Section Duct (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Gain access to the outer fan duct (Refer to Aircraft Maintenance Manual).
Disconnect affected aircraft supplied drain fittings and all other related components (Refer to Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

Disconnect the rear engine mount link from the engine mount spar (Refer to Aircraft Maintenance Manual). Rear engine mount links assembly is part of the rear outer bypass duct assembly and is removed with the bypass duct.
Remove two bolts and washers (Ref. View M-M) attaching bottom of rear outer bypass duct to the engine lower outer bypass duct flange.

Remove rear outer bypass duct attachment bolts, washers and nuts at positions where electrical harness and engine equipment support brackets are located. Take note of the position and orientation of all brackets prior to removal.

Position electrical harness and engine equipment support brackets as necessary to clear rear outer bypass duct flange during removal. Engine supplied brackets are mounted on the rear side of the engine outer bypass duct and the airframe supplied brackets are mounted on the front side of the rear outer bypass duct.
Support rear outer bypass duct and remove remaining bolts, washers and nuts attaching rear outer bypass duct to engine outer bypass duct.
Carefully remove the rear outer bypass duct.

procedure.title: Removal of Access Door and Brackets (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove
bolts (30) B23NB20-30 6 ,
washers (31) B23NW03-07 6 and
access door (32) B23ND20A01 1 .

25107 (Ref. Fig. ): For Field Modified Exhaust Ducts: Remove three
brackets (33) F23FB40-18 3 , four
brackets (36) F23FB40-19 4 and seven
bolts (34) pw306a-727001-001-0540 7 from the
rear outer bypass duct (35) B23ND21A13
. For Production Exhaust Ducts: Remove three brackets (33), four brackets (36), seven
threaded pins (37) F23FP04-01 7 and seven
nuts (38) F23FN05-18 7 from the rear outer bypass duct (35).

procedure.title: Installation of Rear Section (Ref. Fig.)
procedure.step: Position rear outer bypass duct and align locating pins on the engine outer bypass duct flange.

MAKE SURE TO INSTALL OUTER BYPASS DUCT FLANGE ‘D’ BOLTS, NUTS AND WASHERS IN THE DIRECTION OF THE ARROWS.Install
bolts (3) B23NB20-28 48 ,
washers (2) B23NW03-06 88 ,
nuts (1) B23NN05-24 46 and fingertight at positions not attaching electrical harness or engine component support brackets (Ref. Section L-L).

Position electrical harness and install engine components support
brackets (4) B23EB40-01 1 . Install bolts (3), washers (2), nuts (1), brackets (4) and tighten nuts with fingers. Position and orientation of the engine and airframe brackets must be the same as when they were removed.
Secure bottom of rear outer bypass duct to engine outer bypass duct flange with two bolts (3) (Ref. View M-M). Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).
Torque all rear outer bypass duct attachment nuts to 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).
Install rear engine mount links to engine mounting lugs in the aircraft (Refer to Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

procedure.title: Installation of Access Door and Brackets (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Install
access door (32) B23ND20A01 1 with
bolts (30) B23NB20-30 6 and
washers (31) B23NW03-07 6 .
Torque bolts (30) 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.5 Nm).

25107 (Ref. Fig. ): For Field Modified Exhaust Ducts: Install three
brackets (33) F23FB40-18 3 and four brackets (36), at seven locations shown and secure with
bolts (34) pw306a-727001-001-0540 7 . Torque bolts (34) 75 to 85 lb.in. (8.5-9.6 Nm.). For Production Exhaust Ducts: Lubricate seven
threaded pins (37) F23FP04-01 7 using engine oil (PWC03-001) and install at seven locations on the
rear outer bypass duct (35) B23ND21A13
. Install three brackets (33) and four
brackets (36) F23FB40-19 4 at seven locations shown and secure with
nuts (38) F23FN05-18 7 . Torque nuts (38) 85 to 95 lb.in. (9.6-10.7 Nm.).

procedure.title: Removal of Engine Mount (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove ten
nuts (16) B23NN05-40 10 , ten
spacers (26) B23NS33-02 10 and two
front heat shields (25) B23NS23-05 2 .

Support the engine
