(25.4 to 28.3 Nm). 25192 and 25201: Lubricate threads of adapter (1) and preformed packing (5) with anti-seize compound (PWC06-004B). Install preformed packing (5) onto drain valve adapter (1). Install drain valve adapter (1) into the lower bypass duct and torque 145 to 160 lb. in. (16.3 to 18.0 Nm).
Secure fuel drain valve adapter (1) using lockwire (PWC05-089) or safety cable (PWC05-344).

procedure.title: Prepare for Inspection (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove the aft body of the nacelle (Ref. AMM).
Remove the rear lower inner bypass duct (Ref. Chapter 72-70-01).

Remove the 12
screws (2) D36NB20-17 12 .

Remove the
exhaust cone (3) D36NC15-01 1 . The emergency fuel shut-off valve upper mechanism can be inspected without disassembly.

procedure.title: Inspection of Fuel Shut-off Mechanism (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Visually inspect the rod mechanism.
Remove the cotter pin, the washer and the pin attaching the bellcrank to the cable on the bottom of the exhaust case.

DO NOT MOVE THE CONTROL LEVER ON THE FUEL SHUT-OFF VALVE WHEN REMOVING CABLE.Carefully remove the cable from the fuel shut-off valve (Ref. View A) without disturbing the nuts, and the position of the control lever.
Inspect the bellcrank on the bottom of the exhaust case for condition. Clean as required.

Inspect the shut-off cable as follows: Pull the shut-off cable through its range of travel, checking for freedom of movement and correct operation. Examine the inner cable for worn, corroded or broken wires. A small amount of wear or corrosion is acceptable but if any wires are broken or worn thin, the cable must be replaced. Examine the cable housing. A small amount of wear, corrosion or distortion is acceptable, if it does not prevent free travel of the cable. Any breaks or openings in the cable housing are not acceptable and the cable must be replaced.
Pin and lever: Inspect area for evidence of oil leak or coking. If oil leakage or coking is observed (Ref. Chapter 72-00-00) for corrective action.
Re-set the fuel shut-off valve (Ref. Para. , ).

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Apply a thin film of anti-seize compound (PWC06-009) to the threads of the screws (2).

Align the holes and install the
exhaust cone (3) D36NC15-01 1 on the exhaust case flange (4).

Install the
screws (2) D36NB20-17 12 and tighten 18 to 22 lb.in. (2-2.4 Nm).
Instal the lower rear inner bypass duct (Ref. Chapter 72-70-01).
Install the rear outer bypass duct (Ref. Chapter 72-70-01).
Install the aft body of the nacelle (Ref. AMM).
Do engine ground checks 1, 2 and 3 (Ref. Chapter 71-00-00).

general.para: Lubricate preformed packings, threads and mating surfaces with engine oil unless otherwise stated.
Install protective caps and plugs on disconnected tubes, component openings and electrical connectors after sub-assembly.

consumables.para: The consumable materials listed below are used in the following procedures.

special-tools.para: The special tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

fixtures-and-equipment.para: The fixtures, equipment and supplier tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. and Fig. )
procedure.caution: THE FUEL PUMP AND MOTIVE FLOW VALVE MUST BE REMOVED/REINSTALLED FROM 25290 HMU'S ONLY. 25290 HMU'S HAVE AN INTEGRAL FUEL PUMP AND MOTIVE FLOW VALVE. DO NOT TRY TO REMOVE THE FUEL PUMP AND/OR MOTIVE FLOW VALVE FROM 25290 HMU'S.
MAKE SURE AIRFRAME ELECTRICAL POWER IS OFF WHEN DISCONNECTING ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS.
procedure.note: If HMU is to be replaced for any reason, it will be necessary to remove fuel pump from HMU (Ref. 73-10-02) and re-install in replacement HMU.

key.def: Wiring Harness Connector P17 - Standby Shutdown
Wiring Harness Connector P35 - Motive Flow Valve

procedure.step: Select maintenance test discrete ON before HMU removal (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).
Provide drain tray under engine to collect fuel.
Remove airframe fuel inlet connection from HMU (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).
Remove wiring harness connectors P15, P16, P17 and P35 (8, 9, 7 and 10).
Remove all fuel pressure and bypass tubes (Ref. 73-10-01).

25290: Remove fuel pump and motive flow valve from the HMU (Ref. 73-10-02) and Para. If the HMU is to be replaced, install a blanking cover on the valve mounting port on the HMU and pack in the appropriate shipping case.
25290: Do not remove the fuel pump and/or the motive flow valve from the HMU.

25290 (Ref. Fig. ): Remove lockwire and loosen coupling nut (3). Disconnect fuel tube (4). Remove
nipple (2) F50FN02-02 1 and discard
preformed packing (1) F50FP03-06 1 .
Plug/cap all exposed openings and electrical connections.

Remove lockwire, if installed, and loosen
flange clamp (3) F13FC07-01 1 by removing nut (4).

DIRT MUST NOT ENTER THE FUEL SYSTEM. TAKE ALL NECESSARY PRECAUTIONS TO AVOID INGRESS OF FOREIGN MATERIAL. WHEREVER POSSIBLE, INSTALL PROTECTIVE CAPS OR PLUGS ON ALL EXPOSED OPENINGS BEFORE REMOVING THE HMU. USE CARE WHEN REMOVING HMU FROM ENGINE. USE ADEQUATE SUPPORT TO MAKE SURE HMU IS REMOVED SMOOTHLY AND IN A STRAIGHT LINE AWAY FROM THE MATING FACE ON AGB. DO NOT DAMAGE AGB MATING SURFACE ON HMU OR AGB.Remove HMU from mounting face of AC generator (2) and discard
preformed packings (5) F13FP03-02 1 .

Remove and discard the
preformed packing (11) F13FP03-02 1 from the fuel pump driveshaft (12) (Ref. View C).

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. and )
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME ELECTRICAL POWER IS OFF WHEN CONNECTING ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS.
MAKE SURE CONNECTOR PLUGS ARE FREE FROM MOISTURE; IF NECESSARY, DRY USING HEAT GUN.
USE ONLY APPROVED TOOLS TO TIGHTEN HARNESS CONNECTORS. CONNECTORS ARE PROPERLY TIGHTENED WHEN ONLY THE BLUE COLOR AND IS VISIBLE; RED COLOR BAND MUST NOT BE VISIBLE.
procedure.step: 25290: Install the fuel pump on the HMU (Ref. 73-10-02). If it is a replacement HMU, remove the blanking (shipping) cover of the valve mounting port from the HMU (Ref. Para. ). Install motive flow valve on the HMU (Ref. Para. ).
25290: The fuel pump and motive flow valve are integral with the HMU. Installation is not required.

25290 (Ref. Fig. ) : Install new
preformed packing (1) F50FP03-06 1 on
nipple (2) F50FN02-02 1 and install the nipple in the integral fuel pump. Torque 65 to 75 lb.in. (7.5-8.5 Nm). Connect fuel tube (4) to the integral fuel pump with coupling nut (3). Torque 90 to 100 lb.in. (10.2-11.3 Nm) and lockwire (PWC05-089).

Lubricate new
preformed packing (5) F13FP03-02 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001) and install on HMU.

Lubricate a new
preformed packing (11) F13FP03-02 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001) and install on fuel pump driveshaft (12) (Ref. View C).
Align splined shaft of fuel pump (if installed) with shaft in accessory gearbox, and dowel pin on HMU with hole in mating face of AC generator and install HMU.

Install
flange clamp (3) F13FC07-01 1 with nut (4). Make sure clamp is oriented correctly (Ref. View A-A). Torque clamp nut (4) 32 to 36 lb.in. (3.5-4.1 Nm) and gently tap around circumference of clamp to make sure proper seating. Final torque nut (4) 50 to 60 lb.in. (5.7-6.8 Nm).
Apply electrical contact enhancer to connectors (Ref. 70-00-00, CLEANING).

Install wiring harness connectors P15, P16, P17 and P35 (8, 9, 7 and 10). Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector with soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
Install fuel pressure and bypass tubes (Ref. 73-10-01), except do not connect primary and secondary fuel supply tubes to fuel dump valve.
Perform depreservation procedure (Ref. 72-00-00, SERVICING) to purge HMU of preserving fluid.
Restore electrical power to appropriate system and reset EEC circuit breaker to ON.
Select maintenance test discrete OFF.
Refer to Chapter 71-00-00, for checks following installation of HMU.

procedure.title: PMA - Removal/Installation
procedure.step: Refer to 72-60-01 for Removal/Installation of AC Generator (PMA).

n-para.title: Motive Flow Valve
n-para.caution: THE FUEL PUMP AND MOTIVE FLOW VALVE MUST BE REMOVED/REINSTALLED FROM 25290 HMU'S ONLY. 25290 HMU'S HAVE AN INTEGRAL FUEL PUMP AND MOTIVE FLOW VALVE. DO NOT TRY TO REMOVE THE FUEL PUMP AND/OR MOTIVE FLOW VALVE FROM 25290 HMU'S.

procedure.title: Removal (25290) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove three
bolts (1) F13FB20-01 3 , three
washers (2) F13FW03-03 3 and remove
motive flow valve (3) F23BV01-01 1 from the
HMU (5) F23BF04-01 1 . Remove and discard two
preformed packings (4) F13FP03-01 2 from the valve (3).

procedure.title: Installation (25290) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: If the motive flow valve is being installed to a replacement HMU, remove the blanking (shipping) cover of the valve mounting port from the HMU.

Install two new
preformed packings (4) F13FP03-01 2 to the
motive flow valve (3) F23BV01-01 1 and install valve on mounting port on the
HMU (5) F23BF04-01 1 . Attach valve with three
washers (2) F13FW03-03 3 and three
bolts (1) F13FB20-01 3 . Torque 32 to 36 lb.in. (3.5-4.1 Nm).

general.para: Lubricate preformed packings, threads and mating surfaces with engine oil unless otherwise stated.
Install protective caps and plugs on disconnected tubes,/component openings and electrical connectors after disassembly.

consumables.para: The consumable materials listed below are used in the following procedures.
Refer to INTRODUCTION for alternate products, suppliers and suppliers addresses.

special-tools.para: The special tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

fixtures-and-equipment.para: The fixtures, equipment and supplier tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

procedure.title: Removal of EEC (Ref. Figs. and )
procedure.step: If an EEC is removed because of suspected malfunctioning, complete the EEC return sheet (Ref. Fig. ) and return it with the EEC.
Select maintenance test discrete ON before EEC removal (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

MAKE SURE AIRFRAME 28 VDC POWER IS OFF BEFORE DISCONNECTING ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS.Disconnect engine electrical connectors P1, P3 and P4 (12, 11 and 10) from
EEC (1) F23BE02-01 1 . Disconnect airframe electrical connectors P2, P5. Check connectors for moisture. If necessary, dry connectors with suitable heat gun.

DO NOT CHANGE OR REPLACE TRIM PLUG P3 ON THE ENGINE. THE TRIM PLUG IS MATCHED TO THE ENGINE SERIAL NO. AND IS NOT INTERCHANGEABLE WITH ANY OTHER TRIM PLUG. Remove coupling nut of
tube assembly (22) F13AT17A11 1 from
tube assembly (4) F13AT17A12 1 and disengage
loop clamp (2) F13AC07-03 1 . Remove coupling nut (5) from the EEC.

Remove two
bolts (6) F13AB20-01 1 and nuts
(8) F13AN05-02 1 and
(9) F14EN05-01 1 and disengage harness loop clamp from the EEC bracket.

INSTALL PROTECTIVE CAPS OVER THE OUTSIDE OF ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS. DO NOT INSTALL PROTECTIVE CAPS ON THE INSIDE OF ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR SLEEVES. IMPROPER INSTALLATION OF CAP CAN DAMAGE THE INSIDE OF THE CONNECTOR (Ref. 70-00-00, REMOVAL/INSTALLATION).Plug/cap all openings.

Remove
nut (16) F13EN05-04 1 , and disengage
bracket (18) F13EB40-30 1 from the EEC. Remove one end of
strap (19) F13EC01A01 1 from EEC ground mounting point.

MAKE SURE EEC IS PROPERLY SUPPORTED BEFORE REMOVING BOLTS (20). REMOVE LOWER TWO BOLTS AND WASHERS FIRST. DAMAGE CAN OCCUR TO MOUNTING FEET IF EEC MOVES FORWARD UNDER ITS OWN WEIGHT WHEN REMOVING BOLTS.Support EEC and remove two lower bolts (20) and washers (21). Remove two upper bolts (20) and washers (21). Remove EEC from engine.

procedure.title: Installation of EEC (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME 28 VDC POWER IS OFF BEFORE CONNECTING ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS.
DO NOT SWAP EDU AND/OR EEC FOR TROUBLE SHOOTING PURPOSE.
procedure.note: If a 25158 engine incorporates 25104 at a later date, 25158 must be replaced with 25150.
If a 25207 engine incorporates 25104 at a later date, 25207 must be replaced with 25203.
procedure.step: DO NOT LUBRICATE THE THREADS.Position the EEC to the four points on the mounting bracket with four washers (21) and four bolts (20). Torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Clean ground terminal and adjacent area with solvent (PWC11-027).

DO NOT LUBRICATE THREADS.Install
bracket (18) F13EB40-30 1 and the strap lug on the ground stud on the EEC with
nut (16) F13EN05-04 1 .

Install
rubber cushion (14) F13EC20-01 2 in
loop clamp (13) F13EC07-01 1 and secure with
bolt (17) F13EB20-03 1 and
nut (15) F13EN05-04 1 . Torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).
Torque nut (16) on ground terminal stud 32 to 36 lb.in. (3.6-4.0 Nm). Apply coat of silicone sealant (PWC09-008) or (PWC09-008A) to ground terminal.

Put
tube assembly (4) F13AT17A12 1 and install coupling nut (5) to the mating tube on the EEC. Tighten coupling nut with your hand.

Install coupling nut of
tube assembly (22) F13AT17A11 1 to tube assembly (4) and tighten nut with your hand. Torque 90 to 100 lb.in. (10.2-11.3 Nm) and lockwire (PWC05-089).

Install l
loop clamp (2) F13AC07-03 1 and
bolt (3) F13AB20-03 1 . Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Torque coupling nut (5) 42 to 49 lb.in. (4.7-5.5 Nm) and lockwire (PWC05-089).
Apply electrical contact enhancer to connectors (Ref. 70-00-00, CLEANING).

USE ONLY APPROVED TOOL TO TIGHTEN HARNESS CONNECTORS. CONNECTORS ARE PROPERLY TIGHTENED. MAKE SURE THAT YOU CAN SEE THE BLUE COLOR BAND AND YOU MUST NOT SEE THE RED COLOR BAND.Remove protective caps/plugs and connect P1 and P4 connectors (12 and 10) to EEC. Connect trim plug P3 (11). Connect airframe electrical connectors J2 and J5. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods: For aircraft with Data Transmission Unit (DTU) installed, make sure to pull the DTU circuit breaker on the overhead cockpit panel.
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lbf.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORS.Tighten the connector with soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lbf.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
Set maintenance test discrete to “ON” (MAINT) (Ref. AMM).
Set proximity system breaker to "ON" to activate WOW system.
Set TLA to CUT-OFF and make sure that all thrust lever microswitch breakers are "ON".
Set circuit breaker FADEC Channel A and B to “ON”.
After 15 seconds, set circuit breaker FADEC Channel A and B to “OFF”.
After 15 seconds, set circuit breaker FADEC Channel A to "ON".
After 15 seconds, set circuit breaker FADEC Channel B to "ON".
Make sure that no EEC fault lamps are "ON". If fault lamps are "ON", refer to 72-00-00, FAULT ISOLATION.
After 15 seconds, set maintenance discrete OFF (NORMAL) after EEC installation and before engine operations (Ref. AMM).
After 15 seconds, Refer to Chapter 71-00-00, for checks following installation of EEC.

procedure.title: Removal of N1 Speed Trim Box 25336 (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove four
cap screws (16) F23ES02-02 4 and multiple
self-locking nut (14) F23EN05-11 1 .

Remove
N1 speed trim box (15) F23EC17-01 1 . Identify and place in clean plastic bag.

procedure.title: Installation of N1 Speed Trim Box 25336 (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Position
N1 speed trim box (15) F23EC17-01 1 ) in
EEC mounting bracket (9) F13EB40-11 1 .

Secure trim box using four
cap screws (16) F23ES02-02 4 and multiple
self-locking nut (14) F23EN05-11 1 .
Torque screws (16) 6 to 7 lb.in. (0.7-0.8 Nm).

procedure.title: Removal of EEC Mounting Brackets ( 25382) (Ref. Fig. )

figure.title: EEC Mounting Brackets and N1 Speed Trim Box - Removal/Installation

procedure.step:
Remove two
nuts (1) A13EN05-01 1 ,
washer (2) A13NW03-01 1 ,
bolt (3) A13NB20-03 1 and remove
bracket (4) F13EB40A03 1 .

Remove two
bolts (10) F13EB20-06 2 and two washers (11) and remove
bracket (6) F13AB40-01 1 .

Remove two
nuts (20) F13EN05-07 4 , two
bolts (19) F13EB20-05 2 and remove
bracket (18) F13EB40-09 1 .

Remove two
bolts (8) F13EB20-07 4 and
washers (7) F13EW03-04 4 securing
lower electrical bracket assembly (9) F13EB40-11 1 to
bracket (5) F13EB40A01 1 on Flange B.

Support lower electrical bracket assembly (9) and remove two
nuts (12) F13EN05-07 4 ,
washers (13) F13EW03-06 4 and two
bolts (17) F13EN05-05 2 . Remove lower electrical bracket assembly (9) from engine.

procedure.title: Removal of EEC Mounting Brackets ( 25382) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove the two bolts (26), the two washers (25) and the lower EEC mount bracket assembly (24).
Remove the two nuts (32), the two washers (31) and the lower rear mount bracket (30).
Remove the two nuts (1), the bolt (3), the washers (2), the two spacers (28) and the upper rear support bracket (29).
Remove the two bolts (10) and the upper front support bracket (23).
Remove the two nuts (12), the two washers (13), the two bolts (17) and the lower front mount bracket (27).
Remove the two nuts (20), the two washers (22), the two spacers (21), the two bolts (19) and the upper front mount bracket (18).

procedure.title: Inspection of EEC Lower Mounting Bracket (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Cracks through the upper and lower strengthening lip, at the locations shown, at either end, are acceptable up to 0.250 inch (6.35 mm) long. Do not stop drill the crack(s).

procedure.title: Installation of EEC Mounting Brackets ( 25382) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Install
bracket (18) F13EB40-09 1 on Flange A of fan case at Location A and secure with two
bolts (19) F13EB20-05 2 and
nuts (20) F13EN05-07 4 . Torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Install
support bracket (6) F13AB40-01 1 on bracket (18) and secure with two
bolts (10) F13EB20-06 2 and washers (11). Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Install
bracket (4) F13EB40A03 1 on Flange B and secure with one
bolt (3) A13NB20-03 1 ,
washer (2) A13NW03-01 1 and two
nuts (1) A13EN05-01 1 . Torque nuts 54 to 60 lb.in. (6.0-7.0 Nm).

Install
lower electrical bracket assembly (9) F13EB40-11 1 to rear side of Flange A and to
lower rear support bracket assembly (5) F13EB40A01 1 . Secure bracket (9) to Flange A at Locations B with two
bolts (17) F13EN05-05 2 ,
washers (13) F13EW03-06 4 and
nuts (12) F13EN05-07 4 , and to bracket (5) with four
washers (7) F13EW03-04 4 and
bolts (8) F13EB20-07 4 . Torque nuts (12) and bolts (8) 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

procedure.title: Installation of EEC Mounting Brackets ( 25382) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Lubricate threads of the two bolts (19) with engine oil (PWC03-001).

Install the upper front mount bracket (18) on flange A of the fan case with the two spacers (21), the two bolts (19), the two washers (22) and the two nuts (20). Torque bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm). Spacers must be installed between the front flange and the bracket.
Apply a thin coat of silicone grease (PWC09-003) on the two washers (13) for ease of assembly.

Lubricate threads of the two bolts (17) with engine oil (PWC03-001). Install the lower front mount bracket (27) on flange A of the fan case with the two bolts (17), the two washers (13) and the two nuts (12). Torque bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Lubricate threads of the two bolts (10) with engine oil (PWC03-001).
Install the upper front support bracket (23) on the bracket (18) with the two bolts (10). Torque bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Install the upper rear support bracket (29) with the two spacers (28), the bolt (3), the washer (2) and the two nuts (1) on the flange B. Washer must be installed below the bolt head.
Torque the bolt (3) 62 to 72 lbf.in. (7.0-8.1 Nm) dry.
Torque the nut (1) on the stud 54 to 60 lbf.in. (6.1-6.8 Nm) dry.
Install the lower rear mount bracket (30) with the two washers (31) and the two nuts (31). Torque nuts 54 to 60 lbf.in. (6.1-6.8 Nm) dry. Washers must be installed below the nuts.
Lubricate threads of the two bolts (26) with engine oil (PWC03-001).

Install the lower EEC mount bracket assembly (24) to the rear side of flange A and to the lower rear mount bracket (30) with the two bolts (26) and the two washers (25). Torque bolts 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

procedure.title: Removal of Ground Strap (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove
bolt (17) F13EB20-03 1 and
nut (15) F13EN05-04 1 and separate
clamp (13) F13EC07-01 1 and
rubber cushions (14) F13EC20-01 2 from
bracket (18) F13EB40-30 1 and
ground strap (19) F13EC01A01 1 .

Remove
nut (16) F13EN05-04 1 and bracket (18) and remove strap end from EEC ground terminal.

Remove strap end from Flange A: Remove
nut (26) F13EN05-04 1 ,
washer (27) F13EW03-03 1 and ground strap lug (32) and washer (28).

procedure.title: Installation of Ground Strap (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Clean shaded area (a), both lugs of ground strap and ground studs with solvent (PWC11-027) to ensure clean ground contact.

Install strap end to Flange A: Install washer (28), lug (32) of
strap (19) F13EC01A01 1 on the ground stud and one more
washer (27) F13EW03-03 1 with
nut (26) F13EN05-04 1 . Torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Install strap end to EEC ground terminal with
nut (16) F13EN05-04 1 . Tighten 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Install
cushions (14) F13EC20-01 2 and
loop clamp (13) F13EC07-01 1 on strap (19) to
bracket (18) F13EB40-30 1 with
bolt (17) F13EB20-03 1 and
nut (15) F13EN05-04 1 . Tighten 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Measure the torque of nuts (15, 16 and 26). Make sure that the torque is correct.
Apply coat of silicone sealant (PWC09-008) or (PWC09-008A) on ground terminals and area a (Ref. Fig. ).

procedure.title: Removal of Trim Plug (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME 28 VDC POWER IS OFF WHEN DISCONNECTING ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS.Record the class of the trim plug to be removed. The new plug must be the same class for T4.5 and N1 trim.

Remove
bolt (1) F13EB20-04 1 from retaining strap.

Remove
trim plug (2) F13BP26A01 1 .
Install protective cap on EEC connector.

procedure.title: Installation of Trim Plug (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME 28 VDC POWER IS OFF WHEN CONNECTING ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS. MAKE SURE THE CLASS OF REPLACEMENT TRIM PLUG IS THE SAME AS THE ONE REMOVED. MAKE SURE CONNECTOR PLUG IS FREE FROM MOISTURE; IF NECESSARY, DRY USING HEAT GUN.Remove protective cap.
Apply electrical contact enhancer to connectors (Ref. 70-00-00, CLEANING).

USE ONLY APPROVED TOOLS TO TIGHTEN TRIM PLUG CONNECTOR. CONNECTOR IS PROPERLY TIGHTENED WHEN ONLY THE BLUE COLOR BAND IS VISIBLE; RED COLOR BAND MUST NOT BE VISIBLE.Install
trim plug (2) F13BP26A01 1 on EEC. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lbf.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORS.Tighten the connector with soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lbf.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Install
bolt (1) F13EB20-04 1 and torque 36 to 40 lbf.in. (4.1 - 4.5 Nm). For aircraft with Data Transmission Unit (DTU) installed, make sure to pull the DTU circuit breaker on the overhead cockpit panel.
Set maintenance switch (LH) or (RH) test discrete to MAINT (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual). Switch located in the tail of the aircraft (Half equipment bay).
Select airframe 28 VDC power ON (15 Sec).
Select airframe 28 VDC power OFF.
Return maintenance switch (LH) or (RH) test discrete to NORMAL.
Select airframe 28 VDC power ON. This procedure could required to be performed several times (Maximum three times) to make sure EEC read the proper trim values.
Make sure no EEC fault lamps are on.
If fault lamps are on, refer to 72-00-00, FAULT ISOLATION.
Do a Check No. 2 - Engine Start, followed by a Check No. 3 - Engine Shutdown (Ref. Chapter 71-00-00, ADJUSTMENT/TEST).

general.para: Lubricate preformed packings, threads and mating surfaces with engine oil unless otherwise stated.
Install protective caps and plugs on disconnected tubes, component openings and electrical connectors after disassembly.

consumables.para: The consumable materials listed below are used in the following procedures.

special-tools.para: The special tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

fixtures-and-equipment.para: The fixtures, equipment and supplier tools listed below are used in the following procedures.

procedure.title: Removal of Outer Wiring Harness 25336 (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME ELECTRICAL POWER IS OFF WHEN REMOVING CONNECTORS.
procedure.step: Select maintenance test discrete ON (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).
Disconnect connectors P22 and P23. Check connectors for moisture. If necessary, dry with suitable heat gun.

Remove
nuts (3) F23EN05-02 3 ,
bolts (2) F23EB20-01 2 and
loop clamps (4) F23EC07-31 1 , fourteen places (Ref. View A, B, C, O, R and V).

Remove
nut (3) F24LN05-01 1 ,
bolt (2) F24LB20-09 1 and
loop clamp (5) F24LC07-03 1 from adjacent bracket (Ref. View D).

Remove
nut (3) F24FN05-17 1 ,
bolt (2) F24FB20-26 1 and
loop clamp (5) F24FC07-14 1 from adjacent loop clamp (Ref. View E).

Remove
nuts (3) F23EN05-04 2 ,
bolts (2) F23EB20-03 2 and
loop clamps (5) F23EC07-04 2 from adjacent tube bracket (Ref. View N).

Remove eight
screws (14) F50ES02-10 8 , washers (16) and two
multiple nut plates (15) F50EN05-12 2 securing connectors J6 and J7 to mounting bracket. Remove connectors J6 and J7 (Ref. View F).

Remove
nut (3) F24LN05-01 1 ,
bolt (2) F41EB20-05 1 ,
loop clamp (5) F24LC07-03 1 ,
spacer (19) F41ES33-02 1 and
loop clamp (13) F24LC07-05 1 (Ref. View G).

Remove
nut (3) F24LN05-01 1 ,
bolt (2) F24LB20-07 1 , and
loop clamp (7) F24LC07-04 1 from adjacent bracket (Ref. View H).

Remove
nut (3) F24FN05-17 1 ,
bolt (2) F24FB20-26 1 , and
loop clamp (6) F24FC07-14 1 from adjacent bracket (Ref. View I).

Remove
nuts (3) F23EN05-03 1 ,
bolts (2) F23EB20-02 1 , and loop clamps
(7) F23EC07-03 1 ,
(8) F23EC07-02 1 and (9) from adjacent brackets (Ref. View J).

Remove
nut (3) F23EN05-03 1 ,
bolt (2) F23EB20-02 1 , and loop clamps (11 and 22) (Ref. View K).
Remove nut (3), bolt (2), and loop clamp (12) from bracket (17) (Ref. View L).

Remove
nut (3) F23AN05-02 1 ,
bolts (2) F23AB20-02 1 , and
loop clamp (4) F23EC07-07 1 from adjacent bracket (Ref. View M).

Remove nuts (3), bolts (2), and loop clamps
(20) F23EC07-17
and
(21)
from adjacent bracket (Ref. View P).

Remove
nut (3) F23EN05-04 1 ,
bolts (2) F23EB20-03 1 , and
loop clamp (10) F23EC07-06 1 from adjacent bracket (Ref. View Q).

Remove
nuts (3) F23EN05-07 F23EN05-05 1,1 ,
bolts (2) F23EB20-04 F23EB20-06 1,1 and
loop clamps (9) F23EC07-11 F23EC07-09 1,1 from adjacent brackets, two places (Ref. View S and U).

Remove
nut (3) F23EN05-06 1 ,
bolt (2) F23EB20-05 1 and
loop clamp (10) F23EC07-10 1 from
bracket (18) F23EB40-36 1 (Ref. View T).
Disconnect connectors P1 and P4 from EEC. Disconnect P31 from trim box. Remove any other associated loop clamps, bolt and nuts.
Disconnect P36 from the EDU.
Disconnect connectors P27, P28, P29 and P39.
Disconnect connectors P15, P16, P17, P34 and P35.
Disconnect connectors P11 and P12.
Remove connectors P9, P10 and P30.
Check all connectors for moisture. If necessary, dry with suitable heat gun.

Check that all associated bolts, nuts and loop clamps are removed, and remove
wiring harness (1) F50BW17-02 1 from engine.
Place wiring harness and attaching hardware in sealable plastic bags and tag with engine model, serial number, wiring harness part number and date of storage.

procedure.title: Installation of Outer Wiring Harness 25336 (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME ELECTRICAL POWER IS OFF WHEN INSTALLING CONNECTORS.
DO NOT FORCE OR STRETCH HARNESS WHEN INSTALLING CONNECTORS OR FASTENING LOOP CLAMPS.
procedure.step: Apply electrical contact enhancer to connectors (Ref. 70-00-00, CLEANING).

Position wiring harness on intermediate case and connect connectors P22 and P23 to receptacles at front of intermediate case. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Install
loop clamps (4) F23EC07-04 F23EC07-08 F41EC07-35 2,3,1 on
wiring harness (1) F50BW17-02 1 and fasten to brackets with
bolts (2) F23EB20-03 F23EB20-04 F41EB20-03 2,3,4 and
nuts (3) F23EN05-05 F23EN05-04 3,2 , nine places (Ref. View A, C, O, R and V). Torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamps (4) F24LC07-02 4 on wiring harness and fasten to oil tube brackets with
bolts (2) F24LB20-06 5 , four places (Ref. View B). Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Position connectors J6 and J7 on electrical mounting bracket and secure with eight washers (16), eight
screws (14) F50ES02-10 8 and two
nut plates (15) F50EN05-12 2 (Ref. View F). Torque screws 7 to 8 lb.in. (0.8-1.0 Nm).

Install connectors P1 and P4 to EEC. Install connector P31 to trim box. Torque connectors P1, P4 with pliers (PWC90012). Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Install
loop clamp (5) F24LC07-03 1 , on wiring harness, and fasten to adjacent bracket with
bolt (2) F24LB20-09 1 and
nut (3) F24LN05-01 1 . Torque nut 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm). The direction of the bolt is determined by the incorporation of SB25329 (Ref. View D).

Install
loop clamp (5) F14EC07-01 1 on wiring harness, and fasten to adjacent loop clamp with
bolt (2) F14EB20-04 1 and
nut (3) F14EN05-01 1 (Ref. View E). Torque nut 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install loop clamps
(5) F24LC07-05 1 and
(13 F24LC07-03 1 ) on wiring harness, and fasten together with
bolt (2) F41EB20-05 1 ,
spacer (19) F41ES33-02 1 between loop clamps, and
nut (3) F24LN05-01 1 (Ref. View G). Torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install connectors P15, P16, P17 and P35 to HMU (Ref. View W). Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Position
loop clamp (7) F24LC07-04 1 on wiring harness and secure to J bracket with
bolt (2) F24LB20-07 1 and
nut (3) F24LN05-01 1 (Ref. View H). Torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Position
loop clamp (6) F24FC07-14 1 on wiring harness and fasten to bracket with
bolt (2) F24FB20-26 1 and
nuts (3) F24FN05-17 1 (Ref. View I). Torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Position loop clamps
(7) F23EC07-03 1 ,
(8) F23EC07-02 1 and (9) on wiring harness and fasten to brackets with bolts (2) and nuts (3) (Ref. View J). Torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install connectors P11 and P12 to their respective receptacles. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
Position loop clamp (11) on wiring harness and fasten to oil tube loop clamp (22) with bolt (2) and nuts (3) (Ref. View K) . Torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).
Position loop clamp (12) on wiring harness and fasten to bracket (17) with bolt (2) and nut (3) (Ref. View L). Torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install connectors P27, P28 and P29. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Position
loop clamp (10) F23EC07-06 1 on wiring harness and fasten to respective bracket with
bolts (2) F23EB20-03 1 and
nuts (3) F23EN05-04 1 (Ref. View Q). Torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Position loop clamps
(21) F23EC07-05 1 and
(20) F23EC07-17 1 on wiring harness and fasten to respective bracket with
bolts (2) F23EB20-03 1 and
nuts (3) F23EN05-04 1 (Ref. View P). Torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install connectors P9, P10 and P30. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Install connector P34 to start fuel and dump valve. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Position
loop clamps (9) F23EC07-11 F23EC07-09 1,1 on wiring harness and fasten to respective brackets with
bolts (2) F23EB20-06 F23EB20-04 1,1 and
nuts (3) F23EN05-07 F23EN05-05 1,1 , two places (Ref. View S and U). Torque nuts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).
Restore electrical power to the appropriate system and reset EEC circuit breaker to ON.
Select maintenance test discrete OFF (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).
Refer to Chapter 71-00-00 for checks following installation of wiring harness.

procedure.title: Removal of Outer Wiring Harness 25336 (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME ELECTRICAL POWER IS OFF WHEN REMOVING CONNECTORS.
procedure.step: Select maintenance test discrete ON (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

Remove
bolt (2) F41EB20-20 1 ,
nut (3) F41EN05-30 1 and
loop clamp (20) F13EC07-12 1 from EDU bracket (18) (Ref. Sheet 6, View F).

Remove
bolt (27) F41EB20-20 1 from the N2 speed sensor and remove
loop clamp (7) F13EC07-12 1 (Ref. Sheet 5, View G).

Remove
bolts (2) F23EB20-06 F23EB20-02 F23EB20-03 1,1,1 and
nuts (3) F23EN05-07 F23EN05-03 F23EN05-04 1,1,1 in three places. Remove two
loop clamps (7) F23EC07-17 F23EC07-05 1,1 and one
loop clamp (20) F23EC07-02 1 from brackets (21) (Ref. Sheet 6, View I).
Remove connector P36 from the EDU.

Remove
bolt (2) F23EB20-09 1 ,
nut (3) F23EN05-09 1 ,
clamp (32) F23EC07-13 1 and
grommet (33) F23EG17-01 1 from AGB bracket (Ref. Sheet 8).

Remove bolt (2), nut (3) and
loop clamp (11) F23EC07-12 1 above P12 from the oil tube
loop clamp (13) F23EC07-12 1 (Ref. Sheet 8).
Remove bolt (2), nut (3) and loop clamp (16) near P34, from the fuel pressure tube loop clamp (13) (Ref. Sheet 6, View H).

Remove
bolt (2) F24FB20-26 1 ,
nut (3) F24FN05-17 1 and
loop clamp (8) F24FC07-14 1 from the heat exchanger bracket (18) (Ref. Sheet 2).

Remove
bolt (2) F24LB20-07 1 ,
nut (3) F24LN05-01 1 and
loop clamp (10) F24LC07-041 1 from bracket (17) (Ref. Sheet 3, Detail C).

Remove
bolt (25) F41EB20-04 1 ,
spacer (26) F41ES33-01 1 ,
nut (3) F24FN05-06 1 and
loop clamp (7) F24FC07-04 1 from the fuel bypass tube
loop clamp (13) F24FC07-04 1 (Ref. Sheet 4).

Remove
bolt (2) F23EB20-05 1 ,
nut (3) F23EN05-06 1 and
loop clamp (11) F23EC07-10 1 from AGB bracket (Ref. Sheet 8).

Remove
bolt (2) F23EB20-04 1 , nut (3) and
loop clamp (16) F23EC07-09 1 from bracket (29) (Ref. Sheet 7, View J).

Remove
bolts (2) F23EB20-04 3 and
loop clamps (4) F23EC07-08 3 below P30 from the bypass duct brackets in three places (Ref. Sheet 5).

Remove
bolt (2) F23EN05-03 1 ,
nut (3) F23EB20-02 1 and
loop clamp (12) F23EC07-03 1 next to the HMU from the harness support (Ref. Sheet 4).

Remove
bolts (2) F23EB20-03 2 ,
nuts (3) F23EN05-04 2 and
loop clamps (5) F23EC07-04 1 and
(7) F23EC07-63 1 from the harness support bracket (Ref. Sheet 3, Detail D).

Remove
bolt (2) F23AB20-02 1 ,
nut (3) F23AN05-02 1 and
loop clamp (4) F23EC07-07 1 below P29 from the harness support (Ref. Sheet 2).

Remove
bolt (2) F23EB20-03 1 ,
nut (3) F23EN05-04 1 and
loop clamp (6) F23EC07-06 1 below P27&28 from the harness support (Ref. Sheet 2).

Remove bolt (2), nut (3) and
loop clamp (7) F24LC07-03 F24LB20-09 F24LN05-01 1,1,1 from the EEC mounting bracket (Ref. Sheet 1, View A, Detail K).

Remove
bolt (2) F24LB20-06 1 ,
nut (3) F50EN05-12 2 and
loop clamp (5) F24LC07-02 5 from the oil tube bracket (Ref. Sheet 1, View A).

Remove
bolts (2) F24LB20-06 5 and
loop clamps (4) F24LC07-02 4 from the oil tube brackets, in four places (Ref. Sheet 1, View A).

Remove
bolts (2) F23EB20-01 2 ,
nuts (3) F23EN05-02 3 and
loop clamps (6) F23EC07-31 1 and
(4) F23EC07-01 1 behind P22&23 from the harness support bracket in two places (Ref. Sheet 1, View A).
Remove connectors P22 and P23 from the P1/T1 sensors (Ref. Sheet 1, View A).

Remove eight
screws (14) F50ES02-10 8 , two
nut plates (15) F50EN05-12 2 and connectors J6 and J7 from the mounting bracket (Ref. Sheet 1, View B).

Remove
bolt (24) F41EB20-05 1 ,
spacer (19) F41ES33-02 1 ,
nut (3) F24LN05-01 1 and
loop clamp (9) F24LC07-05 1 from the oil pressure tube loop clamp (11) (Ref. Sheet 3, Detail B).

Remove
bolt (2) F14EB20-04 1 ,
nut (3) F14EN05-01 1 and
loop clamp (9) F14EC07-01 1 from the P1 tube bracket (Ref. Sheet 2).
Remove connectors P1 and P4 from the EEC.
Remove connectors P9, P10, P11, P12, P34, P35, P17, P16, P15, P28, P27, P39 and P29.
Check all connectors for moisture. If necessary, dry with suitable heat gun.
Check that all associated bolts, nuts and loop clamps are removed, and remove wiring harness (1) from engine.
Place wiring harness and attaching hardware in sealable plastic bags and tag with engine model, serial number, wiring harness part number and date of storage.

procedure.chgdesc: The installation procedure of outer wiring harness has been revised to add caution.
procedure.title: Installation of Outer Wiring Harness 25336 (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME ELECTRICAL POWER IS OFF WHEN INSTALLING CONNECTORS.
DO NOT FORCE OR STRETCH HARNESS WHEN INSTALLING CONNECTORS OR FASTENING LOOP CLAMPS.
procedure.note: Wiring harness loop clamp size selection can be minus one or plus two from their nominal dash number, to make sure there is a tight hold on the cable bundle.
procedure.step:
Install (or replace if necessary) insulation tape (ST6333-01) on the harness as follows: Cut 16 inches (406.4 mm.) of ST6333-01 insulation tape (22). Begin winding the
tape (22) F50ET29-11 ref on the harness from 0.125 in. ± 0.125 in. (3.175 mm ± 3.175 mm) below where the P29 branch joins the main harness (Ref. Sheet 2). Wind the first turn of tape (22) straight around the harness for one full turn. Stretch the tape lightly while winding. Continue winding the tape at an angle to cover a 3.25 in. ± 0.25 in (82.55 mm ± 6.35 mm) length of harness. Wind the tape evenly, use the centre guide line on the tape to create a smooth and even cover. Wind the last turn of tape straight around the harness for one full turn. Set the tension on (PWC90058) tie cable tool between 6 and 8.
MAKE SURE TO TIGHTEN EACH TIE CABLE UNTIL THE HARNESS IS IN POSITION AGAINST THE CABLE TIE MOUNT.Install ST3805-01
cable ties (23) F50ES25-15 2 within 0.375 in. (9.525 mm) of each end of the tape (22). Put the ends of the cable ties (23) as shown (Ref. Sheet 2).

Install wiring harness on left side of engine and connect connector P29. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Connect connector P39. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Connect connectors P27 and P28. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Connect connectors P15, P16, P17, P35 and P34. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Install wiring harness on right side and connect connector P30. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Connect connectors P10 and P9. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Connect connectors P11 and P12. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Connect connectors P1 and P4 to the EEC. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Install
loop clamp (9) F14EC07-01 1 , on wiring harness, and attach to P1 tube bracket with
bolt (2) F14EB20-04 1 and
nut (3) F14EN05-01 1 (Ref. Sheet 2). Torque nut 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamp (9) F24LC07-05 1 on wiring harness, and attach to oil pressure tube loop clamp (11) with
bolt (24) F41EB20-05 1 ,
spacer (19) F41ES33-02 1 and
nut (3) F24LN05-01 1 (Ref. Sheet 3, Detail B). Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

With the master keyways at the upper outboard side, install connectors J6 and J7 in the mounting bracket and attach with eight
screws (14) F50ES02-10 8 , and two
nut plates (15) F50EN05-12 2 ) (Ref. Sheet 1, View B). Torque screws 6 to 7 lb.in. (0.68-0.79 Nm).

Make sure the front of connectors P22 and P23 can extend 3 inches forward of the fan case to reach the P1/T1 sensors. If the sensors are already installed, connect connectors P22 and P23 (Ref. Sheet 1, View A). Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Install
loop clamps (6) F23EC07-31 1 and
(4) F23EC07-01 1 on wiring harness behind P22&23 and attach to harness support bracket with
bolts (2) F23EB20-01 2 and
nuts (3) F23EN05-02 3 in two places (Ref. Sheet 1, View A). Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamps (4) F24LC07-02 4 on wiring harness and attach to oil tube brackets with
bolts (2) F24LB20-06 5 , in four places (Ref. Sheet 1, View A). Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamp (5) F24LC07-02 5 on wiring harness, and attach to oil tube bracket with
bolt (2) F24LB20-06 5 and
nut (3) F50EN05-12 2 (Ref. Sheet 1, View A). Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamp (7) F24LC07-03 F24LB20-09 F24LN05-01 1,1,1 on wiring harness, and attach to top hole of EEC mounting bracket with bolt (2) and nut (3) . Torque nut 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm). The direction of the bolt is determined by the incorporation of SB25329 (Ref. Sheet 1, View A, Detail K).

Install
loop clamp (6) F23EC07-06 1 on wiring harness below P27&28 and attach to harness support with
bolt (2) F23EB20-03 1 and
nut (3) F23EN05-04 1 (Ref. Sheet 2). Torque nut 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamp (4) F23EC07-07 1 on wiring harness below P29 and attach to harness support with
bolt (2) F23AB20-02 1 and
nut (3) F23AN05-02 1 (Ref. Sheet 2). Torque nut 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamps (5) F23EC07-04 1 and
(7) F23EC07-63 1 , on wiring harness, and attach to harness support bracket with bolts (2) and nuts (3) (Ref. Sheet 3, Detail D). Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamp (12) F23EC07-03 1 on wiring harness next to HMU and attach to harness support with
bolt (2) F23EB20-02 1 and
nut (3) F23EN05-03 1 (Ref. Sheet 4). Torque nut 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamps (4) F23EC07-08 3 on wiring harness below P30 and attach to bypass duct brackets with
bolts (2) F23EB20-04 3 , in three places (Ref. Sheet 5). Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).
If not already installed, install bracket (29) on lower bypass duct flange, and attach with bolt (31), washer (30) and nut (3) (Ref. Sheet 7, View J). Torque bolt 27 to 30 lb.in. (3.05-3.39 Nm).
If not already installed, install two bolts (31), washers (30) and nuts (3) (Ref. Sheet 7, View J). Torque bolts 27 to 30 lb.in. (3.05-3.39 Nm).

Install
loop clamp (16) F23EC07-09 1 on wiring harness and attach to bracket (29) with
bolt (2) F23EB20-04 1 and
nut (3) F23EN05-05 1 (Ref. Sheet 7, View J). Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamp (11) F23EC07-12 1 on wiring harness and attach to AGB bracket with bolt (2) and nut (3) (Ref. Sheet 8). Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamp (7) F24FC07-04 1 on wiring harness and attach to fuel bypass tube
loop clamp (13) F41FC07-01 1 with
bolt (25) F41EB20-04 1 ,
spacer (26) F41ES33-01 1 and
nut (3) F24FN05-06 1 (Ref. Sheet 4). Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamp (10) F24LC07-04 1 on wiring harness and attach to bracket (17) with
bolt (2) F24LB20-07 1 and
nut (3) F24LN05-01 1 (Ref. Sheet 3, Detail C). Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamp (8) F24FC07-14 1 on wiring harness and attach to heat exchanger bracket (18) with
bolt (2) F24FB20-26 1 and
nut (3) F24FN05-17 1 (Ref. Sheet 2). Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamp (16) F23EC07-14 1 on wiring harness near P34, and attach to fuel pressure tube
loop clamp (13) F23EC07-15 1 with
bolt (2) F23EB20-10 2 and
nut (3) F23EN05-10 1 (Ref. Sheet 6, View H). Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).
Install loop clamp (11) on wiring harness above P12 and attach to oil tube loop clamp (13) with bolt (2) and nut (3) (Ref. Sheet 8). Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
grommet (33) F23EG17-01 1 and
clamp (32) F23EC07-13 1 on wiring harness, and attach to AGB bracket with
bolt (2) F23EB20-09 1 and
nut (3) F23EN05-09 1 (Ref. Sheet 8). Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Connect connector P36 to the EDU. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

If not already installed, install two fire detection
brackets (28) F50EB40A08 2 and three
brackets (21) F24EB40-02 3 to the fan case rear flange (Ref. Sheet 6, View I). Attach with three nuts (34) and torque 54 to 60 lb.in. (6.1-6.78 Nm).

Install two
loop clamps (7) F23EC07-17 F23EC07-05 1,1 and one
loop clamp (20) F23EC07-02 1 on wiring harness, and attach to brackets (21) in three places with
bolts (2) F23EB20-06 F23EB20-02 F23EB20-03 1,1,1 and
nuts (3) F23EN05-07 F23EN05-03 F23EN05-04 1,1,1 (Ref. Sheet 6, View I). Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Remove the
lower bolt (27) F41EB20-03 4 from N2 speed sensor. Install
loop clamp (7) F41EC07-35 1 on wiring harness, and attach to N2 speed sensor with
bolt (27) F41EB20-03 4 (Ref. Sheet 5, View G). Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

If not already installed, install
bracket (18) F41EB40-20 1 on EDU mounting bracket, and attach with
bolt (2) F13EB20-10 2 (Ref. Sheet 6, View F). Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install
loop clamp (20) F13EC07-12 1 on wiring harness, and attach to bracket (18) with bolt (2) and nut (3) (Ref. Sheet 6, View F). Torque nut 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).
Restore electrical power to the appropriate system and reset EEC circuit breaker to ON.
Select maintenance test discrete OFF (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).
Refer to Chapter 71-00-00 for checks following installation of wiring harness.

procedure.title: Removal of Rear Core Wiring Harness (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME ELECTRICAL POWER IS OFF WHEN REMOVING CONNECTORS.
procedure.step: Select maintenance test discrete ON (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

Disconnect
rear core wiring harness N1 OUT connectors (22) F50BW17-04 1 from
N1/T4.5 terminal box (33) F33BB16-01 1 (Ref. 77-20-01).

Remove two
bolts (6) F33EB20-03 1 (Ref. View D) and two
self-locking nuts (2) F33EN05-03 1 from bracket (1). Remove loop clamps
(3) F33EC07-02 1 ,
(4) F33EC07-03 1 and
(5) F33EC07-03 1 from wiring harness (22).

Remove two self-locking nuts
(25) F33EN05-03 1 and
(27) F33EN05-04 1 (Ref. View B), two bolts
(29) F33EB20-03 1 and
(32) F33EB20-04 1 and
bracket (31) F33EB40-07 1 . Remove loop clamps
(24) F35EC07-01 1 ,
(26) F33EC07-02 1 ,
(28) F33EC07-03 1 and
(30) F33EC07-03 1 from rear core wiring harness (22).

Remove
self-locking nut (8) F33EN05-02 2 (Ref. View D) and
bolt (13) F33EB20-03 2 from bracket (7). Remove loop clamps
(9) F33EC07-02 1 ,
(11) F33EC07-03 1 and
(12) F33EC07-03 1 from wiring harness (22).

Remove eight
screws (18) F23ES02-01 8 (Ref. View A) or cap screws, eight
washers (17) F23EW03-01 8 and two
nut plates (14) F23EN05-01 2 from two terminal connectors (15). Remove two
gaskets (16) F23EG03-01 2 .

Remove two
bolts (19) F50EB20-01 2 and remove wiring harness (22) from engine.

Remove two
bolts (20) F50EB20-01 2 and two
self-locking nuts (35) F50EN05-11 2 securing
bracket (21) F50EB40-38 1 to wiring harness.

INSTALL PROTECTIVE CAPS OVER THE OUTSIDE OF ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS. DO NOT INSTALL PROTECTIVE CAPS ON THE INSIDE OF ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR SLEEVES. IMPROPER INSTALLATION OF CAP CAN DAMAGE THE INSIDE OF THE CONNECTOR (Ref. 70-00-00, REMOVAL/INSTALLATION).Place protective covers on all connectors and receptacles.

procedure.title: Installation of Rear Core Wiring Harness (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME ELECTRICAL POWER IS OFF WHEN INSTALLING CONNECTORS.
DO NOT FORCE OR STRETCH HARNESS WHEN INSTALLING CONNECTORS OR FASTENING LOOP CLAMPS.
TIGHTEN CONNECTORS WITH APPROVED TOOL ONLY. CONNECTORS ARE PROPERLY TIGHTENED WHEN ONLY THE BLUE COLOR BAND IS VISIBLE.
procedure.step: Apply electrical contact enhancer to connectors (Ref. 70-00-00, CLEANING).

Secure
bracket assembly (21) F50EB40-38 1 to
rear core harness (22) F50BW17-04 1 using two
bolts (20) F50EB20-01 2 and two
self-locking nuts (35) F50EN05-11 2 . Torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install two
gaskets (16) F23EG03-01 2 (Ref. View A) on two terminal connectors (15) and position wiring harness on engine. Secure wiring harness (22) to rear support ring using two
bolts (19) F50EB20-01 2 . Torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Secure two terminal connectors (15) to lower bypass duct using eight
washers (17) F23EW03-01 8 and eight
cap screws (18) F23ES02-01 8 . Torque 6.0 to 7.0 lb.in. (0.6-0.8 Nm).

Install loop clamps
(9) F33EC07-02 1 ,
(11) F33EC07-03 1 and
(12) F33EC07-03 1 (Ref. View C) on wiring harness and
clamp (10) F33EC07-01 2 (part of T4.5 wiring harness). Secure loop clamps to bracket (7) and clamp (10) (part of T4.5 wiring harness) using
bolt (13) F33EB20-03 2 and
self-locking nut (8) F33EN05-02 2 . Torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

DO NOT LUBRICATE THREADS. Secure
loop clamp (24) F35EC07-01 1 (Ref. View B) and
bracket (31) F33EB40-07 1 to
bracket (23) F33EB40-08 1 using
bolt (32) F33EB20-04 1 and
self-locking nut (27) F33EN05-04 1 . Torque 27 to 30 lb.in. (3.0-3.4 Nm).

Install loop clamp
(26) F33EC07-02 1 ,
(28) F33EC07-03 1 and
(30) F33EC07-03 1 on wiring harness and secure to bracket (31) using
bolt (29) F33EB20-03 1 and
self-locking nut (25) F33EN05-03 1 . Torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Position loop clamp
(3) F33EC07-02 1 ,
(4) F33EC07-03 1 and
(5) F33EC07-03 1 (Ref. View D) on wiring harness and secure to bracket (1) using
bolts (6) F33EB20-03 1 and
self-locking nuts (2) F33EN05-03 1 . Torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install rear core wiring harness (22) in
N1/T4.5 terminal box (33) F33BB16-01 1 (Ref. 77-20-01).
Restore electrical power to appropriate system and reset EEC circuit breaker to ON.
Select maintenance discrete OFF.
Pull EEC circuit breaker to OFF.

procedure.title: Removal of Front Core Wiring Harness (25095) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME ELECTRICAL POWER IS OFF WHEN REMOVING CONNECTORS.
procedure.step: Select maintenance test discrete ON (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).
Remove upper (outer and inner) bypass ducts (Ref. 72-70-01).
Remove top P2.8 supply tube (Ref. 75-30-01).

Remove
bolt (2) B23EB20-01 1 and
loop clamp (3) F50EC07-24 1 (Ref. Detail A).

25378: Remove two
screws (4) F23AB20-04 2 , two
washers (5) F23AW03-02 2 and
nut plate (6) F23AB40A03 1 (Ref. View B). Remove J29 connector (7) from left outer bypass duct and remove
gasket (8) F23AG03-04 1 .
25378: Remove four screws (4), four washers (5) and nut plate (6) (Ref. View B). Remove J29 connector (7) from left outer bypass duct and remove gasket (8).

Remove three
self-locking nuts (9) A15EN05-01 3 , three
bolts (10) A15EB20-06 A15EB20-06 3 and three
loop clamps (11) A15EC07-04 A15EC07-01 2,1 .

25378: Remove two
screws (12) F23AB20-03 4 , two
washers (13) F23AW03-01 4 and
nut plate (14) F23AB40A01 1 (Ref. View D). Remove J30 connector (15) from right side bypass duct and remove
gasket (16) F23AG03-02 1 .
25378: Remove four screws (12), four washers (13) and nut plate (14) (Ref. View D). Remove J30 connector (15) from right side bypass duct and remove gasket (16).

Remove
bolt (17) B23EB20-01 1 and
loop clamp (18) F50EC07-01 1 (Ref. Detail C).

Remove
self-locking nut (19) A15AN05-17 1 ,
bolt (20) A15AB20-20 1 and
loop clamps (21) A15EC07-01 1 (Ref. View E).

Remove
self-locking nut (22) A15AN05-17 1 ,
spacer (23) A15AS33-04 1 ,
loop clamps (24) A15EC07-01 1 and
bolt (25) A15AB20-24 1 (Ref. View F).

Remove
self-locking nut (26) A15AN05-03 1 ,
bolt (27) A15AB20-16 1 and
loop clamp (28) A15EC07-01 1 (Ref. View G).

Remove
self-locking nut (29) A15AN05-17 1 ,
bolt (30) A15AB20-20 1 and
loop clamp (31) A15EC07-01 1 from
bracket (32) A15EB40-05 1 (Ref. View H).

Remove
self-locking nut (33) A15EN05-01 1 ,
bolt (34) A15EB20-06 1 and
loop clamp (35) A15EC07-01 1 from P3 tube assembly (36) (Ref. View J).

Remove P connectors (37, 38, 39, 40, 41, 42 and 43) and remove
wiring harness (1) F50BW17-03 1 .
Put protective covers on all connectors and receptacles.

procedure.title: Installation of Front Core Wiring Harness (25095) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME ELECTRICAL POWER IS OFF WHEN INSTALLING CONNECTORS.
DO NOT FORCE OR STRETCH HARNESS WHEN INSTALLING CONNECTORS OR FASTENING LOOP CLAMPS.
HARNESS CONNECTORS MUST BE ASSEMBLED WITH CLEAN, DRY THREADS. THE USE OF ENGINE OIL, SPRAY RELEASE AGENTS AND OTHER LUBRICANTS IS PROHIBITED.
INSTALL AND TORQUE CONNECTORS WITH APPROVED TOOLS ONLY. CONNECTORS ARE FULLY ENGAGED WHEN ONLY THE BLUE COLOR BAND IS VISIBLE. FINAL TORQUE OF THE CONNECTOR IS TO BE APPLIED USING SOFT-JAWED PLIERS.
procedure.step: Apply electrical contact enhancer to all connectors (Ref. Ch. 70-00-00, CLEANING).

Position
front core wiring harness (1) F50BW17-03 1 on compressor case.

Engage master keyway and install P24 connector (40) and P25 connector (41) on linear stator vane actuator. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Engage master keyway and install P18 connector (39) on anti-icing valve. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Engage master keyway and install P14 connector (38) and P13 connector (37) on compressor bleed valve solenoid. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Engage master keyway and install P37 connector (42) and P38 connector (43) on compressor start bleed valve solenoid. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

25378: Install
gasket (8) F23AG03-04 1 on J29 connector (7) and position connector in left lower bypass duct half with master keyway at top center. Attach with
nut plate (6) F23AB40A03 1 , two
washers (5) F23AW03-02 4 and two
screws (4) F23AB20-04 4 (Ref. View B). Torque the screws 6 to 7 lb.in. (0.6-0.8 Nm).

25378: Install gasket (8) on J29 connector (7) and position connector in left lower bypass duct half with master keyway at top center. Attach with nut plate (6), four washers (5) and four screws (4) (Ref. View B). Torque the screws 6 to 7 lbf.in. (0.6-0.8 Nm).

Position
loop clamp (3) F50EC07-24 1 on wiring harness (1) and attach clamp to left side lower fairing with
bolt (2) B23EB20-01 1 (Ref. Detail A). Torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Position
loop clamp (11) A15EC07-04 A15EC07-01 2,1 on wiring harness (1). Attach clamp to P3 tube assembly (36) with
bolt (10) A15EB20-06 3 and
nut (9) A15EN05-01 3 . Torque nut 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

DO NOT LUBRICATE THREADS.Position two loop clamps (11) on wiring harness (1). Attach clamps (11) to flange mounted brackets with two bolts (10) and two self-locking nuts (9). Torque 27 to 30 lb.in. (3.0-3.4 Nm).

25378 Install
gasket (16) F23AG03-02 1 on J30 connector (15) and position connector in right lower bypass duct half with master keyway at top center. Attach with
nut plate (14) F23AB40A01 1 , two
washers (13) F23AW03-01 4 and two
screws (12) F23AB20-03 4 (Ref. View D). Torque 6 to 7 lb.in. (0.6-0.8 Nm).

25378: Install gasket (16) on J30 connector (15) and position connector in left lower bypass duct half with master keyway at top center. Attach with nut plate (14), four washers (13) and four screws (12) (Ref. View B). Torque the screws 6 to 7 lbf.in. (0.6-0.8 Nm).

Position
loop clamp (18) F50EC07-01 1 on wiring harness (1). Attach clamp (18) to right lower side fairing with
bolt (17) B23EB20-01 1 (Ref. Detail C). Torque bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Position
loop clamp (35) A15EC07-01 1 on wiring harness (1). Attach clamp to P3 tube assembly (36) with
bolt (34) A15EB20-06 1 and

loop clamp (28) A15EC07-01 1 on wiring harness (1). Attach clamp (28) to P3 adapter flange with

loop clamp (21) A15EC07-01 1 on wiring harness (1). Attach clamps (21) to flange mounted bracket with

procedure.title: Removal of Front Core Wiring Harness (25095) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME ELECTRICAL POWER IS OFF WHEN REMOVING CONNECTORS.
procedure.step: Select maintenance test discrete ON (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).
Remove upper (outer and inner) bypass ducts (Ref. 72-70-01).
Remove top P2.8 supply tube (Ref. 75-30-01).

Remove
bolt (2) B23EB20-01 1 and

self-locking nuts (9) A15EN05-01 3 , three

bolt (17) B23EB20-01 1 and

Remove

procedure.title: Installation of Front Core Wiring Harness (25095) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE AIRFRAME ELECTRICAL POWER IS OFF WHEN INSTALLING CONNECTORS.
DO NOT FORCE OR STRETCH HARNESS WHEN INSTALLING CONNECTORS OR FASTENING LOOP CLAMPS.
HARNESS CONNECTORS MUST BE ASSEMBLED WITH CLEAN, DRY THREADS. THE USE OF ENGINE OIL, SPRAY RELEASE AGENTS AND OTHER LUBRICANTS IS PROHIBITED.
INSTALL AND TORQUE CONNECTORS WITH APPROVED TOOLS ONLY. CONNECTORS ARE FULLY ENGAGED WHEN ONLY THE BLUE COLOR BAND IS VISIBLE. FINAL TORQUE OF THE CONNECTOR IS TO BE APPLIED USING SOFT-JAWED PLIERS.
procedure.step: Apply electrical contact enhancer to all connectors (Ref. Ch. 70-00-00, CLEANING).

Position
front core wiring harness (1) F50BW17-03 1 on compressor case.

Engage master keyway and install P24 connector (40) and P25 connector (41) on linear stator vane actuator. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Engage master keyway and install P18 connector (39) on anti-icing valve. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Engage master keyway and install P14 connector (38) and P13 connector (37) on compressor bleed valve solenoid. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

Engage master keyway and install P37 connector (42) and P38 connector (43) on compressor start bleed valve solenoid. Tighten the connector using one of the following methods:
SOFT JAWED PLIERS HAVE A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in (11.3 Nm). DO NOT USE STEEL JAWED PLIERS TO TIGHTEN CONNECTORSTighten the connector using soft jawed pliers (PWC90012) or Glenair TG69. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.
WRENCH ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR HAS A DESIGN SLIP TORQUE OF 100 lb.in. (11.3 Nm).Tighten the connector with a wrench assembly connector (PWC58104) or Glenair TG70. Apply reasonable force to make sure connector coupling nut is firmly tightened and the red band is covered.

25378: Install
gasket (8) F23AG03-04 1 on J29 connector (7) and position connector in left lower bypass duct half with master keyway at top center. Attach with
nut plate (6) F23AB40A03 1 , two
washers (5) F23AW03-02 4 and two
screws (4) F23AB20-04 4 (Ref. View B). Torque the screws 6 to 7 lb.in. (0.6-0.8 Nm).

25378: Install gasket (8) on J29 connector (7) and position connector in left lower bypass duct half with master keyway at top center. Attach with nut plate (6), four washers (5) and four screws (4) (Ref. View B). Torque the screws 6 to 7 lbf.in. (0.6-0.8 Nm).

Position
loop clamp (3) F50EC07-24 1 on wiring harness (1) and attach clamp to left side lower fairing with
bolt (2) B23EB20-01 1 (Ref. Detail A). Torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Position
loop clamp (11) A15EC07-04 A15EC07-01 2,1 on wiring harness (1). Attach clamp to P3 tube assembly (36) with
bolt (10) A15EB20-06 3 and
nut (9) A15EN05-01 3 . Torque nut 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

DO NOT LUBRICATE THREADS.Position two loop clamps (11) on wiring harness (1). Attach clamps (11) to flange mounted brackets with two bolts (10) and two self-locking nuts (9). Torque 27 to 30 lb.in. (3.0-3.4 Nm).

25378 Install
gasket (16) F23AG03-02 1 on J30 connector (15) and position connector in right lower bypass duct half with master keyway at top center. Attach with
nut plate (14) F23AB40A01 1 , two
washers (13) F23AW03-01 4 and two
