procedure.title: Patch-Making Procedure
procedure.caution: PATCH-MAKING PROCEDURE IS NOT A CLEANING PROCEDURE FOR FILTER ELEMENTS.
procedure.step: Remove oil filter element from engine.
Seal inner cavity of filter element with suitable tapered plugs.
Place filter in cylindrical container.
Fill container with solvent (PWC11-048), enough to cover filter element but leaving a space for liquid movement when shaking, and install cover.
Shake container for about three minutes manually, or 30 seconds in a vibrator.
Remove cover. Make sure there are no deposits left on filter. If there is, install container cover and continue shaking.
Install new filter patch (PWC05-190) in filter patch holder and place over a suitable container 0.5 gal (2 liters) min.
Remove filter element from container.
Pour liquid contents of container into filter patch holder.
Flush out all possible loose particles which may still be in container by pouring some solvent (PWC11-048) into it, shaking, then emptying into filter patch holder.
Remove filter patch from filter patch holder and place in patch receptacle. Identify sample with type of filter, engine serial number and flight hours run.

If any debris is found, particles large enough to be trapped by filter patch, should be sent to laboratory for material spectrographic analysis. Some operators retain the filter patches to establish a visual coloration trend. Operators doing this, need to build up their own experience for patch coloration trend evaluation because trends may vary from one engine to another and may be affected by the operating environment and maintenance practices.
Remove plugs from filter element. Make sure the preformed packing does not drop inside the element).
WHEN USING COMPRESSED AIR FOR DRYING, REGULATE TO 29 psi (200 kPa) OR LESS. WEAR GOGGLES OR FACE SHIELD TO PROTECT EYES.Dry filter element with clean compressed air at 29 psi (200 kPa).
Install filter element on engine (Ref. Removal/Installation).

procedure.title: Debris in Oil System Inspection (Chip Detector and/or Oil Filter Bypass Warning)
procedure.note: This procedure should be used in conjunction with debris in oil system fault isolation chart (Ref. 72-00-00, ENGINE - GENERAL - FAULT ISOLATION 01).
New or recently overhauled engines may exhibit debris in the oil system for the first 50 hours of operation.
procedure.step: Confirmed oil filter bypass requires engine removal. An assessment of the amount of contamination can indicate whether a bypass has actually occurred. If the oil filters are replaced at regular intervals and debris is found deposited on most of the filter element surface, associated housing, chip detector and strainer, it can be considered that a bypass has occurred.

Remove and inspect chip detector and filters. Use a magnet and determine if any of the debris collected is magnetic. If magnetic debris is found, use a magnifying glass and inspect. Analysis debris and take action required (Ref. Subpara. ).

Do a patch-making procedure (Ref. Subpara. ) on relevant filter and transfer any debris from chip detector (Ref. Subpara. ). Send filter patch and/or tape with chip detector debris for laboratory analysis (Ref. Subpara. )

If allowable debris is found (Ref. Subpara. , , ), clean and install the chip detector again. Inspect the pressure filter (Ref. Subpara. , ) and again install or replace as required. The aircraft may be returned to normal operation.
If non-allowable debris Category 1 is found (Ref. Subpara. , , ), remove the engine.

If non-allowable debris Category 2 or 3 is found (Ref. Subpara. , , or ), and the engine has no history of generating debris within 400 flight hours, proceed as follows: Clean and install the chip detector, the associated strainer and replace the oil filter. Run the engine at 80% TO power for 10 minutes. Remove and inspect the chip detector and oil filter. If no debris is found: Clean and install the chip detector and the oil filter again. Return the engine to service. Remove and inspect the chip detector after 10 flight hours. Remove and inspect the main oil filter and the chip detector after 50 flight hours. If debris is found: Drain, flush and fill the engine oil system again. Clean and install the chip detector and replace the oil filter. Run the engine at 80% TO power for 10 minutes. Remove and inspect the chip detector(s) and the main oil filter. If no debris is found: Clean and install the chip detector and the oil filter; return the engine to service. Remove and inspect the chip detector after 10 flight hours. Remove and inspect the main oil filter and the chip detector after 50 flight hours. If debris is found, replace the engine.

If non-allowable debris Category 2 or 3 is found (Ref. Subpara. , , or ), and the engine has a history, within 400 flight hours, of generating debris, proceed as follows: Review the results of the last laboratory analysis. Results of the last sample must be known prior to continuing operation. If the results show bearing material (AMS6444 (52100) / AMS6491 (M50) / AMS6414 / AMS6415), replace the engine immediately if the laboratory report was made following a confirmed chip detector and/or oil filter debris (See Note 2). Following the debris analysis of the oil filter, if the bearing material debris confirmed by the laboratory analysis is in trace amount only (less than 10% of the debris weight), continue in service and no action is required. If the laboratory report was made following a confirmed low oil pressure or confirmed chip detector debris and/or confirmed oil filter debris and the laboratory report of the chip or debris found in the oil filter was confirmed in minor or major constituent, replace engine immediately.If the laboratory report indicates bearing material in the small amount category and repositioning of the aircraft to a facility equipped for engine removal is a preferred option, provide the laboratory report and photographs of the chip detector and oil filter condition to Pratt & Whitney Canada for further revaluation in support of a recommendation for engine repositioning. If the laboratory report was made following a scheduled oil filter check with no indication of low oil pressure event, chip detector and/or oil filter debris, the engine can continue in service. If the results show gear (AMS6265) or any other ferrous material, the quantity of debris is not increasing and the engine is not consistently generating debris, install the chip detector and the filter. Return the engine to service. Remove and inspect the oil filter for debris after the engine has run for 50 flight hours. If the amount of debris is increasing, replace the engine at the first opportunity within 10 flight hours. If the debris is generated by the accessory gearbox module, this may be replaced rather than the whole engine. Following the debris analysis of the oil filter, if the gears material debris confirmed by the laboratory analysis is in trace amount only (less than 10% of the debris weight), continue in service and no action is required. If non-magnetic debris is found, for disposition refer to Subpara. , .

procedure.title: Chip Detector Collected Debris Transfer
procedure.step: Remove chip detector.
Dip magnet end in solvent (PWC11-027) to remove oil.
Transfer debris at magnet end to clear adhesive tape.
Identify tape with engine serial number and hours run since new or overhauled.
Send debris for analysis (Ref. Subpara. )
Install chip detector.

n-para.title: Adjustment/Test
n-para.para: Start the engine, and do the checks associated with the installation/replacement of the oil filter (Ref. 71-00-00, POWER PLANT - ADJUSTMENT/TEST).

procedure.title: Oil Filter Bypass Valve
procedure.caution: DO NOT EXTEND, CONTRACT, BEND OR OTHERWISE DAMAGE OIL FILTER BYPASS VALVE SPRING.
procedure.step: Wash parts in clean petroleum solvent (PWC11-027). If necessary, use a nylon bristle brush to remove contaminants.
Dry parts using clean, dry, filtered compressed air blast, or allow parts to stand and air dry.

general.para: Use engine oil to lubricate preformed packings, threads and mating surfaces, unless otherwise stated.
Lubricate preformed packings in fuel system with engine fuel.
Install protective caps and plugs on disconnected tubes, component openings and electrical connectors after sub-assembly.

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Drain oil system (Ref. 72-00-00, SERVICING).

Remove three
nuts (4) F41LN05-07 3 ,
washers (3) F41LW03-15 3 ,
bracket (9) F41EB40-06 1 and
bolt (10) F41LB20-25 3 .

25260: Remove four
bolts (6) F24FB20-06 F24FB20-09 2,2 and
bracket (11) F41EB40-05 1 from
fuel transfer tubes (7) F50FT17A01 F50FT17A02 1,1 to
fuel/oil heat exchanger (8) F41LE06-01 1 .

25260: Remove four
bolts (6) F24FB20-06 F24FB20-09 2,2 ,
bracket (11) F41EB40-05 1 and three
washers (12) F24FW03-09 3 from
fuel transfer tubes (7) F50FT17A01 F50FT17A02 1,1 to
fuel/oil heat exchanger (8) F41LE06-01 1 .

Disengage fuel pressure transfer tubes (7) from the heat exchanger bosses and remove heat exchanger from engine. Discard
preformed packings (5) F24FP03-05 F24FP03-06 2,2 . Remove
transfer tubes (2) F41LT17-03 2 and discard
preformed packings (1) F41LP03-17 4 .
Install protective caps and/or plugs in all openings.

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove all protective caps and/or plugs.

Install new preformed packings
(1) F41LP03-17 4 and
(5) F24FP03-05 F24FP03-06 2,2 on transfer tubes
(2) F41LT17-03 2 and
(7) F50FT17A01 F50FT17A02 1,1 .
Insert transfer tubes (2) into oil manifold.

DO NOT LUBRICATE THREADS.Install
heat exchanger (8) F41LE06-01 1 on the mounting flange two studs and secure with two
washers (3) F41LW03-15 3 and
nuts (4) F41LN05-07 3 . Install
bolt (10) F41LB20-25 3 , washer (3) and
bracket (9) F41EB40-06 1 on the mounting flange. Torque nuts 27 to 30 lb.in. (3.0-3.4 Nm).

25260: Insert
fuel transfer tubes (7) F50FT17A01 F50FT17A02 1,1 into bosses on
heat exchanger (8) F41LE06-01 1 . Install
bracket (11) F41EB40-05 1 and four
bolts (6) F24FB20-06 F24FB20-09 2,2 . Torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

25260: Insert
fuel transfer tubes (7) F50FT17A01 F50FT17A02 1,1 into bosses on
heat exchanger (8) F41LE06-01 1 . Install
bracket (11) F41EB40-05 1 , three
washers (12) F24FW03-09 3 and four
bolts (6) F24FB20-06 F24FB20-09 2,2 . Torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm). Orientation of the bracket is with the long tab on the flange.
Refer to Chapter 71-00-00 for checks following installation of fuel/oil heat exchanger.

general.para: Use engine oil to lubricate preformed packings, threads and mating surfaces, unless otherwise stated.
Install protective caps and plugs on disconnected tubes, component openings and electrical connectors after sub-assembly.

n-para.title: Scavenge Oil Return to Tank Tube Assembly

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove two
nuts (6) F14LN05-06 2 ,
bolts (1) F14LB20-05 F14LB20-06 2,2 and
loop clamps (4) F14LC07-03 2 securing
scavenge oil return tube assembly (3) F14LT17A07 1 to intermediate case
brackets (5) B23NB40-38 1 .
Remove two bolts (1) at flange on top of intermediate case and two bolts (1) at the gearbox mounting boss and remove scavenge oil return tube assembly (3).

Remove and discard preformed packings
(2) F14LP03-04 1 ,
(7) F24FP03-06 1 . Place protective covers on tube (3).

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Lubricate two new preformed packings
(2) F14LP03-04 1 ,
(7) F24FP03-06 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001) and install on
scavenge oil return tube assembly (3) F14LT17A07 1 .

Install scavenge oil tube (3) to boss on intermediate case, and to the accessory gearbox mounting boss and secure with four
bolts (1) F14LB20-05 F14LB20-06 2,2 . Torque two bolts at the intermediate case boss 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm) and torque two bolts at the accessory gearbox area 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

DO NOT LUBRICATE THREADS OF BOLTS (1) SECURING LOOP CLAMPS (4). Install two
loop clamps (4) F14LC07-03 2 on scavenge oil tube (3) and secure to the
brackets (5) B23NB40-38 1 , and secure with two bolts (1) and
nuts (6) F14LN05-06 2 . Torque nuts 27 to 30 lb.in. (3.0-3.4 Nm).

n-para.title: No. 4 Bearing Scavenge Oil Tube Assembly

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove
nut (10) F50LN05-26 2 ,
bolt (14) F50LB20-27 1 and
loop clamp (11) F50LC07-02 2 securing
No. 4 bearing scavenge oil tube assembly (15) F50LT17A05 1 to bracket on Flange E.
Remove bolt (34) and nut (35) to disconnect the loop clamp (33) from the bracket of the primary fuel tube (36).
Remove nut (10), bolt (14) and remaining loop clamp (11).

Remove two
bolts (13) F50LB20-37 F50LB20-38 2,2 at outer bypass duct and two nuts (10) and bolts (13) at flange on elbow (29) and remove No. 4 bearing scavenge oil tube assembly (15) and
gasket (8) F50LG03-09 1 . Discard gasket.

Remove four preformed packings
(9) F50LP03-23 2 ,
(12) F50LP03-20 2 . Discard preformed packings. Place protective covers on tube ends.

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Lubricate two new
preformed packings (9) F50LP03-23 2 with engine oil (PWC03-001) and install on elbow (29). Install new
metal gasket (8) F50LG03-09 1 on elbow (29).

Lubricate two new
preformed packings (12) F50LP03-20 2 and install on
No. 4 bearing scavenge oil tube assembly (15) F50LT17A05 1 .

DO NOT LUBRICATE THREADS OF BOLTS (13) AT ELBOW (29).Install No. 4 bearing scavenge oil tube (15) to elbow (29) with two
bolts (13) F50LB20-37 F50LB20-38 2,2 and
nuts (10) F50LN05-26 2 . Torque nuts 27 to 30 lb.in. (3.0-3.4 Nm).
Secure lower end of oil tube assembly (15) to outer bypass duct with two bolts (13). Torque bolts 20 to 30 lb.in. (2.2-3.4 Nm).

DO NOT LUBRICATE THREADS OF BOLTS (14). Secure oil tube assembly (15) to bracket on flange E with
loop clamp (11) F50LC07-02 2 ,
bolt (14) F50LB20-27 1 and nut (10). Torque nut 27 to 30 lb.in. (3.0-3.4 Nm).
Secure oil tube assembly (15) to bracket on pressure oil tube assembly with bolt (14) and nut (10). Torque nut (10) and nut (17) 27 to 30 lb.in. (3.0-3.4 Nm).
Secure loop clamp (33) of scavenge oil tube to bracket on the primary fuel tube (36) using bolt (34) and nut (35). Torque 27 to 30 lb.in. (3.0-3.4 Nm).

n-para.title: No. 4 Bearing Scavenge Oil Tube Assembly - AGB to Outer Bypass Duct

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove
nut (10) F50LN05-26 2 ,
bolt (13) F50LB20-37 F50LB20-38 2,2 and
loop clamp (19) F24LC07-01 1 .

Remove two
bolts (17) F24LB20-03 F24LB20-04 4,2 . Remove lockwire and remove two
bolts (22) F24LB20-02 2 and
scavenge oil tube assembly (20) F50LT17A09 1 .

Remove and discard preformed packings
(21) F24LP03-01 1 ,
(28) F41LP03-64 1 . Place protective covers on tube ends.

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Lubricate two new preformed packings
(16) F24LP03-02 1 ,
(21) F24LP03-01 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001) and install on
No. 4 bearing scavenge oil tube assembly (20) F50LT17A09 1 .

Install scavenge oil tube assembly (20) to boss on accessory gearbox and secure with two
bolts (17) F24LB20-03 F24LB20-04 4,2 , and to boss on outer bypass duct and secure with two
bolts (22) F24LB20-02 2 . Torque bolts (17) 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm), and bolts (22) 20 to 30 lb.in. (2.2-3.2 Nm).

DO NOT LUBRICATE THREADS OF BOLT (30). Install
loop clamp (19) F24LC07-011 1 on tube assembly (20) and secure to
loop clamp (32) F41LC07-12 1 with
bolt (30) F41LB20-16 1 and

n-para.title: No. 3 Bearing Scavenge Oil Tube Assembly

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove two
bolts (17) F24LB20-03 F24LB20-04 4,2 and
washers (24) F24LW03-01 2 , securing elbow (2) to boss on outer bypass duct.

Remove
elbow (25) F24LE01-01 1 and
transfer tube (27) F24LT17-01 1 as an assembly. Remove and discard preformed packings
(16) F24LP03-02 1 ,
(23) F24LP03-041 1 .

Remove
retaining ring (26) F24LR20-01 1 and separate
transfer tube (27) F24LT17-01 1 from elbow (25). Remove and discard preformed packing (16). Place protective covers on tube ends.

Remove lockwire and disconnect coupling nut on differential pressure switch tube assembly from
scavenge oil tube assembly (18) F50LT17A11 1 .
Remove four bolts (17) and scavenge oil tube assembly (18). Remove and discard preformed packing (16). Place protective covers on tube ends.

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Lubricate new
preformed packing (28) F41LP03-64 1 and install on
scavenge oil tube assembly (18) F50LT17A11 1 .

Install scavenge oil tube (18) on accessory gearbox and secure at two places with four
bolts (17) F24LB20-03 F24LB20-04 4,2 . Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Place
retaining ring (26) F24LR20-01 1 over
transfer tube (27) F24LT17-01 1 .

Lubricate two new
preformed packings (16) F24LP03-02 1 and install on transfer tube (27).

Install transfer tube (27) in
elbow (25) F24LE01-01 1 . Do not secure with retaining ring (26) at this time.

Lubricate new
preformed packing (23) F24LP03-04 1 and install on elbow (25).

Install elbow (25) on bypass duct boss and secure with two
washers (24) F24LW03-01 2 and bolts (17). Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).
Slide transfer tube (27) into scavenge oil tube (18) and engage retaining ring (26) in elbow (25).

Connect coupling nut of differential pressure switch tube assembly (Ref. 79-30-02) to tee connection of scavenge oil tube (18). Torque coupling nuts of tube 90 to 100 lb.in. (10-11 Nm) and lockwire (PWC11-021).

n-para.title: Inspection/Check
n-para.note: For periodic inspection refer to Chapter 5-20-00.

procedure.title: Scavenge Oil Tubes
procedure.step: Cracks - Cracked tubing must be replaced. No repair is permitted.

Scratches - Minor scratches having no appreciable depth are acceptable. Scratches to a depth of 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) must be blended out. Replace tubing with scratches over 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) inch deep.

Nicks - Individual nicks up to 0.062 inch (11.58 mm) long by 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) wide and 0.003 inch (0.08 mm) deep can be ignored. Nicks to a maximum depth of 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) must be blended out to remove sharp edges. Replace tubing with nicks greater than 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep.

Dents - Round bottom dents on straight sections of tubing are permitted provided the length and depth are not greater than 10 percent of the normal outside diameter of tube. No more than one dent to maximum depth per 12 inch (30.5 cm) length of tube is acceptable. Dents on tube bends, which cause restriction by flattening and local weakening, are not acceptable.

Pitting - Minor isolated pitting up to 0.003 inch (0.08 mm) deep is acceptable. Clusters of pitting should be blended out to a maximum depth of 0.005 inch (0.13 mm). Tubing must be replaced if pitting exceeds 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep.
Corrosion - Straining on tubing and surface corrosion is acceptable if removable by light polishing with crocus cloth and oil.

procedure.title: Scavenge Oil Tubes
procedure.step: Soak external oil tubing in cold carbon remover compound (PWC11-021) for two hours at room temperature.
Remove tube from solvent and pull a suitable sized swab (or lint-free cloth) through tube.
ENSURE NO PART OF SWAB OR CLOTH REMAINS IN OIL TUBE; OTHERWISE, OIL FLOW CAN BE RESTRICTED. Rinse tube exterior with petroleum solvent.
Pressure flush tube interior with petroleum solvent (PWC11-027) and dry interior and exterior with compressed air.

procedure.title: Bolt-Machine
procedure.step: Tighten bolts to a torque of 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1 to 4.5 Nm).

figure.title: Scavenge Oil Tubes - Fits and Clearances

Install protective caps and plugs on disconnected tubes, component openings and electrical connectors after disassembly.

procedure.title: Oil Tubes
procedure.step: Cracks - Cracked tubing must be replaced. No repair is permitted.

Scratches - Minor scratches having no appreciable depth are acceptable. Scratches to a depth of 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) must be blended out. Replace tubing with scratches over 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) inch deep.

Nicks - Individual nicks up to 0.062 inch (11.58 mm) long by 0.010 inch (0.25 mm) wide and 0.003 inch (0.08 mm) deep can be ignored. Nicks to a maximum depth of 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) must be blended out to remove sharp edges. Replace tubing with nicks greater than 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep.

Dents - Round bottom dents on straight sections of tubing are permitted provided the length and depth are not greater than 10 percent of the normal outside diameter of tube. No more than one dent to maximum depth per 12 inch (30.5 cm) length of tube is acceptable. Dents on tube bends, which cause restriction by flattening and local weakening, are not acceptable.

Pitting - Minor isolated pitting up to 0.003 inch (0.08 mm) deep is acceptable. Clusters of pitting should be blended out to a maximum depth of 0.005 inch (0.13 mm). Tubing must be replaced if pitting exceeds 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) deep.
Corrosion - Staining on tubing and surface corrosion is acceptable if removable by light polishing with crocus cloth and oil.

procedure.title: Oil Tubes
procedure.step: Soak external oil tubing in cold carbon remover compound (PWC11-021) for two hours at room temperature.
Remove tube from solvent and pull a suitable sized swab, or lint-free cloth through tube.
MAKE SURE NO PART OF SWAB OR CLOTH REMAINS IN OIL TUBE. OTHERWISE, OIL FLOW CAN BE RESTRICTED. Rinse tube exterior with solvent (PWC11-027).
Pressure flush tube interior with solvent (PWC11-027).
Dry interior and exterior with dry, compressed air.

general.para: Lubricate preformed packings, threads and mating surfaces with engine oil unless otherwise stated.
Install protective caps and plugs on disconnected tubes, component openings and electrical connectors after disassembly.

consumables.para: The consumable materials listed below are identified in procedural text.
Refer to INTRODUCTION for alternate products, suppliers and suppliers addresses.

procedure.title: Removal of Oil Pump Assembly (Ref. Fig. )

key.def: Pressure Adjusting and Cold Start Valve (Ref.)

procedure.step: Drain oil system (Ref. Chapter 72-00-00, ENGINE, SERVICING).
Remove EEC and lower electrical bracket assembly (Ref. Chapter 73-20-02, ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROL (EEC) - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES).

Remove two
bolts (3) A14LB20-05 1 ,
retaining plate (2) A14NP16-04 1 and slide
tube (15) A14LT17-04 1 into
oil pump (6) F41LP32A02 1 .

Remove four
bolts (12) F41LB20-08 4 ,
washers (11) F41LW03-03 4 and remove oil pump assembly (6).

Remove
transfer tube (5) F41LT17-04 1 and discard
preformed packing (4) F41LP03-17 2 .

Remove transfer tube (15) from oil pump assembly (6) and discard
preformed packings (14) A14LP03-04 2 .

Remove two
retaining rings (1) A14LR20-01 2 and withdraw
strainer element (17) A14LS51A02 1 from transfer tube (15).

If necessary, remove
nuts (10) F41LN05-03 2 ,
washers (9) F41LW03-02 2 ,
cover (8) F41LC28-02 1 and
preformed packing (7) F41LP03-09 1 . Discard preformed packing.

procedure.title: Installation Oil Pump Assembly (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Lubricate
preformed packing (7) F41LP03-09 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001), install on
cover (8) F41LC28-02 1 and install cover with
washers (9) F41LW03-02 2 and
nuts (10) F41LN05-03 2 . Torque nuts 23 to 26 lb.in. (2.6-3.0 Nm.).

Install
strainer element (17) A14LS51A02 1 in
transfer tube (15) A14LT17-04 1 with two
retaining rings (1) A14LR20-01 2 .

Lubricate
preformed packings (4) F41LP03-17 2 with engine oil (PWC03-001), install on
transfer tube (5) F41LT17-04 1 and install tube (5) into oil pump assembly.

Lubricate
preformed packings (14) A14LP03-04 2 with engine oil (PWC03-001), on transfer tube (15) and install tube (15) into main oil supply port of
oil pump assembly (6) F41LP32A02 1 .

Lubricate
preformed packing (16) F41LP03-10 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001), and install on oil pump assembly (6).
Install one guide pin (PWC64241-2) on the AGB at the oil pump bolt hole location. Use of assembly fluid is permitted to hold the guide pin in place.

DO NOT OVERHEAT MATING FACE OF AGB, AS THE PREFORMED PACKING MAY BE DAMAGED ON OIL PUMP ASSEMBLY.Set the dial of heat gun (PWC90000) to #3. Evenly heat the AGB bore in a circular motion for 5 to 10 minutes.

MAKE SURE THE SPLINED COUPLING SHAFT OF THE OIL PUMP ENGAGES WITH THE SCAVENGE PUMP INSIDE THE AGB.Align guide pin, transfer tubes (15 and 5) and coupling shaft to install oil pump (6) on the AGB. The starter shaft may require rotating to align with the coupling shaft.

MAKE SURE THE OIL PUMP SEATS COMPLETELY AND THE PREFORMED PACKING HAS NOT MOVED OR BECOME PINCHED BETWEEN THE AGB AND THE OIL PUMP.Remove the guide pin and install four
bolts (12) F41LB20-08 4 with
washers (11) F41LW03-03 4 . Torque bolts in a star pattern 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm.).

MAKE SURE THE TRANSFER TUBE IS FULLY SEATED IN THE INTERMEDIATE CASE.Push transfer tube (15) into the intermediate case and secure with
retaining plate (2) A14NP16-04 1 and two
bolts (3) A14LB20-05 1 . Torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm.).
Install the lower electrical bracket assembly and the EEC (Ref. Chapter 73-20-02, ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROL (EEC) - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES).
Replenish the oil system (Ref. Chapter 72-00-00, ENGINE, SERVICING).
Do the required engine checks following installation of the oil pump (Ref. 71-00-00, POWER PLANT - ADJUSTMENT/TEST). Adjust oil pressure as necessary.

procedure.title: Removal of PAV and Cold Start Valve (Ref. Fig. )

figure.title: PAV and Cold Start Valve - Removal/Installation

procedure.step: Drain the engine oil from the oil tank (Ref. 72-00-00, SERVICING).

Remove the two
nuts (9) F41LN05-04 2 , the two bolts (1) and the two washers (12). Remove the
valve cover (10) F41FC28-02 1 with puller (PWC43172).

Remove and discard
preformed packing (11) F41FP03-10 1 .
Remove PAV and cold start valve by turning assembly counterclockwise.

Compress
seat (7) F41FS16-01 1 and
spring (6) F41FS44-01 1 in the
valve (5) F41FV01-01 1 with compressor (PWC60831), and remove
retaining ring (8) F41LR20-05 1 , seat (7), spring (6) and valve (5) from the
sleeve (4) F41FS28-01 1 .

procedure.title: Installation of PAV and Cold Start Valve (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Assemble PAV and cold start valve as follows: Install
sleeve (4) F41FS28-01 1 in compressor (PWC60831). Install
valve (5) F41FV01-01 1 in sleeve (4) and position
retaining ring (8) F41LR20-05 1 in pusher arm of tool. Install
spring (6) F41FS44-01 1 with
seat (7) F41FS16-01 1 in valve (5), compress seat and spring and install retaining ring (8). Remove compressor (PWC60831).

Screw in PAV and cold start valve assembly into the
valve housing (3) F41LC28-01 1 in the oil pump cover until it seats lightly.
Adjust seating by turning the valve 1 turn counterclockwise.

Lubricate
preformed packing (11) F41FP03-10 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001) and install it on the
valve cover (10) F41FC28-02 1 .
Install the valve cover (10) with the two bolts (1), the two washers (12) and the two nuts (9). Torque bolts 27 to 30 lbf.in. (3.1-3.3 Nm).
Replenish engine oil (Ref. 72-00-00, SERVICING).
Do the required engine checks following installation of the PAV/cold start valve (Ref. 71-00-00, POWER PLANT - ADJUSTMENT/TEST). Adjust oil pressure as necessary.

n-para.title: Adjustment/Test
n-para.para: Refer to Chapter 71-00-00 for required checks following installation of the Oil Pump and PAV/Cold Start Valve.

Install protective caps and plugs on disconnected tubes, component openings and electrical connectors after disassembly.

row.entry: Cleaner, Contact Preservative and Conditioner Aerosol

procedure.title: Magnetic Chip Detector
procedure.step: Refer to 72-00-00, SERVICING.

procedure.title: Magnetic Chip Detector
procedure.step: Inspect flats and safety wire holes for excessive wear.
Examine internal and external threads for damage.
Check that electrical connector is securely swaged in housing.
Examine terminals of electrical connector; make sure terminals are clean, secure and undamaged and that potting compound is not cracked.

Before doing a continuity check after a chip detector fault code event or a chip detector event, clean the electrical pin and magnet area as follows, to make sure that the chip detector is free of any contamination: If the connection faces are dirty with oil or grease, use the petroleum solvent (PWC11-027) or the isopropyl alcohol (PWC11-014) and degrease the chip detector. With the soft bristle brush or cotton swab, loosen remaining oxides from the shell, between the electrical contact pins and at the magnet area. Clean the electrical contact pins, shell and magnet areas with sufficient cleaning solvent to flush out contamination. Use the petroleum solvent (PWC11-027) or the isopropyl alcohol (PWC11-014). Use clean, oil free compressed air or nitrogen (PWC05-050) at 30 psig (207 Kpa) maximum and make the chip detectors/collectors and valves dry. Do not let the solvent evaporate in the shell. The contaminants can be deposited again. Make sure that the contact pins and the shell are fully dry. Spray contact pins and connection shell with conditioner (PWC11-036).
Connect ohmmeter across detector output terminals and place suitable iron bar across magnetic poles. Circuit continuity must exist. Remove bar and check that open circuit is indicated.
Check that continuity resistance between each connector terminal and corresponding magnet is less than 0.5 ohms.
Check that insulation resistance between magnets and between either magnet and body is 10 megaohms minimum at 68°F (20°C).
Test magnetic poles using suitable steel weight. A minimum weight of six ounces must be lifted by the poles.
If components are unserviceable, the magnetic chip detector assembly must be replaced.

procedure.title: Valve Housing
procedure.step: Inspect flats and safety wire holes for excessive wear.
Examine internal and external threads for damage.
Examine valve and valve chamber for scoring or other damage.
Check that bent leg of spring is undamaged and retains spring in housing.
If components are unserviceable, the magnetic chip detector assembly must be replaced.

module.pageblock-title: OIL PRESSURE MEASURING SYSTEM - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES

general.para: Lubricate preformed packings, threads and mating surfaces with engine oil unless otherwise stated.
Install protective caps and plugs on disconnected tubes, component openings and electrical connectors after disassembly.

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )

key.def: Differential Pressure Switch Oil Tube Assembly
Differential Pressure Switch Air Tube Assembly

procedure.step:
Disconnect airframe connections from
oil tube assembly (8) F50LT17A23 1 ,
air tube assembly (11) F50LT17A16 1 and
switch (1) F50LS66-03 1 .

Remove
self-locking nut (14) F50LN05-10 1 ,
bolt (17) F50LB20-22 1 ,
self-locking nut (16) F50LN05-10 1 ,
bracket (15) F50LB40-21 1 and
loop clamp (18) F50LC07-22 1 .
Remove lockwire and disconnect coupling nuts (10 and 2).
Remove air tube assembly (11).

Remove
self-locking nut (12) F50LN05-10 1 ,
loop clamp (13) F50LC07-22 1 and washer (5).
Remove lockwire and disconnect coupling nuts (9 and 4).
Remove oil tube assembly (8).

Remove self-locking nuts
(3) F50LN05-10 1 and
(19) F50LN05-10 1 , switch (1) and two
spacers (5) F50LS33-05 2 .

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Position two
spacers (5) F50LS33-05 2 on
fuel filter housing (6) F41FH05A01 1 .

DO NOT LUBRICATE THREADS.Position
switch (1) F50LS66-03 1 on spacers (5) and fasten with self-locking nuts
(19) F50LN05-10 1 and
(3) F50LN05-10 1 . Torque 23 to 26 lb.in. (2.6-2.9 Nm).

Position
oil tube assembly (8) F50LT17A23 1 on switch (1). Tighten coupling nuts (4) and (9) with your hand.

DO NOT LUBRICATE THREADS.Position
washer (7) F50LS33-04 1 on fuel filter housing (6). Install
loop clamp (13) F50LC07-22 1 on oil tube assembly (8) with
self-locking nut (12) F50LN05-10 1 . Torque 23 to 26 lb.in. (2.6-2.9 Nm).
Torque coupling nuts (9) and (4) 90 to 100 lb.in. (10.2-11.3 Nm).

Position
air tube assembly (11) F50LT17A16 1 on switch (1) and tighten coupling nuts (10) and (2) with your hand.

Position
loop clamp (18) F50LC07-22 1 on air tube assembly (11).

DO NOT LUBRICATE THREADS.Install
bracket (15) F50LB40-21 1 on fuel filter housing (6) with
self-locking nut (16) F50LN05-10 1 . Torque 23 to 26 lb.in. (2.6-2.9 Nm).

DO NOT LUBRICATE THREADS.Install loop clamp (18) to bracket (15) with
bolt (17) F50LB20-22 1 and
self-locking nut (14) F50LN05-10 1 . Torque 23 to 26 lb.in (2.6-2.9 Nm).
Torque coupling nuts (10) and (2) 90 to 100 lb.in. (10.2-11.3 Nm) and install lockwire (PWC05-089).
Connect airframe connections to oil tube assembly (8), air tube assembly (11) and switch (1).

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove the electrical connector (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).
Cut lockwire of the two coupling nuts (3, 6) and disconnect the two ends of tube assembly from the transducer.

Remove the two mounting
bolts (5) F50LB20-56 2 ,
nuts (8) F50LN05-24 2 and
washers (9) F50LW03-21 2 from the bracket (1) on the intermediate case.

Remove the two mounting
clamps (4) F50LC07-09 2 and remove the
transducer (2) F50LS66-04 1 .

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Install the two mounting
clamps (4) F50LC07-09 2 and position the
transducer (2) F50LS66-04 1 on the mounting bracket (1). Secure with
bolts (5) F50LB20-56 2 ,
washers (9) F50LW03-21 2 and
nuts (8) F50LN05-24 2 . Torque nuts to 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Install the two coupling nuts (3, 6) on the transducer body. Tighten the nuts fingertight.
Torque two coupling nuts (3, 6) 90 to 100 lb.in. (10.0-11.5 Nm) and lockwire (PWC05-089).
Install the electrical connector (Ref. Aircraft Maintenance Manual).

general.para: Lubricate preformed packings, threads and mating surfaces with engine oil unless otherwise stated.

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )

figure.title: Oil Level Indicator Sight Glass - Removal/Installation

procedure.step:
Remove
bolts (4) F50LB20-23 9 .

25164 or 25206: Remove
cover (5) F50LC28-12 1 ,
gasket (6) F50LG03-07 1 ,
glass (3) F50LI08-01 1 ,
gasket (2) F50LG03-04 1 and
float (7) F50LB03-03 1 . Discard gasket (2) and gasket (6). Remove
oil level indicator reflector (1) F50LR15-01 1 .

25164 or 25206: Remove
cover (5) F50LC28-12 1 ,
gasket (6) F50LG03-07 1 ,
indicator (9) F50LI08-01 1 ,
gasket (2) F50LG03-04 1 and
float (7) F50LB03-03 1 . Discard gasket (2) and gasket (6).

25164 or 25206: Remove and discard
rivet (8) F50LR25-05 1 .

procedure.title: Installation (25164 or 25206) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Wipe a thin coat of assembly fluid (PWC06-011) on the surface of oil level indicator reflector (1, Fig. ) which is in contact with the oil filler neck assembly.

Install
reflector (1) F50LR15-01 1 and
float (7) F50LB03-03 1 .

Lubricate
bolts (4) F50LB20-23 9 with engine oil (PWC03-001) and install
gasket (2) F50LG03-04 1 ,
glass (3) F50LI08-01 1 ,
gasket (6) F50LG03-07 1 ,
cover (5) F50LC28-12 1 and bolts.
Torque bolts (4) in increments of 5 lb.in. (0.6 Nm) to a torque of 25 to 30 lb.in. (2.8-3.4 Nm) in sequence as shown (Ref. Fig. ).
Install lockwire (PWC05-089).

If lockwire holes do not align, do not loosen bolts. Torque bolt(s) to 30 lb.in. (3.4 Nm) maximum, and install lockwire. If bolts are loosened more than 10 lb.in. (1.1 Nm) gaskets (2 and 6) must be replaced.

procedure.title: Installation (25164 or 25206) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Insert the
float (7) F50LB03-04 1 through the oil exit opening in the oil filler neck. Make sure the float passes through the sight glass chamber into the throat area chamber.

25206: Secure the oil filler neck assembly in a bench vise with the sight glass opening facing up. Install the
rivet (8) F50LR25-05 1 at the location shown.

25206: Secure the assembly in a bench vise with the sight glass opening facing up. Install the
pin (10) F50LP04-13 1 at the location shown.

Install the
gasket (2) F50LG03-04 1 in the sight glass seat.

Install the
indicator (9) F50LI08-01 1 with the plain glass face out and the fluted face to the oil chamber.

Install
gasket (6) F50LG03-07 1 and
cover (5) F50LC28-12 1 with
bolts (4) F50LB20-23 9 .
Torque bolts (4) in increments of 5 lb.in (0.6 Nm) to a torque of 25 to 30 lb.in (2.8-3.4 Nm) in sequence as shown (Ref. Fig. ).

Install safety cable (PWC05-344). If safety cables holes do not align, do not loosen bolts. Torque bolts to 30 lb.in (3.4 Nm) maximum and install safety cable. If bolts are loosened more than 10 lb.in (1.1 Nm) gaskets (2 and 6) must be replaced.

procedure.title: Removal (25295) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove lockwire from
oil pressure indicator (4) F50LI08-02 1 .

Remove oil pressure indicator (4) from
housing (1) F50LH05-08 1 .

Remove and discard preformed packings
(3) F50LP03-16 1 and
(2) F50LP03-17 1 .

procedure.title: Installation (25295) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Check function of indicator (Ref. Testing).

Lubricate new preformed packings
(3) F50LP03-16 1 and
(2) F50LP03-17 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001) and install on
differential oil pressure indicator (4) F50LI08-02 1 .

Install oil pressure indicator (4) in
housing (1) F50LH05-08 1 . Tighten indicator 200 to 225 lb.in. (23-25 Nm) and install lockwire (PWC05-089).

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
25164 or 25206: Note position of
sensor (2) F50LS19-01 1 . Remove
bolts (3) F50LB20-15 2 and sensor.

25164 or 25206: Note position of
sensor (2) F50LS19-01 1 . Remove
bolts (3) F50LB20-15 2 ,
bracket (4) F14LB40-11 1 and sensor (2).

Remove and discard
preformed packing (1) F50LP03-12 1 .

procedure.title: Installation (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.caution: MAKE SURE OIL LEVEL SENSOR IS ANGLED TO REAR, APPROXIMATELY 25°, TO PREVENT CONTACT WITH AIRFRAME STRUCTURE.
procedure.step:
Lubricate new
preformed packing (1) F50LP03-12 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001) and install on the sensor (2).

25164 or 25206: Install
sensor (2) F50LS19-01 1 into the filler neck with
bolts (3) F50LB20-15 2 . Tighten bolts with fingers.

25164 or 25206: Install
sensor (2) F50LS19-01 1 into the filler neck with
bracket (4) F14LB40-11 1 and
bolts (3) F50LB20-15 2 . Tighten bolts with fingers.
Position sensor (2) in same position as that noted at removal. Torque bolts (3) 36 to 40 lb.in (4.0-4.6 Nm) and install lockwire (PWC05-089).

procedure.title: Operational Check (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Take note of the oil level in the sight glass.

With suitable test leads, connect an ohmmeter to pins A and B of the sensor (Ref. Fig. ). If the oil level can be seen in the sight glass, the sensor switch must read closed (0-1 ohms). The sensor switch can also read closed when the oil level is below the sight glass, if the oil level is above the height of the sensor switch.
Drain the oil tank (Ref. 72-00-00 ENGINE - SERVICING).
When the oil level falls below the sensor, the switch must change from closed to open (10 Megohms minimum).
Remove the oil level sensor (Ref. Para. ).
Connect an ohmmeter to pins A and B of the sensor, with the sensor in the installed position the switch must read open (10 Megohms minimum).

Turn the sensor over, in the inverted position the switch must read closed (0-1 ohms). Lightly tap the sensor in different directions, a sudden change in resistance (greater than 0.5 ohms) shows that the sensor is unserviceable.
Reject and replace the sensor if it is not satisfactory in all of the above checks.

procedure.title: Removal (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step: Remove oil level indicator (Ref. Para. ).
Remove oil level sensor (Ref. Para. ).

Remove
filler cap (1) F50LF07-01 1 . Remove and discard
preformed packing (2) 791196RP0301 1 .

25164 or 25206: Remove
bolts (7) F50LB20-24 2 and
bracket (6) F50LB40-17 1 that attaches the
filler neck (5) F50LF07A04 1 to intermediate case. Remove
bolts (4) F50LB20-53 2 that attaches the upper end of filler neck (5) to pressure indicator housing. Remove
bolts (8) F50LB20-29 2 that attaches the lower end of filler neck (5) to intermediate case. Remove filler neck (5). Remove and discard Preformed packings
(3) F50LP03-66 1 and
(9) F50LP03-14 1 .

25164 or 25206: Remove
bolts (17) F50LB20-53 2 ,
bolts (13) F14LB20-21 2 from
oil vent tube (12) F14LT17A12 1 . Remove
bolt (15) F14LB20-22 1 and
nut (16) F14LN05-09 1 and
loop clamp (14) F14LC07-04 1 . Remove oil vent tube (12). Remove and discard the preformed packings
(11) F14LP03-10 1 and
(18) F50LP03-66 1 . Remove
bolts (7) F50LB20-24 2 ,
bracket (10) F14LB40-06 1 and
bracket (6) F50LB40-17 1 . Remove
bolts (8) F50LB20-29 2 fastening lower end of
filler neck (5) F50LF07A04 1 from the intermediate case. Remove filler neck (5). Remove and discard
preformed packing (9) F50LP03-14 1 .

Remove
retaining ring (19) F50LR20-06 1 and
strainer element (20) F50LS51-04 1 .

procedure.title: Installation (25164 or 25206) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Install the
strainer element (20) F50LS51-04 1 and
retaining ring (19) F50LR20-06 1 in the
filler neck (5) F50LF07A04 1 .

Lubricate new preformed packings
(3) F50LP03-66 1 and
(9) F50LP03-14 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001) and install on each end of filler neck (5).
Install the filler neck (5) into its mounting points on the intermediate case and engage the upper end tube to the pressure indicator housing.

Install mounting
bracket (6) F50LB40-17 1 into the filler neck assembly (5) with
bolts (7) F50LB20-24 2 . Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install the bottom end of the filler neck with
bolts (8) F50LB20-29 2 . Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Lubricate new
preformed packing (2) 791196RP0301 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001), install on
filler cap (1) F50LF07-01 1 and install filler cap in oil filler neck (5).
Install oil level sensor (Ref. Para. ).
Install oil level indicator (Ref. Para. ).

procedure.title: Installation (25164 or 25206) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Install the
strainer element (20) F50LS51-04 1 and
retaining ring (19) F50LR20-06 1 in the
filler neck (5) F50LF07A04 1 .

Lubricate new
preformed packing (9) F50LP03-14 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001) and install on filler neck (5).
Install the filler neck (5) into its mounting points on the intermediate case and engage the upper end tube to the pressure indicator housing.

Install mounting
bracket (6) F50LB40-17 1 and
bracket (10) F14LB40-06 1 onto the filler neck assembly (5) with
bolts (7) F50LB20-24 2 . Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Install the bottom end of the filler neck with
bolts (8) F50LB20-29 2 . Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Make sure there is a minimum gap of 0.125 inches between the low oil level switch flange on the filler neck and the oil scavenge tube. This must be achieved with no adjustment to any other hardware other than those that can be achieved with bolt clearances. This minimum gap is only applicable when the oil filler neck is installed on the left-hand side of the engine.

Install new packings
(11) F14LP03-10 1 and
(18) F50LP03-66 1 on
oil vent tube (12) F14LT17A12 1 . Install vent tube (12) and secure with bolts
(13) F14LB20-21 2 and
(17) F50LB20-53 2 . Tighten the bolts with fingers.
Centralize the vent tube and torque the upper and lower bolts (13 and 17) 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm) and install safety cable.

Install
loop clamp (14) F14LC07-04 1 on vent tube at the location shown and attach with
bolt (15) F14LB20-22 1 and
nut (16) F14LN05-09 1 . Torque the bolt 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.0-4.6 Nm).

Lubricate new
preformed packing (2) 791196RP0301 1 with engine oil (PWC03-001), install on
filler cap (1) F50LF07-01 1 and install filler cap on oil filler neck (5).
Install oil level sensor (Ref. Para. ).
Install oil level indicator (Ref. Para. ).

procedure.title: Removal (25295) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove
nut (15) F50LN05-09 1 ,
bolt (14) F50LB20-17 1 and
clamp (13) F50LC07-03 1 from
bracket (12) F50LB40-20 1 at flange C.

Hold the
elbow (4) F50LE01-09 1 with a wrench, and remove the coupling nuts at end of tubes
(6) F14LT17A02 1 and
(2) F14LT17A02 1 .

Remove
bolts (3) F50LB20-21 2 fastening flange of tube (2) to intermediate case.

Remove and discard
gasket (1) F50LG03-08 1 .

Remove
bolts (8) F50LB20-19 2 fastening flange of tube (6) to
oil indicator housing (7) F50LH05-08 1 .

Remove and discard
preformed packing (5) F50LP03-66 1 .

procedure.title: Installation (25295) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Install
gasket (1) F50LG03-08 1 on
tube (2) F14LT17A02 1 . Attach tube (2) with 2
bolts (3) F50LB20-21 2 , leave the bolts loose.

Install
elbow (4) F50LE01-09 1 on tube (2), leave the coupling nut loose.

Install
packing (5) F50LP03-66 1 on
tube (6) F14LT17A02 1 . Attach tube (6) into the
oil indicator housing (7) F50LH05-08 1 and assemble the coupling end to the elbow, leave the coupling nut loose.

Attach tube (6) with 2
bolts (8) F50LB20-19 2 . Torque bolts 24 to 30 lb.in. (2.7-3.3 Nm) and lockwire.
MAKE SURE THE TUBES ARE NOT STRAINED DURING THE TORQUING PROCEDURE.Torque bolts (3) 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Torque coupling nuts on tube (6) and elbow (4) 90 to 100 lb.in. (10.1-11.2 Nm). Hold the elbow (4) with a wrench while torquing the coupling nuts.

Remove
bolt (9) B23NB20-26 22
washer (10) B23NW03-03 33 and
nut (11) B23NN05-41 14 . Install
bracket (12) F50LB40-20 1 and reinstall bolt (9) washer (10) and nut (11). Torque bolts to 27 to 30 lb.in. (3.1-3.4 Nm) again.

Install
clamp (13) F50LC07-03 1 to bracket (12) with
bolt (14) F50LB20-17 1 and
nut (15) F50LN05-09 1 . Torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

procedure.title: Removal (25295) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Remove two
nuts (8) F50LN05-09 B23NN05-41 2,14 , two
bolts (16) F50LB20-17 2 and two
loop clamps (3) F50LC07-03 2 from brackets
(5) F50LB40-10 1 and
(6) F50LB40-20 1 at flange C.

Remove two nuts (8), two
bolts (15) F50LB20-24 2 , two
washers (2) B23NW03-03 33 and brackets (5 and 6).

Remove bolt (16), nut (8) and loop clamp (3) from
bracket (4) F14LB40-06 1 .
Remove bolt (15) and bracket (4).

Hold the
elbow (13) F50LE01-09
with a wrench, remove the coupling nuts at end of vent tubes
(7) F14LT17A02 1 and
(10) F14LT17A02 1 and remove elbow.

Remove two
bolts (14) F50LB20-21 2 from flange of vent tube (10) at intermediate case.

Remove and discard
gasket (11) F50LG03-08 1 .

Remove two
bolts (1) F14LB20-21 2 from flange of vent tube (7) at oil filler neck. Remove vent tube.

Remove and discard
preformed packing (9) F14LP03-10 1 .

If necessary, Remove
filler cap cable (12) F50LC01-01 1 and
bolt (17) A14NB20-03 8 .

procedure.title: Installation (25295) (Ref. Fig. )
procedure.step:
Install a new
gasket (11) F50LG03-08 1 on flange of
vent tube (10) F14LT17A02 1 . Attach vent tube (10) and gasket (11) to the intermediate case with two
bolts (14) F50LB20-21 2 , tighten the bolts with your fingers.

Lubricate a new
preformed packing (9) F14LP03-10 1 with engine oil and install on vent tube (7).

Install
vent tube (7) F14LT17A02 1 on the oil filler neck with two
bolts (1) F14LB20-21 2 , tighten the bolts with your fingers.

Install
elbow (13) F50LE01-09
on vent tubes (7 and 10), tighten the coupling nuts with your fingers.

Install brackets
(5) F50LB40-10 1 and
(6) F50LB40-20 1 to front of flange C with
bolt (15) F50LB20-24 2 ,
washer (2) B23NW03-03 33 and
nut (8) F50LN05-09 B23NN05-41 2,14 . Torque bolts 27 to 30 lb.in. (3.1-3.4 Nm).

Install
bracket (4) F14LB40-06 1 with the short leg on the oil filler neck mounting bracket. Install
bolt (15) F50LB20-24 2 and torque 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).

Install
loop clamps (3) F50LC07-03 2 on brackets (4, 5 and 6) with
bolts (16) F50LB20-17 2 and nuts (8). Torque bolts 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1 - 4.5 Nm).
Torque the vent tube flange bolts (14) 36 to 40 lb.in. (4.1-4.5 Nm).
Torque the vent tube flange bolts (1) 24 to 36 lb.in. (2.7-4.1 Nm). Install safety cable (PWC05-344) or lockwire.

MAKE SURE YOU DO NOT PUT A STRAIN ON THE TUBES WHEN TORQUING.Torque the coupling nuts on vent tubes (7 and 10) 90 to 100 lb.in. (10.1-11.2 Nm) and install safety cable or lockwire . Support elbow (13) with a wrench while torquing the coupling nuts.

Attach
filler cap cable (12) F50LC01-01 1 to the engine mount pad with
bolt (17) A14NB20-03 8 . Torque bolt 425 to 475 lb.in. (48-54 Nm) and install lockwire.
